reviews.text: Come here for cheesecake. End up eating a days worth of calories before dessert, but the food is amazing.  It&#39;s hard to pick what you like because there&#39;s so much but all of the cheese cake flavors I&#39;ve ever had are good. Just make sure to hit the gym afterwords

We went back to Cheesecake Factory and were #2 in line!!! We arrived just as they were opening. And in two little women versus food...food won!!! Again the portions were huge! <br><br>The service was wonderful. The server was extremely friendly and very helpful. The rest of the staff was great as well. <br><br>This time I got the peach Bellini. It was very tasty. We shared the avocado egg rolls, a must have here, and the chicken parm pizza style, plus the s&#39;mores cheesecake. We came home with three more boxes. <br><br>It&#39;s still the best over here! Keep it coming Cheesecake Factory!

Let me start by saying it took me since Thursday to write this review.  I didn&#39;t want to write a bad review out of frustration and/or emotion.  <br><br>I have now decide to write my review and it will be fair and just.  My food and restroom experience at this location was awful.  I&#39;ll start with my 83$ total waste.  We ordered several items from the Happy Hour menu.  These items consisted of : pot stickers, fried macaroni and cheese, chicken sliders, avocado egg rolls, and fried cauliflower.   My husband was satisfied with the cauliflower and the chicken sliders.  We also order two slices of cheese cake (mango and the lemon raspberry) along with an order of chicken lettuce wraps to go.  <br><br>The avocado egg rolls had no flavor at all, the macaroni and cheese bites were cold in the inside, and the pot stickers were just full of shredded chicken no flavor or seasoning other than the dipping sauce.   The cheesecake and its crust was old and stale.  And the most saddest and disappointing part of our meal was the lettuce wraps.  When we got home and discovered that there was only one sliver of chicken per lettuce wrap, we were so angry.   We could not believe it.  We could not even compare it to a half of a half of a piece of a chicken nugget.  I was so upset, embarrassed, and angry all in one!! Nonetheless, the entire meal went straight in the trash!!<br><br>Now speaking of trash,, the ladies restroom was just that, trashed.  No paper towel to dry your hands.  Toilet paper on the floor, and one of the soap dispensers didn&#39;t work.  <br><br>I will not be returning to this location EVER AGAIN... And on Monday I will be calling their Corporate Office seeking a total refund.

Not the best cheesecake factory location. Service is meh, our waitress was not in a a good mood ha. <br><br>Seems like the food is heavier than other location. Cheesecake quality is still the same but food is meh. It is still a popular spot but you recommend you try other restaurant

I haven&#39;t been here since covid, but I&#39;ve had several good meals and I really wanted to put a spotlight on the last meal I ordered from here because I had tried something different that ended up being surprisingly flavorful and tasty while also healthier than the general fare at Cheesecake Factory. <br>Normally when I order here I&#39;ll get something like their pasta which is high calorie but my past visit I decided to go with the healthy option of the vegan Cobb salad and it was phenomenal!! I&#39;m not vegan but I have an appreciation for vegan dishes and this was certainly the best vegan dish I&#39;ve ever had at a national chain.  It was a super healthy mixture of veggies that was very filling, But not like the normal filling you get when eating here where you&#39;re miserable afterwards because you ate too much cheese!! Lol. <br>Of course as always I had to get a slice of cheesecake to go home with (very cherry ghiradelli is my fav) but at least I could feel better about having dessert since I didn&#39;t rack up so many calories beforehand.

Why do people wait so long for the Cheesecake Factory around here?  Maybe because they have been in Texas for decades, it is nothing new.  If there is a long wait, I just go to CPK and have some good food.  I never wait for this place.  So for those who are not familiar, the place has some good Cheesecake.  Have some.  The menu... the sheer number of items is an amazing feat.  I want to see how the kitchen works.  The food is good and if a person can&#39;t find something they want to eat, that is on them.  Now, because of this, some food is decent, some food is okay, and some menu items are really good.  This place isn&#39;t fine dining, it is friend dining.  <br><br>Décor: 3 out of 5<br>Food:  3 out of 5<br>Drinks: 4 out of 5<br>Service:  4 out of 5<br>Cleanliness:  4 out of 5

Food was delicious service was great and the wait was not that long! Everything was hot and fresh. With the Louisiana pasta make sure you ask for extra sauce because it&#39;s a little dry. Other than that everything was great!  The drink wax not strong at all!

This has been my favorite restaurant since 2016. We live 45 minutes away, so it is a commitment to come out this way. I&#39;m always excited to come here, but the last 2 times I&#39;ve been here, the service and food has been anything but stellar. The last time I came here, our appetizer came out after we had gotten our food. The server didn&#39;t even know because he never came to check on us during the whole dinner course. We also didn&#39;t get refills on our drinks so I went my whole meal without water. This time around, we sat outside and it took us about 10 minutes to even get greeted. The food was also only warm.<br>Overall, it seems like every time we come here, there&#39;s an issue. Whether it&#39;s the service, the 40 minute wait for our cheesecake or the food not being up to our expectations. There always seems to be something. They need to get more team members on the cheesecake/bakery area and also more kitchen staff to make sure our food isn&#39;t sitting while other items on the check are cooking. Just a thought!

I am giving this review based on my meal and based on the manager on staff when I did my pickup order.  My husband and I are in our mid 70&#39;s.  We do not go inside any stores  because of the Covid virus.  But we decided to do a curbside order at Cheesecake Factory.   I realize it was my poor judgment to order on a Saturday night.  (First mistake).  I tried ordering on line but wanted to pay with a gift card.  Couldn&#39;t find the way to pay that way. (Second mistake).  I called and asked if I could order a curbside pickup with a gift card. The person on the phone was clueless.  She took my order and told me it would be easy to pay at the front and get my food. (Third mistake).   I got there and it was packed with people waiting outside.  Many without masks.  I always wear a mask when near people.  I went into lobby and people were packed tightly together asking for a table.  I was very uncomfortable with that situation.  I asked the person at the desk where I could pay for my pickup.  They pointed to a line on the other side of the restaurant.  By then I was getting even more anxious.  I told the person I couldn&#39;t go into that crowd of people.  I was getting very upset and said that was not acceptable.  Luckily they called the manager over and he talked to me outside away from the crowd.  He took my gift card for my order and told me to get in my car and wait for it to be delivered.  Very nice and accommodating manager.  Food was yummy.  <br>Lesson learned for me.

The Cheesecake Factory decided to close there in door dinning a day earlier then the government mandated closure, BUT they did not bother to contact people that had reservations for the evening that they decided to close the day early. I drove an hour for a special occasion dinner to find out they closed early and never contacted the people that had reservations. When this place does open again I will NEVER give them my time and money since they couldn&#39;t take the time to let me know my reservation was no good..

Honestly I can&#39;t recommend anyone going here. I used to love the Cheesecake Factory. It was one of my favorite restaurants (delicious food, good service etc) but now it&#39;s totally changed. The service was ROUGH to say the least, the manager was straight up RUDE to my family  and the food was terrible . We had to send several plates back due to wrong orders and poor food quality. Our waitress even dropped her dirty napkin right on one of our plates Almost every person&#39;s meal was cold and just did not taste good. I understand there are regulations etc in place but really, why even open if that&#39;s the kind of experience you will give your customers. Hopefully one day they will get better staff and better management , then maybe I&#39;ll feel comfortable returning.

They had easy carry out service for covid and the food was grood. You know what you&#39;re getting when you go to CF: a well-prepared, but otherwise unremarkable meal. Except for the cheesecake! The cheesecake is always the move. I tried salted caramel and it was heeeeeaveeeeen

I have been much happier with my experience at this restaurant in the past than tonight.I wonder if it is the Covid condition and the difficulty many businesses are having with staffing and supplies.<br>We did not have to wait long to get a small booth towards the back of the restaurant. The waitress was a little delayed in getting to us.I was able to find the restaurant website and find menu online.We made plans to order some drinks and appetizers from happy hour menu before dinner. The waitress finally came to table and informed us we would have to be seated at the bar to order for happy hour. Revamped our order plans and was able to get bread butter and silverware.Drinks soon followed.<br>  We waited a while....dinner plates were delivered from a gentleman who would say &#34;yeah &#34; after he put each plate down? The sour cream for potatoes was forgotten.The A1 was not given either.We ate anyway while food was warm.The chicken da Vinci tasted bland and off.No onion or cheese I think.<br>The deserts were wonderful as always.<br>When we received the bill the salad we never got was on it.The waitress blamed others.She never got back with us to confirm we had everything.<br>The restaurant was not very busy with over half the tables closed for distancing.The take outs were substantial though.<br>The day after I posted this review I received a comment from restaurant to connect to website for questions.I don&#39;t have any questions to be answered?!I thought perhaps they were reaching out to me for information?<br>I did not see where I was to post it??
Shit service. Seriously waited 35 min for them to cut me up a slice of cake. Like wtf. I actually came here to pick up an order and they still butchered it.

Poor customer service, rude employees. My partner and I were racially profiled and treated poorly while attempting to place an order. Our business and money spent with the company was undervalued. The manager was very nonchalant about the behavior presented by his employees. I will never return here, I would recommend others seek establishments to endorse that are respectable and practice good customer service....

I went here for my friend&#39;s birthday brunch. It is a beautiful location and we didn&#39;t have to wait to be seated but it took nearly 2 hours to get a coffee and over an hour for them to take my food order. Half of our party&#39;s food has come out and been completely eaten while the rest of us sit around waiting for our coffee still. We all got here and ordered at the same time. I want to walk out but again, I&#39;m here for my friend. I can&#39;t tell you how the food is because I&#39;m still waiting for my food to come out. I will not be coming back and I see this type of report is not unusual. I&#39;m afraid to ask for new silverware because it will take another 2 hours to get it. <br><br>We were told our food was ready to come out from the kitchen about 20 minutes ago. We are still waiting though

Delicious lunch and our server Gabrielle was fantastic!!!<br>And at another visit we had Noah , who was also great! Kudos to all my sisters and brothers at the Cheesecake Factory in Novi given great service!

Cheesecake Factory is the kind of place where I sit down to the expansive menu and think &#34;ok, how am I getting diabetes and gaining 17# today?&#34;  And I&#39;m not even mad about it. We&#39;ve only eaten dinner here a few times, but it&#39;s always ridiculously delicious (and never healthy-do they have healthy options? Who knows, I&#39;m not there for my diet). Pretzel bites, fried Mac n cheese, fried cheese, pastas galore, and let us not forget the almighty cheesecake. Available in, what I assume, are 95 flavors. Every single one is delicious. And they have items on their menu from every genre I think. There&#39;s Italian, Mexican, American, Chinese, oh my. <br><br>Service is always slow (even if you&#39;re just picking up a cake) and there is always a wait I think, but it&#39;s just because everyone loves it and everything is done right, so it takes longer. I mean, I&#39;m paying $60 for a cheesecake and I&#39;m smiling about it, so obviously they are doing something right. <br><br>If you haven&#39;t been, if you haven&#39;t tried their cheesecake, go. Right now, stop what you&#39;re doing, and eat your weight from the Cheesecake Factory.

I would not recommend the Lunch Fettuccini Alfredo. I ordered it via Door Dash pickup on Sunday, March 22nd; and the pasta was bland! It was just a bunch of oily, greasy noodles. I had to go back inside and ask for an extra cup of sauce; which caused me to be late for work. Even with the extra sauce, that didn&#39;t make it creamy enough. When I got to work, I had to douse my food with hot sauce, salt, and pepper, just to give that doughy pasta some taste. Ultimately, I ended up throwing the last of it out. I hate wasting food, (especially when it&#39;s expensive) but I couldn&#39;t pretend to like it anymore.

Very unorganized for a pickup despite having 6 people behind the counter. No one to direct where to pickup nor tell what the hell happened to my order. Except for one or two staff members who over perform 80% of the staff are basically useless and requires a lot of training about customer service because they seem to not care whatsoever

The food, especially the bread and cheesecake, are easily 4 stars; however, we went to the Novi location a few days ago and the experience was lacking.  We waited a bit to be seated, which was fine, but we spent maybe 3 hours for a meal that should have been about a 1 hour ordeal.  Food was slow to come out with every order and silverware was dirty and had to be exchanged.  We also brought the kids, and it was a bit rough for then to sit so long.<br><br>We got a few chicken dishes, which were all pretty good.  Two of us thought it was good, but a bit salty.  We ordered some cheesecake at the end and I believe it took 45 minutes to get to us.  I have no complaints about the staff, but I would think things would move faster to keep throughput up for tips and revenue.  <br><br>I want to like this place more, but it&#39;s just so slow.  This was maybe my third time there and it was by far the longest.  Next time I probably would stop in for a milkshake or grab cheesecake to go, but I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be seated for a meal anytime soon.

I make it to this location every now and then, so I finally decided to write a review. I had a great experience on Friday afternoon. I brought my laptop in to complete some work while dining with my mom. The hostess was nice enough to sit us at a larger table because she noticed I was working. <br><br>Also, our server was extremely nice and very witty! She made sure we were taken care of and checked on us frequently. <br><br>The food was standard CF food, made to order. We enjoyed our meal and even took advantage of their happy hour specials on apps. Didn&#39;t get any cheesecake, but the guy next to us ordered a Oreo one that looked amazing!

The Cheesecake Factory has been my favorite restaurant since 2016. The restaurant and its ambiance are nice, the food is always delicious. But the servers, are a hit or miss. Some servers are wonderful and always coming to refill drinks or ask you what you like/need, while some servers seem to not care. Which I understand, I am a server as well, but that doesn&#39;t mean you make rude comments or rarely come back to the table. I went here on August 22nd, which happened to be my birthday, and our server Tilly was wonderful. Very upbeat and informal, yet still professional. I ordered the shrimp scampi and a pineapple mojito, both were delicious. My husband ordered a steak hibachi which he loved. We left with six cheesecakes to go. Great service. <br><br>A month later, which is the day after I went that I&#39;m making this review, I went for my two year anniversary. A Friday night at about 6pm, we were seated right away. I ordered a raspberry mixed drink and lemon garlic shrimp from the skinnylicious menu. Wonderful flavors. Both were great. Again, my husband ordered the steak hibachi which was just as great as the first time. Steak was perfectly medium rare, mashed potatoes with great texture and flavor, and the tempura green beans are addictive! What made my review four stars rather than five, was our server. She did not even give us her name. Her profile was on the taller side, a bit chubbier, maybe 30&#39;s Caucasian women. She appeared to have only three other tables, but didn&#39;t seem to want to provide good service. When I ordered my cocktail she asked for my ID, which is fine, but upon looking at the date, she scoffed and said &#34;barely&#34;. I was very offended and taken aback. Barely what? What was the point in making a comment like that? The rest of the dinner she only came to refill drinks and gave the bill. I hope I never have her again as a server. Like I said most times I have great servers, but every once in a while I get those servers that seem like they hate their job, it&#39;s fine if you do, just don&#39;t take it out on the customers. I&#39;m not a high maintain customer and I always leave 18% gratuity regardless of whether I enjoyed my service or not. I just don&#39;t favor the inconsistency with servers.

If I could give less than one star I would. Service was good but the food....I&#39;d rather eat a bowl of hot roadkill with sprinkles of chopped up spiders instead. It&#39;d probably have more flavor than what I tasted. I&#39;d rather eat some fresh off the toilet ASS than eat some of the flavorless carbonara they have. They need to bring their menu of a good 100 dinner items down to a good 10. Trying to reach all varieties and cultures like there the damn corona virus. Well I&#39;ma treat them like they have it. Stay away from Cheesecake Factory. They serve hot ASS on a plate with a side of ASS

Just wanted to say that I picked up my carry out order today during lunch and even though they were very busy with carry outs, management was on top of everything! Not only taking care of the in-house carry outs but as I was leaving he was delivering them to a vehicle for curbside pickup. I wish I would have caught his name to give him a shoutout. <br>Got the food home and everything was delicious!<br>We ordered the lunch deals pepperoni pizza, salad and chicken broccoli, both came with cheesecake  and of course the wheat and sourdough bread!<br>Between the price and how great the food was I can&#39;t wait to get carry out lunch again!!!!

Awesome avocado spring roll. Other than that, there are a few improvements need to be done.<br>1. Quality control<br>2. Easy side entrance (for waiters)<br>3. Busboy/busgirl and waiter ratio<br><br>My penne dish was uncooked. A chunk of green plastic found in my mash potatoes. The tip of the string beans werent nip. <br><br>Waiters need to push the handicap push button to get back. The problem is, it is a very slow moving automatic doors.<br><br>Table wasn&#39;t clean properly, the hostess needs to clean them.<br><br>Overall, I believe management can improve their consistency in food and service.

Made reservations at 9:15. Waited from 9:00-9:25 for my name to be called and at 9:25 when I got frustrated I walked up to the front. The lady at the front proceeded to tell me that I needed to wait like everybody else because I&#39;m 5 min past my &#34;Pager getting&#34; time. Definitely a waste of time to reservations here.

I know I know it&#39;s a chain. But having only ever dined at CF on holiday. I have a lot of fond memories associated with the place.<br>I&#39;m just such a sucker for a good sauce, and they&#39;ve got sauce on lock here. The dipping sauce for the chicken samosa and the sauce that accompanies the firecracker salmon rolls are among my favorite flavors in existence. So freakin yum.<br>I also dig the heck out of their wheat bread. <br>This location was running a two-hour wait when we arrived, but I spotted some people with a to-go container up at the bar so I figured they were cashing out and we cashed in and scored a spot in less than 5 minutes. Rockstar status.

1st.off- Kiera our waitress had to easily be amongst the best server I have had. She knew the entire menu and was smiling and kept checking on everything. Finally made it here, after having a gift card for a few years. Afternoon late lunch/dinner- no wait - yea!. Shared a chicken mango salad and Louisiana chicken pasta. Large portions and delicious. Fresh bread served was also very good. Good as it was - just don&#39;t think I would wait a few hours on a busy night. Takeout piece of salted caramel cheesecake was devoured in the evening- was good !

Had advance reservations for a special family dinner out tonight celebrating my son&#39;s 20th birthday and daughter&#39;s 16th birthday. Even got the confirmation text and confirmed my res for 7pm. We all rushed to get out of work on time and drive the 32 mins to get to the restaurant only to find out that they decided to go &#34;take-out&#34; only a day ahead of the new 3 week &#34;pause.&#34; How frustrating to then try to find a place that will take a party of 6 at the last minute so we didn&#39;t have to wait til 8:30 to eat dinner! Restaurants were packed because this is our last night out til probably sometime in 2021. Why did Cheesecake Factory have to close a day early and then not bother to notify those of us who had reservations? Ridiculous and rude!

I wish The Cheesecake Factory would take reservations because I, along with my 5 friends waited for 2 hours before we were finally seated. We arrived at 5:09 pm and did not expect the place to be so busy. However, I will not dock this location for such a wait, this issue is a corporate one.<br><br>Moving on, our waitress was great and we tipped well. There were a few mishaps but the blame belongs on the kitchen and also the picky eaters of the group lol. Our bread was always warm when delivered, and our food was delivered hot. I did not order cheesecake because I am lactose intolerant, but my friends stated that it was delicious. <br><br>In sum, you will be served well here and this place receives my stamp of approval. But, go when they are least likely to be busy.

Made a reservation on Yelp on Monday for a Friday Reservation. On Friday at 5:45 they texted me telling me my reservation at 7 wasn&#39;t going to be possible because their indoor dining wasn&#39;t available until July 22nd. Very unprofessional. I would have appreciated a response about the restaurant not being opening for dining days before my reservation instead of an hour.

From the moment we walked in the door it was a bad experience. The hostess was rude...anyways we were told a 50 min wait....we 30 mins we&#39;ll over that. When I spoke to hostess she said you&#39;ve been waiting 18 mins...ummm no. We then spoke to a manger and he was very very rude and defensive. Said he&#39;d find us a seat....took about 10 mins. As he was taking us to a table we passed about 5 open tables. The restaurant was a mess, watched a buzzer wipe food on the table, touch his fingers on the tops of forks/spoons. Service was good, food was good. Took my leftovers home which was the cauliflower bites and when I re-heated them the next day there was chunks of chicken....being a vegetarian that&#39;s disgusting. Just a bad disappointment all around unfortunately.

The food was really good. 0 complaints on the dinner. Some people at our table ordered cheesecake and it took 30+ minutes to get it. If we had known that, we wouldn&#39;t have got any. <br><br>What irked me was our server was only full of excuses and was kind of argumentative trying to justify the wait time. She didn&#39;t send a manager to the table either and the couple we were with was pretty upset.

Cheesecake Factory never seems to let me down! I usually only order the same thing off the menu, everytime I do come here to eat! That&#39;s the shrimp w/angel hair. This time I tried something different. Bistro shrimp pasta. Pasta was very good! I definitely couldn&#39;t finish it all. The staff here is pretty on their toes. Our waiter was great and attentive!

Family surprised me with significant birthday celebration and while family went here for lunch on a Saturday.  There were five kids and six adults. <br>It felt like forever for food to come but it was hard entertaining little ones. All foods were good.  Daughter ordered quesadilla which was on appetizer list.  It is very small.<br> Cheesecakes Id suggest split them and share. <br>All were good.  Cinnamon roll scored highest. <br>Second was Oreo cookie.<br>We had never been to a cheese cake<br>Factory.

I might get some people in disagreement with a 4-star rating, but despite the trend that Cheesecake isn&#39;t as good or great as it once was, it is still quite good. They still make most of their items at each location, they roll each egg roll and they do have the most awesome cheesecakes!! They are some of the best and the variety is second to none. <br><br>This location is not as consistent and grand as others. The service is hit or miss. I also palpate a vibe that the customer-first attitude does not translate to each table nor each visit. Even on this occasion, we moved tables and subsequent servers and the second server we had was so much better than the first.  We were glad we moved, we wanted to sit outside and the person that took care of us was great. <br><br>We had some unique and delicious meals, stand outs were the buffalo chicken, the fried zucchini, the crab bites and the flavor and tenderness of the piccata was so good. The sauce, on the other hand, was very heavy-handed with butter, which turned to grease.  The fettuccine was just ok. <br><br>I like Cheesecake, not a frequent stop, but still enjoyable.  We all know it&#39;s pricey, but the concept still provides an experience.

I have wanted to try to Cheesecake Factory ever since I watched the first season of the Big Bang Theory ... but this was the first time I managed to get over there. I know, it&#39;s a chain and most people have probably been there, but it has never been conveniently close to my home. Today, my Mom wanted to go, so my brother and I went with her.<br><br>It was busy and we waited a long time for a table. With more than 250 items on the menu, I was worried about their lack of focus. (Typically, places with fewer dishes execute those dishes better than places with too many disparate options).<br><br>Once seated, I ordered the cafe mocha, which was actually really good. The chocolate and coffee flavors were good and it wasn&#39;t too sweet.<br><br>Then, the bread and butter came. I enjoyed the bread, especially the brown bread, but I have had better. Much better. Still, the little oats on top of the loaf were a nice touch.<br><br>To eat, my Mom and I ordered the fish tacos and the baja chicken tacos and then shared them. Both had a lot of flavor and were pretty good, but neither was the best version (of that particular style) that I had ever had.<br><br>My brother ordered the roadhouse sliders and fries. I didn&#39;t try the burgers, but my brother and my Mom both enjoyed them. I did try the fries, however, which were pretty decent. I wish they were a little crispier and little less salty, but they were good.<br><br>We all ordered cheesecake, obviously, for dessert. We ordered the chocolate tuxedo cream, the chocolate hazelnut crunch, and the coffee &amp; cream supreme. All three were good, but the three of us couldn&#39;t agree which was the best (we all had a different favorite). I thought the chocolate tuxedo cream had the most flavor.<br><br>Finally, the service was good. It was a little slow, but they were busy and our server was still training. She was all smiles, though, and asked us pertinent questions (such as &#34;would you like fries with that?&#34;)

Had dinner on Nov 3rd about 6pm, well we was suppose to at least. We ended up waiting for over 1 1/2 hours for our entrees to come out. When the food finally came out it was cold and when we spoke to the manager about it his response was, &#34;well do you want me to have the kitchen reheat&#34;. <br>We had to wait another 40 minutes for them to remake the food at that point we had them package it to go. Once they brought me the bill they had over charged us for ours entrees and that took another 35 minutes. I reached out to the General Manager and he never responded then I tried reaching out to the corporate customer service department and still haven&#39;t received a response. Overall It was a bad and disappointing experience.
We went for dinner today for the first time in a couple of years. The food and service were outstanding! We will be back!

I just spent $81 for dinner on my husband and I and the service and food were terrible. It&#39;s a Wednesday so they were not super busy but we didn&#39;t get the wonderful experience that we&#39;ve had on the past, unfortunately.

We went today for my girlfriend birthday.  Food was good, we ordered the steak diane and cheeseburger egg rolls and the fried cauliflower. Our waiter was great. For dessert we had the pineapple upside down cheesecake cake and it was delightful. Would go back

Usually a tradition on the kids birthdays to go there for cheese cake.  This place just gets worse and worse.  Friday 2:30pm , non prime hours.  1hr 40min, for one grilled chicken sandwich, fries, bowl of luke warm chili and appetizer.   Couldn&#39;t wait, had to get cheese cake to go.  Two slices, (you know the price) and we get small slices at that.  Other tables big huge pieces, ours on the small side!  <br><br>Two stars is generous but for what we ordered and 65 dollars? I can waste my cash at better places.  Last I go there!

Myself, two other adults and two children dined in at 3pm Sunday. It was my first time at this location. Wait time was about 15 minutes. Once seated our server Justin came over. He was training someone else as well. It took our table about 20 minutes to decide and Justin was very patient with us. <br><br>Recommendation by Justin I ordered the &#34;chicken littles with mashed potatoes and succotash&#34; i asked if I could have the chicken tenders dipped in buffalo sauce. These were some of the juiciest and tender chicken bites I ever had. The potatoes were delicious but the corn was terrible. <br><br>My diner companions had Truffle Honey Chicken with succotash. the wife had Parmesan Herb Chicken. They both said their meals were very tasty. For the kids 1 pasta with white sauce and an apple juice.<br><br>There was an error with the Truffle Honey Chicken, the kitchen didn&#39;t put the order in. So we had to wait an extra 15 minutes for it to come out. Justin offered a chicken soup for the wait.<br><br>We had 3 strawberry cheesecakes to go. 92.96$ PLUS 15% tip 107$<br><br>I&#39;ll certainly be back!

On Sunday September 14th My wife and daughter attempted to go to the cheesesteak cake factory today as a party of two and they were told by the hostess that there would be a 15 minute fine. After 15 minutes they started noticing people coming in after them getting seated before them groups of 4 3 5 7 etc. They saw that their name to be picked up and for them to be seated was always put to the side while the server would grab another ticket and seat the people. <br><br>Finally they complained and the manager should that he could care less that they were upset. He actually was more than a little degrading to them in his handling of the situation. <br><br>I would NEVER recommend anyone go to this place if this is how they treat customers. When my wife said they will just have to write the corporate office he practically dared them to do it.

Always a great place to be. The cheesecakes are the best. But I have never really liked the service here. Basically the cheesecakes always take a long time to come out. However this time out server was really hot and cold. He started out well getting our order and bringing the drinks (still slow). But then it just went downhill he forgot that we had empty water glasses and forgot to fill them. He was gone for most of the time not showing up to ask us how things were. I had to ask for boxes in the end twice. The only thing he was really quick and prompt about was the bill in the end. <br>It&#39;s never been a great experience for dine-in at this place and a cheesecake to-go is the only option (if I can wait for 10-15min).

I love The Cheesecake Factory!  I&#39;ve been to different locations: Atlanta; Chicago; and Las Vegas.  I was excited 5 years ago when I learned about a new location opening up in Novi, Mi.  I&#39;ve been to the location probably 3 times now.  <br><br>I&#39;ve never had any complaints about this particular location.  I&#39;ve never dined in though, so I can&#39;t speak on the customer service and dining experience, as I&#39;ve only ordered carry out orders.<br><br>Before I ordered slices of cheesecake, which were all very delicious!  The carrot cake slice, dulce de ledge, and pineapple upside down were very good!<br>Today I ordered dinner for carry out.  I ordered the Spicy Korean Cauliflower with the sweet and spicy sauce on the side (I love fried cauliflower), and I ordered the dinner portion of Orange Chicken.  Both huge portions, and very good!  I will have leftovers for tomorrow!  <br><br>If the restaurant wasn&#39;t so far from where I live, I&#39;m sure I would dine in, and frequent more often.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Been here a few times there&#39;s always a long wait. Came today and was told it was a40-50 minute wait. We get a text saying our table was ready, we come to the hostess stand and they say they can&#39;t find our reservation, but they put us into the table that they were cleaning off outside. They then moved the people that were waiting in line when we originally checked in behind us to that table. Waited an hour original&#39;s and now we&#39;ve waited another 35 mins. Unacceptable!

First time here since we were in the area at 12 Oaks and we loved everything we had. I ordered from the &#34;skinny&#34; menu where they offer three pages of lower calorie meals but they still tasted really good - you would never know! I heard they change their menu a lot, but see below our options and I hope they keep them longer!

Definitely did not choose a good day to go (Saturday night). Our 50-70 minute wait turned into 90+ minutes. The crowd was absolutely ridiculous. People were upset and frustrated and the staff did not do a great job of calming them down. After being seated, we had a decent experience with our waiter. <br><br>Our appetizers (spinach and cheese dip and the Korean cauliflower) were delicious! I would highly recommend both. As for our main entrees, not so much. We had ordered a few custom pastas and even tho everyone&#39;s sauces were the same, each plate had a different colored sauce. <br><br>After all the wait and the inconsistent food, I don&#39;t think I&#39;d go back on a weekend ever again.

Kristina W was amazing! And the manager Michelle! We mentioned that we worked at a Cheesecake Factory in Atlanta and she came by just to say hi. Overall just a wonderful experience! Food was great and we got everything we asked for/needed. Thanks again ladies!

I had the worse experience ever . First we waited 45 min for the food to come and than they had the order wrong . The service was horrible too ,my server she came to the table 3 times the rest was someone else even the check someone else got it for me . I couldn&#39;t wait to get out of there . One thing is for sure I am not going to go back neither I am going to recommend this place to anyone .

Amazing food and great cheesesteak. This is all in Naples, Florida but I&#39;m sure they all have the same food on their menu! The steak Diane is amazing but very small, chicken Madeira is delicious! I submitted my mashed potatoes for fries. The salmon salad is to die for! I already tried recreating that recipe at home with no luck. Can&#39;t wait to go back and get the same salad. The tacos were just okay, the beans that came with the meal were very bland, no salt to them.

On this visit the snack menu caught my eye- - -<br>Especially the Korean fried cauliflower. I got it and it was delicious and a lot to eat--great spice and tender cauliflower. Also got a Cuban sandwich that was very good. My wife got the French country salad and loved it <br>The kitchen was a little slow, but Rachel did great job for us.

I see a lot of complaints about no reservations on this restaurant when other cheesecake factory locations offer it. I live 30 minutes away from the restaurant so it was very disappointing to go on a Sunday around 3pm to find out it was a two hour wait. Luckily the pagers are gone, but still, what I was going to do in 2 hours other than going back home? Why is there no reservation option if so many people complain about it? We were not going to wait so we went to Sedona who only had 15 minute wait and then I ordered online a Caramel Apple Cheesecake to go from Cheesecake Factory and then I grabbed it on my way out. Traveling back to my home I got the text that my table was ready...

3.5 Stars. Cheesecake Factory has one of the largest menus you will ever see. Having to to decide on one item is a challenge . For the most part the food is solid at this location. Most recently had the miso glazed salmon with brown rice. It was very tasty but also very buttery like most dishes here. Any cheesecake on the menu is a great option. Service at this location is also hit or miss depending on the night . My other fav dish is the crispy chicken costelleta. My fav cheesecake is dulce con leche

As you may or may not know, Saturday evenings are busy. We arrived around 8:30 with an hour wait. We anticipated a wait, so we killed 30 min. walking around the mall. However, when our buzzer went off, the hostess explained that in haste, it was accidental and there was actually NOT a table ready. So we wait, yet again, for an additional 10 minutes for a free table. Not a good start. <br><br>Our waiter was Pete. He was great. We were well taken care of. However, I do feel as if the kitchen was on overdrive. They were out of the shrimp platter. But the suggestion by Pete was superb and the Jamaican Black Pepper shrimp was ordered. That is an entree worth ordering again as long as it is prepared in the same way. Unfortunately, the 2nd entree was not nearly as successful. From the skinnylicious menu, the Grilled Steak Medallions was ordered, hold the mashed potatoes and Madeira wine sauce. I wanted to replace it with rice and corn. I wanted to KEEP the asparagus, mushrooms, and sautéed tomatoes that came with it. Instead, initially, I only received the rice and corn--no other veggies. Pete was quick to bring the other veggies. However, it was onions and peppers! Where are my mushrooms, asparagus and tomatoes?! I ate some of the Jamaican shrimp meal and packed my meal to go. After 2 hours, I was defeated and could not go back and forth any longer. <br><br>We also ordered a slice of red velvet cheesecake to go. That&#39;s what you come for, right?! It did not disappoint. <br><br>The 3 stars  are for the great service from Pete (more like 4!) He, along with the Jamaican Hot pepper shrimp, and cheesecake saved this review from 2 stars.

If you want crappy service this is the place to go.  After a 90 minute wait,which we willing did, we finally got called our table, waited another 20 minutes to be seated. Others, turning in their pagers with darker skin tone were seated before us. Then we get to our table only to wait for a server to show which never happened. When we asked we were told, quite nasty, that it would be a few minutes. While the manager went over to a table to satisfy another table we pale skin customers were again ignored. It seems if you&#39;re not of the darker skin tone you&#39;re ignored at this store. I&#39;ll stick with the Cheesecake Factory in Philly.  More organized and no favoritism

Let me tell you something.... DON&#39;T SKIP THE SALADS!!!<br><br>Please.... Please... BABY PLEASE try one of their fancy salads.  Now you know I love to be greedy but I couldn&#39;t finish this salad to save my life.  I would suggest maybe getting another dressing - it comes on the side but it won&#39;t be enough and you&#39;ll want to take some home.  <br><br>Of course I had to try some of the speciality cheesecakes which I took to go - if you&#39;re here don&#39;t be that person who gets the traditional, simple, and boring flavor.  THINK BIGGER!!!<br><br>Happy Eating!!!<br><br>Sidenote - I really wished I took a picture of the salad.  Now I&#39;m going to back into my phone to see if I did and if not, then i&#39;ll have to recreate this day.
Such a variety and excellent cheesecake. I generally get the salad that is vegan and it&#39;s amazing being a non-vegan! Try it out.
The steak was delicious.<br>Not a huge fan of the chicken madeira, though.

Love the food at Cheesecake Factory...and generally rate their other sites much higher. Trouble with the novi restaurant is that they are very busy and have allowed the staff to behave as if they really do not care whether you wish to dine there or not. The wait staff are really not bad...but try calling the restaurant any time near dinner or even later in the evening and you&#39;ll likely be met with an &#34;accidental&#34; hang up. First time it happened, I assumed it was a fluke...2nd, 3rd and beyond, it&#39;s clearly an accepted practice when they feel too busy to answer the phone. <br>For what it&#39;s worth, we like the food enough that we&#39;ve actually ordered take out from them a few times. Not great but pretty decent for carry out.<br>Was hoping that they would get better with time but after being hung up on yet again last week, I think we&#39;ll forget about Cheesecake Factory here in Novi for a while!

I am only giving this place 2 stars because their cheesecake is delicious. I would solely come back to get takeout cheesecake. Also the server we had was polite and very courteous. <br><br>Where to start on the negative. Well prepare to wait 1.5-3 hours for a table. That would be fine if the food was good. We started with the Mac and cheese balls. I would say not a bad appetizer. One to get if want an app. <br><br>Entrees were terrible to say the least. My husband got the steak Diane and shrimp scampi combo. He asked for steak medium rare. It was closer to well done. Tasted more like diner food for a premium price. I got the filet mignon. Awful. No seasoning. No flavor. And burnt.  For the price it should have at least tasted ok. I hate to send food back but I did. The manager came over and I explained the steak. He looked confused and out of sorts. Like what should I do? I asked for another steak. My next steak was better but still not great. Was just happy to have food that didn&#39;t taste terrible. <br><br>The lady next to me got a steak. Complained it tasted like it had been sitting out. And ended up leaving a $1 for tip for herself and 3 other people who ate their food. So maybe the cooks don&#39;t bother because so many people try to get free comps anyway. Who knows. <br><br>I really only came here because we had gift cards and still spent $60 with tip (I tip on the original amount not the discount total). Wasn&#39;t our waiter&#39;s fault the food was bad. This place is totally over hyped for what you get. Stick with just their cheesecakes.

Wow, I&#39;m soooo annoyed with this place! The apps, specifically the fried Mac and cheese and Tex mex egg rolls were actually very good but my meal was a total let down. I ordered the Louisiana pasta and it was so salty it was unbearable. After a few bites I had enough and just nibbled on the chicken that it came with. I had almost the entire meal left and got it boxed to go as I hate food waste. We had three entrees wrapped up to go and when the waitress boxed them up she places them SIDEWAYS in the bag and all of the sauce ended up spilling out of them and all over the boxes and the bag.<br><br>We ended up throwing out all of the carryout because what a mess everything turned into. For $90 for LUNCH I expect them to know how to at least pack a to-go bag! So pissed about our experience

Can I suggest to the management team that instead of writing generic responses to these reviews that you actually do something about the pathetic level of service that you&#39;re offering. Your customers are telling you that they aren&#39;t coming back because your team lacks empathy. Something is very wrong in your kitchen. You could write better schedules and your team does not seem to be happy.<br><br>What are you doing about those things? Instead of saying that you You&#39;re sorry and hope they come back. Do something to ensure that they come back. One thing you must do is fix your service problems. If you don&#39;t the next manager will.<br><br>Asking me to contact you through some generic platform doesn&#39;t float the boat either. Clearly, a company that just doesn&#39;t understand the customer service piece. The customers have given you the answers to the test. Just go get it done.

I went here again a couple of months ago and I will have to say that this place has improved so much since they opened! They expanded the size of the restaurant so I actually didnt have to wait for a booth which shocked me because I used to have to wait a minimum of one hour before the renovation. The server didnt get to our table until we sat for 10 minutes but once he got to us, he was very pleasant and efficent so we forgave him for making us wait lol. I can&#39;t remember what I ordered but it was good-not great and I&#39;m going to try something else next time because this is my grammy&#39;s favorite place so I know I&#39;ll be back.

We drove 2 1/2 hours to come shopping and eat my fav meal. There was a small wait, as to be expected. Fortunately, they gave a buzzer so we could walk the mall. The hostess was great, very friendly, but we saw no one after being seated. No one made eye contact with us or verbal contact in the 25-30min we sat waiting before we left. Patrons were leavening left and right and there were quite a few disgruntled tables. I read past reviews after leaving and this seems to be a common and long-standing problem with servers that is not being addressed by management.

Quick shoutout to the hosts. The amount of people screaming at them in the time I was waiting was ridiculous. I will never understand why people are willing to make themselves look like idiots over a table at a restaurant.<br><br>Went on a Saturday night, wait was long, as expected. They don&#39;t take reservations, which I find extremely obnoxious. It&#39;s truly not hard. Sat outside the restaurant waiting and was crammed in a corner table against the wall once we were called. However our server, I believe his name was Mo but I could be wrong, was very gracious and polite. The food was good; my friend got a burger and I got a chicken dish. I didn&#39;t get cheesecake (I know I know but I&#39;m lactose intolerant) but I got a chocolate cake and it was divine. I also got a fruity cocktail and it was yummy.<br><br>All in all a decent visit. I don&#39;t understand what all the raving reviews are about; this place is good but not insanely amazing. I&#39;ll go back if there&#39;s a shorter wait, but it&#39;s not worth hours of sitting outside.

Don&#39;t order from them via Doordash....your order will get cancelled behind the scenes and you will never find out until your driver calls you an hour later to let you know he was told by the restaurant when he arrived to pick it up.  If you like being hungry, this is the place.

Server : <br>For some reason Moh was serving us and 4 other tables in a slow Wednesday which is not big deal for me to wait on him ! <br>But he smells CIGARETTES and you don&#39;t need to get close to him to smell that ! <br><br>Food: <br>I ordered avocado rolls, which came Cold <br>Yes .. Cold then they got me a hot fresh one after i gave it back.<br>I ordered coffee and it came warm.<br><br>It was disappointing experience i was celebrating my birthday!
I can&#39;t never ever say a bad thing about the Cheesecake Factory. Best cheesecake ever.

Food is marginal, service is so slow you will lose the desire to eat, quality of the same meal is different every time.  Today I was there at 1:30 and stood in line to get a carryout of cheesecake so I wouldn&#39;t have to suffer sitting at a table waiting for an order of food.  The girl forgot me, left me standing there while she chatted with a manager trainee.  It was like I was invisible.  Instead of speaking up, I waited so I wouldn&#39;t embarrass her in front of her new manager.  I waited patiently. Then, a man walked up and she asked him for his order!  I was standing right there!  I had to interrupt.  She turned into a bItch after that.  Huffed and puffed.  The three slices of cheesecake cost $28. What the hell!!  Never, ever going back.

I went here to celebrate with a friend and I&#39;m glad I did. We were on a budget and only had $25 bucks to spend between the 2 of us. I know tall order for Cheesecake Factory. But we did it! <br><br>We ordered the chicken carbonara to split (they don&#39;t split in back since it messes with the presentation but they&#39;ll bring you a plate to share). The chicken carbonara is pasta in a cream sauce with pancetta, peas, peppered chicken onion and garlic. The portion was more than big enough for the 2 of us. <br><br>For dessert we had the chocolate decadence that is the Godiva chocolate cheese cake. It&#39;s got a chocolate crust, chocolate cheesecake filling topped with whipped cream, chocolate drizzle and a Godiva chocolate piece. That they were able to divide for us. <br><br>Our server Christine B was excellent she really made the evening special.

We&#39;ve eaten at this location a few times, and this week we did a to-go order. <br><br>TCF is crazy popular, so you can expect a wait for dine-in, but they are usually pretty efficient at getting you through. <br><br>For takeout the process was super easy, and I&#39;d recommend. <br><br>One of my favorite dishes here is the Thai Lettuce Wraps. It&#39;s technically an appetizer, but it makes  a great meal. The dish comes with a delicious cold noodle salad, and tons of toppings for the lettuce wraps. There are also three Thai-themed sauces that you can use. The peanut grilled chicken is delish as well. <br><br>My wife typically gets the chicken bellagio, and is never disappointed. TCF does these kind of dishes very wall, and it makes for a very filling meal. <br><br>Of course, if you&#39;re into it, definitely get a slice or two of cheesecake to go :-). <br><br>If you live local, try the to-go option some time. They do a great job of packaging things up and getting your order out in a timely manner.  <br><br>I would agree with others, that sometimes the dine-in service can be hit or miss, but I have had an overall great experience here after visiting a few times.

Their food is usually good, but I don&#39;t think it&#39;s worth the long wait times. My most recent time there, the food was late due to a kitchen mix-up which isn&#39;t a big deal but the pasta was undercooked and chewy. I&#39;d consider going here between the lunch rush and dinner time to avoid the long wait.

I am going to back track on my review. The food here is great but that only gets you so far. Once you eat here over and over it seems the service gets worse and worse. Wait times suck but at least those expectations are set up front. Once you sit down the sh*t show begins. <br><br>Now I have ordered to go for the first time and I am disappointed for sure. The portions seem much smaller but maybe it&#39;s an illusion with the to go containers. But to charge someone $4 more for 6 chunks of chicken is straight dumb. <br><br>I have a $25 gift card so I will be back in but after that, I&#39;ll be a former customer.

I&#39;ve dined at several Cheesecake Factory locations in my life and this wasn&#39;t the best of them. The checking in process was very chaotic. The woman working the host stand was super friendly but her system wasnt working. They gave you a buzzer and would page you when your table was ready. The only problem was, our buzzer went off at the same time as 3 others but no tables were actually ready yet. They had us all wait a few more minutes and then there was a ton of confusion about who was going where. <br><br>After finally get sat, it was about 10 minutes before our server stopped by. Then another 15 until he brought our drinks. After ordering our food we waited 50 mins for it to arrive and we both ordered burgers not fancy elaborate dishes. While the burgers tasted good, both were overcooked and were very well done. At this point we were starving and didnt want to wait another hour to eat so we didn&#39;t speak up.<br><br>The food at CF is typically pretty good but the service and timing needs improvement. If your kitchen cannot handle the amount of tables you have, then you should perhaps have less tables or hire additional kitchen staff.

I&#39;ve been in the area where the Cheesecake Factory and after years of trying to get a seat (and giving up after finding out the wait time) I finally ate here.  They recently expanded and added a second seating area, and on the request of several colleagues we decided to venture here.  The menu is extensive and has so many choices.  I am glad to see that they had lunch options and lower calorie options as well.  The server assigned to us was attentive and kept our drinks and bread full.   I ordered the herb crusted salmon and steak plate, and it was ok.  The cost was $22.95, which is a bit pricey for the portion that I received.  I think depending on the entree, some are valued better then others.   Overall, it was ok.  Just not remarkable.  Maybe it was the overhyped wait and excitement of people over the years left me feeling like it wasn&#39;t as good as it could be. I would return if I&#39;m with a group who would want to eat here, but not the first choice if I was the one planning on the group outing.

This was my 3rd visit ever to the Cheesecake Factory and the first in a long time (maybe two years), so I wasn&#39;t entirely sure what to expect.  I know wait times can be long and that while the menu can be overwhelming,  the food is generally pretty good.  <br>At about 8:45 p.m. we called to check waiting times.  The woman said 15-20 minutes but stressed that it could change. We thought that was great timing as we have been told by friends that wait times are usually at least an hour.  Also, we weren&#39;t hungry yet but figured by the time our food was in front of us we&#39;d be able to eat.  <br>When we arrived a little after nine, the restaurant was crowded though the parking lot was relatively empty due to the mall being closed. I gave the woman at the desk my name and she said she&#39;d be able to seat us right away.  Wow! That&#39;s pretty good at any restaurant on a Saturday. While waiting for our table (about 2 minutes while it was being busted) there was another couple leaving in a rage because they&#39;d been waiting for over an hour for their meal to arrive, while another party seated after them were already eating. Yikes. <br>Luckily,  that didn&#39;t deter us.  Our waiter, Mike, was quick and friendly and attentive enough considering how busy he was. We ordered the strawberry lemonade,  a must try if you like very sweet drinks,  and bang bang shrimp to start.  The shrimp came out quickly,  maybe 10 minutes and was hot. I LOVE the type of breading that they used for it and the sauce was creamy and a little zesty.<br>Our entrees took a little over 20 minutes to come (I timed it for this review!), which was fine because our appetizer came halfway through and kept up busy. <br>I ordered the pineapple chicken and shrimp,  which was pretty good though I&#39;ve had frozen entrees that tasted just as good. My husband had the honey truffle chicken which had a nice breading and complex enough flavor to be worth ordering again. We unfortunately did not have room for dessert so can&#39;t fill you in on that. <br>I will say that,  though our server was awesome,  there were a lot of problems at other tables.  I think the biggest complaint was wait time and I could tell the servers were on edge (one walked by our table and I could hear him saying to himself &#34;I&#39;m about to go the F*uck off&#34; as he stormed to the back), sounds like a management problem. <br>9 p.m. might just be the sweet spot to miss the dinner rush.

From the valet parking to the hostess at the entrance, you&#39;re treated as if you were entering a fine dining restaurant. We had a party of 10 and had no reservations but only had to wait for no more that 8-10 minutes. We didn&#39;t have to wait long for our food and everyone was served at once. My favorite non-alcoholic drink is the Passion Fruit Fizz with mint. The appetizers are the best. This time I ordered 4 appetizers for my meal choices and I shared and left there pretty full. From a large lunch meal to a dinner meal, you can&#39;t go wrong ordering anything from here. My suggestions for desserts is everyone get a different slices of cheesecake and share, because you really can&#39;t eat a whole piece all by yourself.

I am a big Cheesecake Factory fan. I have visited locations in several states.  This evening, I went in for carry out cheesecake orders.  The services was prompt and professional.  I was a bit surprised that this particular Cheesecake Factory had the smallest slices of cheesecake that I have ever gotten.  The price was the same, but the slice was much smaller.

I came here with my mother for lunch one day and it wasn&#39;t a particularly long wait, we were seated in a little corner booth for two. I think if we had a bigger party, we would have waited longer as the place was crowded even for lunch. <br><br>Our waitress was nice enough, she wasn&#39;t very attentive, I even had to stop another waiter to get a refill of water. I ordered the hibachi steak with mushrooms, mashed potatoes, tempura green beans. Let me say those tempura green beans spoke to my soul, they were really good. But the steak was gummy and it was drenched in this sickeningly sweet sauce that I did not like. The first bite was ok but I would have been sick eating that same flavor repeatedly, my green beans and mashed potatoes were also coated in this sauce. It was a teriyaki style sauce. So I tell my waitress that I can&#39;t eat it. The wait was pretty long for our food so I hesitated ordering something else, but I knew I&#39;d be shopping all day so I should eat something. <br><br>I went against my better judgement and ordered a turkey club sandwich with fries. The wait for this seemingly easy dish took forever, another 25 mins of waiting. When she finally came out, I just told her to grab me a box to go because I was ready to leave. I ended up eating it in the car but I must say, the turkey club and fries was really good, or maybe I was just hungry. This wasn&#39;t my first time at Cheesecake Factory and I most certainly would go back and try another dish but there does need to be some better service.

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory! When you&#39;re not sure what to have, or are REALLY hungry, this is the place to go for sure. The portions are huge, and the food is great. Prices are reasonable as well. If you&#39;re fortunate enough to go when there is little or no wait, you best be countin your blessings! It&#39;s quite often for them to have a 45 min wait, so pack your patience! If, and I mean this is a big &#34;if&#34; you saved room for desert, their cheesecakes are phenomenal! So many different variety, and such great quality! Even the bread that is served while waiting is excellent. My favorite is the wheat. Their chicken Madeira is one of they signature dishes, as is the crispy chicken costelleta. Both are fantastic choices. If you want a salad, the bbq ranch salad is to die for! <br><br>The staff is always friendly and efficient, and the food is great! I hope you enjoy, and go often! Be sure to try different things on the menu. The crispy artichoke appetizer, ans the avocado spring rolls are just excellent! <br><br>Enjoy!

Very disappointing.<br><br>I&#39;ve never been to the cheesecake factory before but decided to try yesterday while on a back to school college shopping spree with my daughters.<br><br>It took 2 hours four or five of us to be served. my state never showed up until 30 minutes after the rest of the family was done eating. Their orders were all mixed up and not even what they ordered.<br><br>When my medium rare steak arrived it was so bad you couldn&#39;t even chew it. It was Gray.<br><br>they camped the entire meal and gave us cheesecake for our trouble but it just wasn&#39;t worth it. To sit somewhere for 2 hours and have such a bad experience was not much fun.<br><br>Their manager, Brandon Kincaid was indifferent. It took an assistant manager to get anything done or even come to our table.
Good food, LARGE PORTIONS, friendly service. The food just takes too long in the kitchen. The cheesecake is always awesome, just avoid looking at the calorie count
Good food, slow service. Our waiter rarely ever checked up on us. Ugh! Took forever just to get a plain piece of cheesecake- then brought the cheesecake to go??? Why? We didn&#39;t ask for it to go!

We have been to the Cheesecake Factory numerous times, from Chicago to Las Vegas but have never seen a location  as poorly run as this one. We had a reservation, which saved us from the two hour wait others were dealing with, the long wait would seem to indicate the location being amazing. On the contrary, the food was average, service below average, and to add insult to injury we had to wait 45 minutes from the time we finished our meal for our cheesecake, we finally canceled the order and had them adjust our bill. The waitress was pleasant and that is the only thing keeping this from being a 1 star review.

I&#39;m not a fan of Cheesecake Factory, and this location is pretty bad. The dishes are super heavy and everything is pretty much super sized. When friends want to visit, I do stick to a few salads that I know I won&#39;t mind. But it&#39;s not so much about the food, as it is the service. <br><br>The service is so inconsistent. This is pretty much the only place where I have actually left a zero tip.  And I could guarantee, it&#39;s not because they were understaffed. They always have so many employees, but half of them move like molasses and the others are just rude. One time, I was leaving the table and a server who wasn&#39;t carrying any dishes, just body checked me for no reason. The guests always have the right away, but the server didn&#39;t think to seem so or just didn&#39;t care. <br><br>I avoid this place whenever possible.

Came by for dinner. The one thing most people love about Cheesecake Factory is the bread... for which I have not had in a hot minute. Once we were seated and I asked for the bread.. we were told it was still baking and they were waiting for a fresh batch, which is fine. The fresher the better but the bread never ended up making its way out to us, so I was kinda disappointed by that. But now for apps we got the dynamite shrimp which we really enjoyed and the spinach artichoke dip which was alright, I wouldn&#39;t say it&#39;s the best that I have had but good enough to eat if your hungry. I got the chicken and biscuit which was way too salty and my husband got the bang bang shrimp which was pretty tasty. By the end of our meal we were to full for dessert but I wish I would have saved my calories for a cheesecake instead of that salty meal! Oh well, you live and Learn. Till next time!

This is the only location in Michigan, so busy is a complete understatement. That&#39;s the restaurants only downfall, the wait can be up to 2 hours or more sometimes. Once your seated that way is still going to be a minute but the food makes it worth it. I have never been served a bad dish here and never any problems. I go back many times with no problems !
Silverware dirty.  Manager was called.  Didn&#39;t seem to care or want to be bothered.  We left after my friend finished her glass of wine.  Would not return.

Went around 7PM this past week and was seated immediately, granted it was frigidly cold outside, I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly we were seated. Our waitress was immensely helpful and quick to revisit our table whenever we needed anything. She showed us a few new menu items which were scheduled to release the next day. I ordered two of these items. Pretzel bites and Fondue as an appetizer as well as the Pasta Campagne.<br><br>The Pretzel bites were amazing, probably 10 bites total with fantastic cheese fondue and spicy mustard alongside them. The bites are cooked perfectly, not doughy and heavy but very light and crispy. My pasta campagne was very good as well, it was a huge serving and I had to take about half of it home to save room for cheesecake.<br><br>My girlfriend and I shared a large slice of the Cinnabon cheesecake that The Cheesecake Factory serves and it was delicious!<br><br>Yes, it is annoying that the restaurant doesn&#39;t take reservations, and you may wait a bit on busier days before being seated, but it&#39;s important to keep in mind that this is literally the only Cheesecake Factory in Michigan and the demand is incredibly high. And it&#39;s well deserved, the food and service is top-tier!

This was my first time eating and I can say the food was excellent and I had a really great server named Nathan. He was super friendly and had great customer service skills. I order the chicken and biscuit and the cheese burger egg rolls. Then for desert I ordered the Cinnabon cheesecake and the chocolate moose cheesecake both were really great.

I&#39;ve come here several times. The cheesecake is always awesome. It&#39;s amazing how they can successfully be a jack of all trades when it comes to the menu. The menu is huge and all Over the food spectrum but they do everything well for the most part.<br><br>The service is also very good for the most part, there have been some frowning moments. But this is an overall review. <br><br>Their portions are also huge and the food is very rich but what do you expect from a factory that specializes in cheesecakes. There is a skinny menu which is also very good but this ain&#39;t it place for u if you&#39;re on a diet, unless it&#39;s your cheat day.

I Love the Cheesecake Factory! So happy when they finally opened one local since I would always go elsewhere when vacationing. It&#39;s busy the majority of the time so if you want no wait the best time to go is during the week in the off times. We actually got seated right away which has never happened. Service is usually great. Portions are very big unless you order from small plates. The menu is like a short novel, too many choices actually.  I have never not liked anything I&#39;ve tried. The cheesecake is amazing and def big enough to share. My favorites are dulce de leche and the white chocolate with raspberry.

We walked in at 10:45. Not very many people in the restaurant yet. Asked to have our large group seated. They told us that they couldn&#39;t seat us in the large swaths of open tables. Seems like too much of a logistic nightmare for them to get us seated. Would&#39;ve been a $1500 check? So we walked and went to the food court.   Manager is not too bright. Could have just got a seated with some waters and drinks and maybe brought us an appetizer to nibble on until reinforcements showed up.  Could have started the day off with a killer check.

Great desserts! Portions are not too big in the salad department. Some salads lack true crispness. Cheeseburgers are a hit or miss. It&#39;s either a frozen burger or sometimes it&#39;s fresh. At times it&#39;s been a spectacular burger but usually the burger can be tasteless because it was frozen. The waits are horrendous for a table when it&#39;s busy. Service can be good but at times it&#39;s slow. For a family of 6 it can range to a very expensive meal. Food is greasy and lacks any originality. A healthy choice at this eatery is hard to find with all the unhealthy dishes.<br>The clientele can be pushy and very unpredictable because of the lack of space to wait. The hostess stand is an uncomfortable experience.

I took my girls here today for lunch. The service was excellent and the waitress was really on top of things. The waitress&#39; name was Nicole C. We got chicken teriyaki (2), orange chicken and club sandwich and then we also ordered cheesecakes to go. She brought us two bread baskets which was very nice and was totally on top of refilling our drinks. The chicken teriyaki was moist and the flavor was really good. We ate the cheesecakes when we got home which were really fantastic we got salted Carmel, douche Carmel, two Hershey&#39;s ones too. It definitely was great service. We did have a 40 min wait but it was worth the wait.

They need a better system for picking up cheesecake orders.  I was there this past Saturday afternoon to get a cheesecake.  I&#39;m from London, ON and the closest one is in the Toronto area and I was in town anyway.  Paid nearly $60 for a lemon meringue cheesecake and can&#39;t say I&#39;d pay that again.  <br><br>I was told it would be 10 min for it and it was half an hour.  Wouldn&#39;t be SO bad if I was told up front or at least given a more realistic time after the 10 min comes and goes, and there was a waiting area.  Instead, you&#39;re squished in by the hostess stand and front door and end up directing people to the order line because after a few of us are lingering around, people start asking where the line starts and if we&#39;ve already ordered because they can&#39;t tell where to go.  Finally got the long-awaited cheesecake and no apology for the wait or a thanks for waiting or any other compensation for my time.  It was like they were doing me the favour by letting me buy one. <br><br>This was my 3rd visit to a Cheesecake Factory in 3 months and the best one by far is the one on Michigan Ave in Chicago.  People wouldn&#39;t there put up with this kind of service and half an effort.

There were 6 of us and our 30-45 minute wait ended up closer to an hour. We sat in a long booth. Started with the Margherita flat bread, egg roll sampler with salmon, southwest and forgot the other type of roll, along with the crab spinach dip. All the apps were good. My sisterinlaw had the spicy chicken tacos, my hubby got the fish tacos, my fatherinlaw ordered the pork chops, our cousin got the lettuce wrap and my cousin&#39;s kid got the dynamite shrimp starter for his meal, while I ordered the veggie burger. We shared a vanilla bean and white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. Our meals were all good and the raspberry cheesecake was yummy.

Nicole was our server so nice helpful and down to earth. She is the reason for a score of 5. Sangria were good could use a little extra liquor. Appetizer sample egg rolls,  so yummy! Ahi tuna salad was wonderful.

My boyfriend &amp; I were first timers! I have to say, I was IMPRESSED! Food was amazing &amp; service was awesome! Make sure to try the Thai chicken lettuce wraps! I ordered lasagna &amp; my boyfriend ordered the orange chicken, &amp; both were excellent! We also took 3 pieces of cheesecake home which were all to die for! The carrot cake cheese cake was the best though!  if you haven&#39;t tried this place, try it! You won&#39;t regret

We had Cheesecake Factory for my daughter&#39;s quarantine birthday. Everything was great except they forgot the celebrant&#39;s order which was such a bummer coz we don&#39;t live that near to Novi to drive back there. Also, take out sizes seem smaller than how it is dining in. I know because I always order the same dish (Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken); There was more rice than chicken. I wish I had taken a photo. I would give them 3 stars for the take out experience but 4 coz I usually love going to the restaurant itself. Now if they delivered all the way to Livonia this would have been a more convenient experience. I would say driving all the way there to pick up missing orders was not ideal. And my husband did not check because we had a large order.

A little bit of a wait to get seated (only like 15-20 mins) which is great because the last 3 times we&#39;ve tried to go we wound up going somewhere else because the wait was 1-2+ hours. <br><br>The food was really good! we split an app and an entree because the servings are HUGE!! we finished off our meal with a slice of cinnabon cheesecake

Covid problems: Waited 2 hours to even get in. Only to wait an additional 20 minutes just to GET OUR DRINKS. I understand things are difficult but don&#39;t stay open if you can&#39;t provide even reasonable service...

I literally don&#39;t get why this place is still always so packed. Went with my friend for a dinner just us two. We waited for over an hour on a Monday night, then once our buzzer went off, we waited for an additional 20 minutes to be sat. This place is SO disorganized, the people in charge at the host stand just seemed stressed and overwhelmed. If they took reservations, their lives would be 1000x easier. Once we got sat it took around 15 minutes for our server to finally show up. The server offered us bread, and we ordered an app right away because we were so hungry. The app came before the bread did. My silverware was disgusting--see the photos attached, and when I gave it to the girl who dropped off my app and asked for a new one, she never dropped it off. The food here is very mediocre too. Definitely wayyyyy better restaurants in the area. I don&#39;t often come here for obvious reasons. This restaurant just needs to get it together a little more.

I did not even go in today but I have been to the Novi location multiple times and the service is terrible. The only thing that keeps me from never coming back is the food. I just called to ask about the wait and the man that picked up the phone was so rude. He hung up on me because the wait was 2 hours and my response to that was &#34; Two hours?!?&#34;. Incredibly rude. Will not be going back to that location again regardless of the amazing food. The poor customer service will keep me away.

Went here only because the kids were dying for cheesecake. We didn&#39;t want to come for lunch because food is overpriced and not tasty. Today I ordered tea and got a filthy glass. Took ages to get a new one. Service is always very energetic and friendly at least. What is it with no reservations? For my elderly parents this was a no-go so we just went with the kids mid afternoon. I will avoid this place and convince the kids to go elsewhere from now on.

I just love coming to the cheesecake factory I get something different every time and not once has the food let me down. From a burger to pasta to a steak everything is always excellent. It&#39;s hard to finish the food because you get big portions which is fantastic there&#39;s always extra to take home. Let&#39;s not forget about their cheesecake with a whole menu of flavors to choose from no matter what we always leave with a slice to take home.
Ordered for curbside pickup. Website said food would be ready at 7:37 pm, it&#39;s 8:28 now and no sign of food. Called 10 min ago and they told me they were packaging my order. Yeah right!

This place was a major disappointment from the moment I step in...<br>I went there to get cheesecake for my wife&#39;s birthday she wanted 4 flavors so I got Two pieces each. The young lady who waited on me made it very clear I was a bother! She was rude and condescending. Her co workers were the same. When I got the cake home 2 of the pieces out of 8 had freezer burn crust. I spent 100$ and did tip the young lady even though she very much didn&#39;t deserve it. I figured two wrongs don&#39;t make a right! Won&#39;t be back!!<br><br>The two pieces that were freezer burn were not as offensive as the service!
The food here is amazing. The one frustration I have though is that a salad did not come with my $18 entree. Otherwise, I love everything about this place.

One of the worst experiences due to the complete and total incompetence of the staff responsible for the to go department. They had no idea what they were doing and was a total cluster of mass confusion for customers. Customers place their orders and commence to stand in the same area for pickups creating a traffic jam. Orders were being given to out in a very confusing fashion as no one knew what was going on. I don&#39;t blame the employees for this mishap as I fully put the blame on the management for not properly training their employees. Even though they have fantastic cheesecake, I highly doubt that I&#39;d ever go back to that location again.

Came to celebrate my birthday one night and the wait was over an hour. Decided to try again and it was closer to 45 minutes on a Friday night, which was surprising. I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factories all over the US and I have to say this was my least favorite. The layout was a little different then most I&#39;ve been too, and it seemed they crammed as many tables as possible so any type of personal space is void. <br><br>Our server was nice and knowledgeable. We started with the spinach artichoke appetizer and a glass of sangria and a blood orange margarita. Both drinks we good but the glass was jammed with ice of course. For as much as they charge you can let up a little. The appetizer was okay, I should have gone with something else. <br><br>I ordered the blackened Jamaican chicken and shrimp which wasn&#39;t too bad, I have to say it was well cooked. The beau ordered the Chicken Madeira and Steak combo with mashed potatoes. Not the best we&#39;ve had but it wasn&#39;t bad. Of course most come for the cheesecake. I took the pumpkin pecan and he got the godiva to go. <br><br>Overall the bill was close to $100 for two and with the amount of food you do get combined with drinks and dessert I&#39;d say is average.

I want to add one more very important observation about my wasted Saturday evening at the Novi Cheesecake factory location.<br>NOT ONE PERSON IN THE ENTIRE RESTAURANT HAD A SMILE ON THEIR FACE. There&#39;s something wrong with that corporate.

My pregnant fiancée woke up this morning wanting cheesecake. So, I recommended Cheesecake Factory.. We&#39;ve only had it once in Chicago so she was rather excited.
