We drove from Allen Park to get this food and I must say I regret it. She got the chicken and steak combination and I got the burrito grande and a side order of fries. We both also got cheesecake. Her food was far from decent. Very little steak and the chicken was bland. The only thing good was her mashed potatoes. My burrito had a tease of chicken and a boat load of rice. A very bad ratio! Not to mention both of our cheesecake slices tasted off and unexpected. Spending $65 and driving a half hour was nowhere near worth it.

As always this place delivers. So busy, we sat at the bar &amp; got great service. We ordered a few drinks &amp; appetizers. Can&#39;t beat their happy hour where apps are 1/2 price &amp; an app is really enough for a meal. Try the corn tamales they have got to be the best thing on the menu! I had a mojito &amp; it cost more than my food but hey it&#39;s not everyday I get a mojito I&#39;m usually a beer drinker.

We door dashed and have had uneven service. Tonight, with our entrees they packed two butters, no bread, two spoons (we did not have soup), and one fork. I called the restaurant twice to talk to someone and was put on hold for ten minutes each time awaiting a manager who never came to the phone. The food was warm and tasted ok otherwise. Overall will pass and go for granite city or elsewhere for this price and service.

Wow, this location was awful! Once we were seated (after a standard 15 minute wait), no one came by, took drink orders or acknowledged us in any way. After 20 minutes we just left. The table next to us was having all kinds of trouble with their order i.e. wrong food, some people not getting their meals. We felt bad for the table behind us, they were there when we arrived and when we left they still hadn&#39;t even seen a server. Avoid this location like the plague.....
Had to wait 45 minutes just to get our food. Waitress wasn&#39;t very attentive so tipped accordingly. Food was delicious but there should have been no reason for the long wait.

This place is great.<br><br>They sell a lot more then cheesecake. <br><br>They offer all kinds of foods. I got salmon when I visited. It was very good, it melts in your mouth!!! <br><br>BUT my favorite thing was the avocado egg rolls I got for an appetizer!!!! Must try!<br><br>It was summer so I decided to sit outside, the inside was very crowded. Not that much of a view, I saw the parking lot lol<br><br>I will definitely be back.

We ordered online at 1120 for a 330 curbside carryout.  My husband texted the number posted as soon as he arrived and no one responded.  He tried calling numerous times with a busy signal.  He waited until 530-2 hours after our pickup time before leaving without our food!!  I understand if they were busy but have someone answer the phone to let us know!!  Now we are out over $80 and need to find another dinner!  Complete nonsense!!!  I will never eat here again.

Completely disorganized poorly managed. Made a nice day a nightmare.  Ordered ahead scheduled a time and they failed in every way.  I tried to support them during this bulls_hit shutdown but cannot tolerate this unacceptable treatment.

Ordered something through door dash tonight, called cheesecake Bc I wanted a gluten free bun an they didn&#39;t have that option on doordash. cheesecake forwarded me to talk to someone who had no intention of listening what I had to say or help me, made me wait for 35min to talk to the manager and my order already left before even explaining my issue. Thanks guys<br><br>-ps. I&#39;m drunk and very irritated, plus I was there last night. Great way to treat your customers  done spending my money here, shit not even that good anyway

I&#39;ve been to various Cheesecake Factories in several states. How have I not reviewed yet I&#39;m asking myself? No idea, I thought I had. I used to love going out of town and being able to visit. Now there&#39;s one in my own State yet I hardly go. Stopped in tonight since we were busy running errands. Food was good when we finally got our correct meals. My husband&#39;s Burger was overcooked, they were out of my Salmon so I had to order something else. Then come to find out they weren&#39;t out of the Salmon so I ended up getting it about ten minutes after my husband received his meal which he then had to send back. On to the rest though.<br>The menu is extensive! Give yourself time to peruse. There literally is something for everyone. If you can&#39;t find something here I&#39;m not even sure what to say. Of course there is dessert(cheesecake) hence the name. And they are good, big slices and tons of different varieties. My favorite is the Banana Cream.  <br>They have a great menu with healthy alternatives and the nutrition calculated called the Skinnylicious menu, it&#39;s the menu I stick with. Their Tuscan Chicken with Tomatoes, Artichokes, Capers and Balsamic is a favorite I also love the Salmon. For appetizers I love the summer rolls and the Thai lettuce wraps are​ good. They have happy hour from 4-6 with food choices as well as drink specials. I like the Artichoke if they don&#39;t burn them which sometimes they do. Service tends to be on the slower side so be prepared and there is usually a wait.

The place very dirty. The wall next to our booth had tomato sauce splashed on it and not cleaned. The silverware was all dirty for our table, we had to keep asking the waitress to bring other silverware. The food was good but 45 minutes late. Very disappointed..
Pretty good, but they forgot our bread, and the bread is the best part. <br><br>Got the Mac and cheese balls and the eggplant parm, along with dulce de leche cheesecake.

We went here for my daughter&#39;s 15th birthday.  Although, not my first time, it is my first review and I must say I am always pleased when I come here.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  Made sure our drinks were always full and that we were good.  The food came out hot and delicious.  It is a very very busy time of the year so it took the food a long time to.come out bit they give you bread so you are not starving.  Overall very good experience and the food is phenomenal.
Finally got to try the Cheesecake Factory and it was amazing only got the cheesecakes had to try most of them. The original was the best one but overall they were all good
Amazing food and cheesecake. The only downside is the wait. I have found that ordering online and picking it up is just as good.

The Cheesecake Factory is my favorite destination when making a trip to the mall. It consistently has great food and the cheesecake is the best around. Recently, we had a waitperson, Mark P., who was a very professional, polite and overall excellent server. The service is always good, but Mark was exceptional. <br>This is by far my favorite chain restaurant.

FOOD POISONING!!!!! My husband and I got carry out and went home and ate it. About an hour later I had bad stomach pains and vomiting all night. After a Google search it appears to be a more common problem than I thought with the Cheesecake Factory.

I have to say, if you&#39;re coming for cheesecake or drinks, who&#39;s is actually NOT your spot.  The cheesecake of local favorite, Peteet&#39;s, is so far above the quality here and chains always have terrible bartenders, HOWEVER:<br><br>If you&#39;re looking for a healthy, light and quick lunch, this is it.  The salads are amazing.  I ordered the kale and quinoa and my friend ordered a chicken oriental that came out towering with crisps.  Both were really really good and salads aren&#39;t actually easy to impress with.  Lots of attention to detail.<br><br>The margarita was less than average and the plain cheesecake and the celebration cheesecake were actually not so good.  Not any of these three were even half consumed.
People are usually nice here and food is pretty good.... crazy busy so try to go early!

I placed an online order for a whole cheesecake and selected curbside pickup. I showed up at the time they said my order will be ready, waited in my car in front of the restaurant for about 20 minutes, no one showed up. Called them like 10 times, no one answered. Had to park the car and walk inside and was asked to wait in the long bakery line they had. After more than an hour, all they did was get out a frozen cheesecake from freezer and put it in a box and give it to me. Such a big scam that they don&#39;t honor the time they give customers that order will be ready, falsely let you select curbside pickup when no one is in fact going to come out to deliver your order, even though you order ahead still have to wait in their long line so they can spend a second of taking out a cake from freezer and boxing it. I&#39;m furious at this insulting treatment at so many levels. The part that makes me even angrier is when I placed order, I even tipped good because I was expecting someone was actually going to hand deliver. Such a shame, just shame.

Thee Cheesecake Factory!! Ok, the first time I ever ate at a Cheesecake Factory was at Sacramento about 5 to 6 years ago. It was quite some time ago, but the experience was very good.<br><br>It&#39;s not just a place for you to order up cheesecakes. Their food is actually very good. But be prepared to wait for a table, this is basically the ONLY cheesecake factory here in Michigan. So yes, people do make the pilgrimage just to have a crack at it.<br><br>Appetizer of choice,, the chicken samosas. Those things are addictive, trust me on that. Then entree&#39; of choice for me would be the Chicken Marsala or the Shepherds Pie. Those two things, you can never go wrong. Dishes so good, you&#39;d prolly lick the plate when you&#39;re done.<br><br>Come early and put your name on the list right away. Go shopping and just check from time to time to see if your time has shortened. I always expect a bit of wait, just because I wouldn&#39;t be shocked if there was one. I just put my name on the list and go shopping, then check back afterwards. Hopefully they&#39;ll open another one. In Downtown Detroit **hint**

Literally waited OVER 3 hrs &amp; returned to be told it&#39;s another 10-15 minutes. This place needs to have better turnover and people that know how to speak to a customer. Just for these reasons alone, I give this place a 1. No restaurant -  especially this one, is worth an over 3 hour wait. They removed us from the list because we didn&#39;t come back at a guess of time to get a beeper. Pardon me! They should have more pagers, work with reservations or have a better system in place. <br>The food is not outstanding. Nor is the cheesecake. EVEN Chicago Cheesecake Factory knows how to manage the crowd- even Vegas does. Your hostess- the one that GREETS potential customers - is rude. Jennifer needs a dishwashing job. <br><br>The only thing that made the night was our server, Stephanie. She was incredible and is the epitome of what The Cheesecake Factory employee should be. <br>The best one we&#39;ve ever had in the several visits we&#39;ve experienced.  She gets the full 5 stars and should be promoted to management.

This has been my second time coming to the Cheesecake Factory. Both times have been an amazing experience. Starting with the wait staff. They are very attentive to your needs. Today I order the side house salad with cheese on top and Steak Diane with mash potatoes. I order it med. It came back med well. Other wise other problems. I will come back again as long as the cook watch the temp of the meat.

This place was just ok. Very packed inside, but we were there in a weekend. A little pricey but the portions were generous. Bar staff was slammed so it took a Looong time to get a drink. The cheesecake was phenomenal. I wouldn&#39;t make a special trip to go here.

This place is a victim of its own success. One to two hour waits are common, no reservations. And when you break down the value it goes like this:<br><br>Variety of food:  4 stars<br>Service:               2 stars<br>Food:                  3.5 stars<br>Ambiance:         Its a theme restaurant!
The Salmon Special is awesome with capers, mushrooms, and a lemon butter sauce.<br><br>The Red Velvet cheesecake is my favorite!

It seems to be this is the worst Cheesecake Factory ever. And it&#39;s continuing to go down hill. I went here with my boyfriends parents meeting them for the first time. Party of 5. Everyone&#39;s food came out except mine. Everyone waited for me to get my plate to eat all together. 30 min later a manager comes by and says she&#39;s sorry for the mix up, it&#39;s getting cooked now, but here&#39;s a salad in the mean time. Another 30 minutes pass and still no meal. Soon enough I end up canceling my meal completely b.c. Im so pissed off and absolutely starving at this point but also fuming with anger. The waiter constantly came over apologizing and explain how it wasn&#39;t her fault. Imagine spending 3 hrs at Cheesecake Factory and never getting your meal. And everyone saying how it&#39;s not their fault. Yay...

My family and I had a terrible dining experience at Cheesecake Factory this evening. We were there for over 2 hours, most of the time we were waiting. Waiting for drinks, waiting for our entrees, and then (you probably guessed it) waiting for our cheesecake. One in our party of eleven had an exceptionally long wait for his entree. Our server Brittany could not have been nicer, she was the only thing that made this terrible experience a little better. According to her first it was the bar that was slow, then it was the kitchen, and then we waited for cheesecake because the workers at the counter have to get cheesecake for everyone. Well at the point when we were waiting for our cheesecake we were one of few parties left. So who was there to get cheesecake for?! The manager, Scott, had a very cavalier attitude towards our service. That reason in combination with the fact that I&#39;m consistently underwhelmed with the fare is why I will not be returning and I cannot in good faith recommend that anyone go here. I think that they must be making money hand over foot and it&#39;s causing them to care less about quality of service.
Fancy restaurant and good food. However, bad customer service and pricey. Will be back

Bad food, wrong food and very slow service. <br><br>We&#39;ve eaten at cheesecake factories in multiple cities- they are always packed and the food is always delicious. Today&#39;s service in Novi was terrible: slow, food took over 30 minutes, left dirty plates on table while we were still eating next course. <br><br>Food: my omelette was kinda slimy and missing the avocado. The potatoes were half burned. My husbands omelette was equally mediocre and missing the tomato. My son&#39;s pasta was supposed to be just butter and Parmesan. It had all sorts of little pieces of something (veggies from another meal?) stuck to it. They took it off the bill but didn&#39;t offer any other solutions. <br><br>Needless to say, we will not ever return. Truly one of the worst meals I&#39;ve had anywhere in recent memory. Huge disappointment.

It was a great experience today at the cheesecake factory the service was excellent the food was delicious I had a wonderful time the appointment was a necessity I went at noon today and it was already crowded
I never go because I crave the food. I go because of Cheesecake. But the avocado sampler plate is amazing! The chicken Madeira was alright. Kind of salty. The cheesecake was on point.

The service was good. I got the cajun chicken littles, mashed potatoes, and corn succotash. They give you a lot of chicken and that&#39;s why I gave them three stars. As I was going to the restroom, I saw the chicken littles on another lady&#39;s plate, so I had to get that for myself, but all that glitters ain&#39;t gold! The chicken was tender and moist, but lacking in flavor. Just bland! There was nothing cajun about it! I saw little pepper flakes if that&#39;s what you want to call cajun, but lacking in flavor! If it wasn&#39;t for the ranch dressing, barbecue sauce, and honey mustard, I probably would have had the server to take that entree back and I would&#39;ve ordered something else. I am also saying the same for the mashed potatoes. I had to doctor those up with a side of marsala gravy (which is good, by the way) for flavor. The corn was not sweet either. I&#39;ll say this---this entree is cool if you&#39;re on a low sodium diet. Overall, the atmosphere was nice and I will give them another chance. I&#39;ve been before and had the chicken and biscuits. It was good. I will definitely try something else next time.

This place is AMAZING! I have made numerous 1 &amp; a half hour trips to Novi for the Cheesecake Factory specifically in the past year and it never disappoints. I have tried completely new items off of their huge menu at each trip and enjoyed every single one of them. The food quality is impeccable and don&#39;t even think about skipping the Cheesecake for dessert. I always get 3-4 slices to go for the week that follows.
Huge menu with lots of choices. Love the factory chopped salads and the pasta. The cheesecakes are to die for. Usually get in pretty quickly too.  Friendly staff as well.

I have eaten at many cheesecake factory around the U.S and the service at this one was the worst. We knew we would have to wait a while. That was not an issue. After about 35 min we were taken to our seats. Once there, we were told that since we had a baby stroller, we would need to go back on the waiting list. I asked to speak to the mgr, we did and he said that yes we could stay. Looked like they had one bartender working so it took a very long time every time we ordered a drink. Then we ordered our food. My wife&#39;s food came out and it was wrong, and my mother in law&#39;s. She ordered a 4 cheese chicken pasta dish. One issue, no chicken was in the pasta, so we had to have both of them fixed. Our table was piled with empty messy dishes and they never picked them up. We ordered dessert and still never picked up the old used dishes. I will say that the meals that were right were great. Very good. I had the shepherds pie. Really yummy. So food is good, but service needs a lot of work. Overall  I was  disappointed. This one does not meet the Cheesecake Factory Standards.

The food was decent and the cheesecake was good, but why in God&#39;s name did it take 40 minutes to get seated (eventually the wait time was 2 hrs!), 30 minutes to get our food (&#34;fresh rice&#34;), and another 30 minutes to get our cheesecake?! For lunch, that&#39;s a ridiculous amount of time. <br><br>Our waiter was very kind and he did apologize for the wait. It was not his fault. Even after our $25 gift card our lunch with tip was $40. Two fish taco dinners (with rice &amp; beans), two iced teas, and two cheesecakes to go. Not worth the wait or the price. If you want cheesecake, order ahead and do carry out.
Over cooked steak and under cooked pasta. Over hyped!!!!!! Not worth the wait. Friend also had food spilled on him, place is a chaos.
One of our favorite places. Great apps, good happy hour. People watching galore. Always have a fun time there. Also gives us a reason to walk it off in the mall!!

I think somewhat highly of this place. I would 5 star you guys but the wait is still ugh, and the floor is still slippery as well as the seating is still small. Lastly sometimes it&#39;s hair on my plate. The menu is full of options but mostly chicken and beef. If you&#39;re a vegan good luck finding something here you will have to do a lot of substitutions. Although if you&#39;re calorie conscious they have a skinny menu for you. So basically chicken lovers &amp; cheesecake lovers you&#39;re in heaven!

I had a reservation, good thing too because it took us ten minutes just to get to the desk to tell them about our reservation but it was really reAlly packed!!  Once up there we got seated right away!  The waitress was great the appetizers drinks and food were wonderful!  I had the chicken Madeira it was so good and the mashed potatoes were great. I could only eat half so I had some room for my cheesecake!!!  Pineapple upside down cheesecake awesome!!!  It was so good!!!  Definitely a great place Busy but wonderful!!!!

We love Cheesecake Factory, however the hostess system needs improvement!!!!! You wait in line to get a pager, average wait 1-2 hours, then you wait to hand in pager, then you wait again to be seated. Food is delicious, service is usually good as well.
Terrible service extremely rude staff as well as dirty silverware and uncooked Hamburg meat. Not worth the two hour wait extremely disappointed.

Came here for lunch with a friend , first they wanted to sit us by a group of people. Acted for a booth which the hostess was rude about. Then we get the worst waiter ordered a streak medium well . Took 1 hour for our food . After waiting 1 hour they messed up my steak was burnt.

This is for the weekday daytime bartender only. She&#39;s terrible. I&#39;ve gone a few times to sit at the bar on a weekday during the day while I&#39;m doing some shopping and I&#39;ll never go again during that time. She takes at least 5-10 minutes to even acknowledge me, the reason being is that she&#39;s talking to other employees. Not getting drinks or doing work, but just standing there talking. When she finally does come to get my drink order, she&#39;s rude and unpleasant. And then forget about her coming back to take my order for food or ask if I&#39;d like another drink. By the time she does any of that, I&#39;m so over waiting that I&#39;m just ready to leave.

Once again a bad experience at this location. The last time I came to this location for my nephew&#39;s birthday they tried to send my wife into anaphylactic shock by putting a tomato on her burger after us telling them several times she was allergic. They apologized remade the burger and brought it out again with a tomato on it the. Sent it back and merely removed the tomato but we saw tomato seeds on the meat and reported it again. They apologized gave us free desert and a gift card for a future visit.<br><br>Well today I figured I&#39;d used the gift card on a carryout order, a classic burger MEDIUM to go, please look at the picture and be the judge. Looks well done to me, definitely not medium. They said it would be 20 minutes. Order placed at 5:48 pm. At 6:10 I asked about my order they said it would be 8 more minutes. At 6:25 they said it should be ready soon they had to make a fresh one they were just waiting on the burger. I sarcastically said &#34;all I ordered was a burger that only takes 3 minutes to cook each side to reach a medium temperature what&#39;s the hold up?&#34; The girl explained someone accidentally took mine out the window and they&#39;re remaking it. I&#39;m pretty PO&#39;d right now because it can only get worse from here. At 6:38 exactly 50 minutes after I placed the order she hands me my bag, I walked to the car opened it up the burger was well done with NO CONDIMENTS. I took a couple of bites and tossed that dry AZZ hockey puck out the window. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS!!!

I have to say, growing up going to Cheesecake Factory in Florida was the most exciting thing ever for me.. I am very aware the issues the CEO has with Michigan and why he chose not to open up here for so long. My aunt actually went to school with him so I know the story all too well. <br><br>When I had heard this location opened up, I was ready to become a regular. I never imagined that I would have such a bad taste in my mouth about Cheesecake Factory as I do today... All of the corporate cut backs have left menu items tasting lousy. Nothing like the quality they used to have. <br><br>On another note, the staff are so rude and miserable, you can tell they hate every second of their jobs. The service is so bad every time I have visited, which is why I rarely come back. Maybe if the food was the way it used to be, I would come more often despite the bad service.

Never order thru DoorDash. Portions are small. A salad is half the size as dine in. They never include cutlery- which is annoying when you are in a hotel. They give you bread but no butter. Big disappointment for lots of $$.
Good services. Food took too long to come but it was overall very delicious. Servings were also large.

Great food, but always packed. The front desk is ok but the servers are always nice. Expect to get more than you pay for because the  portion sizes are huge. The lettuce tacos are the bomb. Best burgers ever.  Bam bam shrimp and chicken dish is off the hook.  Deserts are amazing. Worth the wait!!

Today I came to this restaurant with my wife and my children. My child found a cockroach in our food. Honestly, I&#39;m in shock. I went to the kitchen to figure it out. So the GENERAL manager pushed me off there and said that he would banish me from the restaurant and ban the entrance. He insulted me for nothing. My lawyer has already taken up this matter I will contact the police and law enforcement agencies. So that people like your managers do not work there! General manager made an employee of this restaurant follow me to the car. it is harassment, insult and bullying of people for nothing. My child almost got poisoned by your food !!!
Obviously expensive but you leave with enough food for leftovers. The Oreo cheesecake is the best!!! A nice date night spot or a place to get drinks with friends

I visited on 9/26/15. 1st time here! All my friends talked about how amazing the cheesecake tasted, so I had to try it myself. The place was packed so carryout was the way to go! I originally wanted to get Cherry Cheesecake but they ran out.  So I got the Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cream Cheesecake and also tried Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake. Both were so rich and good.<br>One day, I plan to try every flavor cheesecake they have!<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory should open a store in Somerset Mall and I&#39;d go there every single day!

I love the Cheesecake Factory and have only good things to say. <br><br>Really the only negative is that they list the calories under each meal and I&#39;d rather not know how caloric every single dish is!!!<br><br>*the sweet corn tamale cakes are a delicious appetizer and next time I might get them as my main meal<br><br>*I got the Thai chicken coconut lime dish and it was very tasty and will be a nice lunch left over <br><br>*the burrito is the largest I&#39;ve ever seen. <br><br>Definitely is a good place to split a main dish with someone especially if you&#39;re ending your meal with cheesecake.

So we came here after a long day of shopping and we were really hungry just to find out they were out of so many things, no bread to start off with , no avocado, no Spinach and cheese dip , and took forever before we could even order , the people were nice just seemed like everything took for,ended up walking out after getting no water after 25 minutes , I recommend the Nordstrom cafe which was so much better

So good so delicious so fantastic. Don&#39;t order delivery from here bc it is meant to be ate fresh &amp; if your going to pay so much, you might as well enjoy the atmosphere. Calamari &amp; margaritas all day!

3 star only for the cheesecake lol. We ordered the egg roll sampler, Evelyn&#39;s favourive pasta and banana cream cheese cake, old fashion burger.<br>Well, eggroll&#39;s filling taste great, especially with the sauce they served. But the surface is a bit over fried.<br>Pasta is good, light taste, healthy meal.<br>Banana cream cheese cake is great, love it.<br>The burger.... I asked for well done... 50%is burnt! I bit in that and it tasted like a piece of coal. They did take it away as I requested. I understand it was a busy day 2nd January 7 pm. But srsly you need to watch the burger burnt like that to make sure it&#39;s well done? Oh and most sweet potato fries were dry and burnt as well.<br>Abt the service. We had to look for and call waiter again and again. No one asked how the food was,  no apologies abt the burnt burger.<br>Quite disappointed, guess only the cheesecakes are worth trying.

Let&#39;s get a few things clear. Yes, the line is pretty long. Yes, it&#39;s probably a two hour wait and yes, they freeze their cheesecakes. <br>. <br>Frozen Cheesecakes<br>It&#39;s no secret, I&#39;ve been told by multiple staff members their popular desserts are ALL frozen. They thaw it out 1-2 hours prior to their fridge display. So um... THAT WOULDN&#39;T FLY IF YOU TRIED ORDERING THIS STUFF FROM A LOCAL BAKERY, but you know, it&#39;s cool. It&#39;s acceptable because it&#39;s a name brand and we are all somewhat disconnected with how food actually makes it way into our bellies anyway.<br><br>No Money No Cake. <br>Overall, the slices are quite pricey. If you don&#39;t have the time to make it yourself, or have a friend that has a friend that can make this for you. Then fine, come here, treat yourself. I&#39;m in that category. But trust me when I say this, I tried calling local bakeries. No one can make this because it&#39;s seasonal. So....  I ordered a 10&#34; red velvet cheesecake for my hubby&#39;s birthday ($53). AND Goodness that cake was rich. Our family tried to devour it but even for 12 guests, I still had six fat slices left over. Good thing I can freeze them...<br><br>Anyway moving on to food...<br>The salads are amazing and the jambalaya pasta is to die for.  If you want to wait in line, you have to try their food. If you just want cheesecake, there&#39;s a section that you can just order a slice and take it to go.<br><br>Conclusion:<br>TCF is pretty good. Try coming on a weekday for dinner or for brunch. If you have to get together for dinner than bring friends so you can take turns waiting in line/go shopping at 12 oaks.

I hate leaving negative reviews, but here we are. Let me just say: the food was amazing. I was hesitant to go here because I was one of the original servers that opened up this restaurant, and I remember that the food used to take forever to come out and it was often sent back - I&#39;m happy to see that that is no longer the case. However, the service is awful (surprising for an establishment that is all about warm and inviting hospitality.) <br><br>I was the first member of my party to arrive on Thursday, March 21st, at around 5:20pm. My girlfriends weren&#39;t scheduled to get there for another forty minutes so I thought I&#39;d enjoy some happy hour refreshments at the bar. The rail had two couples, one woman who was dining solo, and myself - by no means busy. It still took me several minutes to get greeted with an unenthusiastic&#34;hi.&#34; Awesome. Great start - searching for service from an inattentive bartender. I ordered a Skinny Margarita and the Tex Mex Egg Rolls. Both were delicious. I finished my margarita and waited (no joke, I looked at my watch) for ten minutes before I had to basically yell at the bartender for another drink. I ordered a Hendrix martini on the rocks. He gave it to me up. I got attitude when I asked him for it on the rocks once more. My party was trickling in at that moment so I decided to cash out so I could tip him instead of asking for everything to get transferred to the table (we had snagged some high tops in the bar area.) I thought, &#34;what the heck maybe he&#39;s just having a rough day,&#34; so I tipped him $6 on $27 and moved. HOWEVER. Two hours later when my girlfriends and I were wrapping up our food to go, a server approached me with the tab I had ALREADY PAID FOR and told me the bartender requested I paid. What? You gave me horrible service and you want me to pay my tab, twice? That is unacceptable. I walked over to the bar and told him I had already paid and I got a reluctant &#34;yeah sure.&#34; Bro it&#39;s not my fault you can&#39;t close out your checks when there is literally NO ONE at the bar. And honestly the worst service I&#39;ve received anyone on a long time. They need to clean house. I&#39;ll be ordering to go from now on.

It&#39;s true what they say, you always remember your worst service, and I&#39;ll remember the service I received at this Cheesecake Factory location.<br>The wait times are horrid. <br>There&#39;s no order whatsoever with regard to the lines here. <br>Placing a to go order for a slice of cheesecake requires one to show up two hours early. <br>Not to mention the dismissive tendencies of the maître d!<br>All in all, would have given a no stars if that was possible.

Usually have a decent meal there. Sat down, and were given really dirty silverware. The service was slow (and it was right when they opened, and weren&#39;t busy) and the food was not that good. Next trip over that way, I&#39;ll be trying something new. Cheesecake Factory was always a treat for me, since I don&#39;t get over there too often. Sad to see it going down hill.

I had a terrible experience at this location and would not recommend it.  The service was terrible and the food was inedible.  My plate sat under the heat lamp so long that the coleslaw was hot, gross!  I didn&#39;t eat my meal and was still charged for it.  On a positive note, they offered to give me more fries, uhm... no thank you.

This was my first time at The Cheesecake Factory and I loved it! I sat at the bar and was taken care of by Nick the bartender. Service was great and friendly. I ordered a blood orange martini which was perfectly sweet. For my meal I ordered the chicken and shrimp gumbo which was fantastic. It was perfectly spicy and it tasted very fresh. The bread basket here is great as well, two different loaves of what they call Sweet Wheat and Oat Demi Baguette. I ordered three slices of cheesecake to take home and share with the family-Oreo, tuxedo, and my absolute favorite-white chocolate Raspberry. Everything was great from the food, to the drinks, to the service. The restaurant has a slightly elegant vibe to it as well. Excellent place, I&#39;ll be back again.

I love Cheesecake Factory! My family and I have been coming for years but could only ever go when we went out of town. When this location opened, we were STOKED! The location of the restaurant is great, inside a mall with an outside entrance. The servers are always exceptional. They are always attentive to your needs without being overbearingly over your shoulder asking if you need anything. The food is always spectacular, always fresh and cooked to perfection. I always see people complain about the prices, but I ALWAYS get two meals out of one dish, so the price is worth it to me. And the cheesecake...it speaks for itself. Always so creamy and yummy! My personal favorite is the Oreo!! Highly highly recommend :-)

I am only giving it 4 stars because the carry out slices of cheesecake are not as big as the ones you get when dining in. Which for what people pay for a slice it should be considerably larger. But over all love this place. Nice friendly atmosphere for family or just for a couple, friends or even by yourself.

Tried it for the first time today and will never be coming back. No wait to be seated, they were not that busy surprisingly its dinner time. We arrived and seated at 620 pm put our orders in about 5 mins.<br>The disappointing part was the looonnnggg wait for our food! Kids meal arrived 715pm and my son fell asleep waiting for his food. Then our food arrived 740 pm! I was so upset but didnt show it to the waitress who was so apologetic. I know its not her fault, she even said the kitchen messed up my order big time. After our food arrive i have to ask for a box immediately coz my son fell asleep again. I wont be recommending this place to anyone. Food was okay wasnt really amazed.

I was going to put three stars, but &#34;Meh&#34; is exactly the phrase to describe the experience. The service was excellent and the food was very good, but I don&#39;t ever need to go back.<br><br>You didn&#39;t need to tell me that Cheesecake Factory started in LA in 1978--everything about the decor screams it. It maybe would be cool if you didn&#39;t know that there was a war.ehouse full of exactly the same 70s-style stuff and a long-term contract between the corporation and a supplier to produce it. The wait is long, and the noise is LOUD. It should be a cozy fern bar but it&#39;s got the atmosphere of a nightclub.<br><br>Service was really excellent. We didn&#39;t order alcohol and split 3 appetizers instead of getting dinner, and the waitress treated us like we were spending money. Of course, 3 appetizers, 2 soft drinks, and 2 pieces of cheesecake set us back $60 before tip...that IS money to some people.<br><br>The tiramisu cheesecake was OK, but I didn&#39;t feel like I was having an incredible experience. The s&#39;mores cheesecake we tried was brute-force good: it&#39;s almost impossible to make 1200 calories of sugar, fat, and chocolate is going to taste bad.<br><br>It&#39;s not that the Cheesecake Factory was bad, but you can get better food for less money. Meh.

First impressions are underwhelming as the hostess was desperately clinging to her small bit of power by blaming us for &#34;taking too long&#34; after being paged and she had to give our table away. To make it up to us she said we could wait for our name to be called 15 minutes later....still waiting. <br><br>The waiter saved the day. He was personable, professional and on top of things.

Loving the artichoke and mushroom soup.  Cucumber lemonade w/ mint is very refreshing. The chicken Madeira  is excellent. The Gumbo had just the right amount of spice.  Then there is the lemon torte.  I love this place.  The wife and I are definitely coming back.  And yes, the waitress was great. Happy Fathers Day to me!!!

Worst experience ever! I made the mistake of visiting this location on Valentines Day. I do want to add in the beginning of this that we expected things to take longer because of the holiday, we are very patient, and we were so kind to the waitress the entire time, never complained and said please and thank you continuously. I gave her ABSOLUTELY NO REASON to act the way she did. <br><br>My boyfriend and I went very early in the day (to avoid the rush) before there was a wait, and we were seated immediately. It was as soon as we got sat that things started to get bad. Our waitress (HER NAME WAS JAZMINE) greeted the table next to us and didn&#39;t get around to greeting us until at least 15 minutes later. It usually doesn&#39;t take that long to get greeted, but again we understood that it was a holiday. It starts getting worse from here. <br><br>Our drinks took AT LEAST 30 minutes, if not more (I think she forgot to ring them in). We ordered the fried cheese appetizer at the SAME time as our drinks. The waitress came back BEFORE our drinks were out (because they had taken THAT long) to take our order? The fried cheese appetizer NEVER came out. When our meals finally came out we realized we weren&#39;t getting our appetizer, and on top of that the waitress never came back to get us more drinks, sauce, check on us etc. When she finally did come back we were done eating, and I kindly asked for a box. SHE NEVER GAVE ME A BOX. She came back again, and I asked for a box AGAIN. She swiftly picked up my plate, and took my food to the back, boxed it up for me and gave it back. Now I normally wouldn&#39;t mind this at all, but considering the circumstances and how extremely long it took her to box up my food, I was absolutely positive that she had done something to my food. <br><br>At this point, not only had my boyfriend and I waited an obnoxious amount of time, not gotten our appetizer, another drink, a side of sauce, OR a box, I also couldn&#39;t eat my leftovers that I paid top price for! Because I knew I could no longer eat my leftovers, I decided to order Cheesecake. My boyfriend ordered his to go, and I ordered mine for here because at this point I was seriously starting to get hungry again! That was a mistake on my part because 30 minutes later, I flagged the waitress down and asked for my cheesecake to-go because we had been there for SO long at this point. She agreed and another 15 minutes later she brought the cheesecake out and mine was NOT to-go. At this point we had already paid our bill and tipped 20% (regardless of the terrible service), so when I kindly asked for a box because we just wanted to leave, she said okay, walked away and NEVER CAME BACK. We finally had to ask another server for a box and this server was able to take care of three other tables first and still get me a box before our terrible waitress did. I have never had such an awful waitress in my entire life, and Cheesecake Factory used to be my favorite restaurant, but unfortunately my boyfriend and I will never be back.

As usual, excellent food and service today. Our sever Tierra was the best we&#39;ve had here. She is very good. Service was perfect, on point, no mistakes, pleasant and efficient. You need to clone her.<br><br>Our drinks and meals were excellent as usual. The Tuscan Chicken is really good and the portion large. A very healthy meal friends. The Skinny Pot Pie and Lettuce Wrapped Tacos also. Well done chef.<br><br>This place gets busy. If you don&#39;t want to wait, go on an off night like tonight. Always great here! I see some lower reviews. Folks, on a busy night in Novi there&#39;s going to be a wait. Don&#39;t fault them because people love this place.<br><br>Oh, and trim that new tree on the south side of the dining room. Annoying...

This place opened five years ago I believe.  Back in the opening month my family came to try the new restaurant and the wait was 3 hours or more.  We did not wait, that would be an idiotic time to wait even for a Michelin star rated restaurant let alone this caliber of establishment.  Since that time we have tried for a table each time we visit the Twelve Oaks Mall, where this Cheesecake Factory is.   The wait is always at least two hours.  Of note, we rarely come to the mall and then mostly on the weekend.  I have never been long enough in the mall to get a table.  The one time I was, the wait was 1hr 30min and when we returned at that marked time even though our pager did not ring and we waited an additional 45 minutes and still were not seated.  We left.  <br>This review marks the end of our curiosity.  The restaurant has enough mediocre reviews of food, service, and wait times by others that my family and I have decided we are through trying and the curious is dead and buried.  <br>So even though this restaurant review marks my first where I have not even tasted their food I can confidently mark one star based &#34;around the rest of the user experience touch-points&#34;.

We drove over an hour to have dinner here for my birthday. I was so excited as I had read about all of their small plate, low carb, and healthier options. We had an issue getting seated. It was like they kept skipping over us. When we did get seated I think our waitress had Alzheimer&#39;s. She was super nice, but hella forgetful. Not great when you&#39;re a server. The wine we ordered never came until we asked for it AGAIN. So we had half eaten plates (and fully finished appetizer) prior to getting our wine. My tuna poke was inedible. The tuna itself tasted freezer burnt and the avocado was BROWN and mushy. I sent it back. Unfortunately by the time our waitress came back I had just given up on the idea of dinner. They did remove it from my bill, thankfully. We ordered cheesecake to go- they accidentally brought it to the table plated. We waited another 10-15 minutes for boxes. I came hungry and excited and I left still hungry and disappointed. The two stars were for the low carb cheesecake. It was a dream and the egg roll sampler wasn&#39;t too shabby either.

Oh yeah. My cheese quesadilla was great in the restaurant and heated up great 2 days later Diane made them and oh oh oh. Sooooooo good. Amazing!!!!when the chef knows how to make them. They are wonderful eating st the restaurant  one 2 days later still tasting great <br>Thanks Cheesecake for Diane. Do not let her go !!!!!!&#39;nn

The Cheesecake Factory has great food. They give you a lot and I usually have to take carry outs. I usually get the salmon. Sometimes I get the small plates. It&#39;s kind of pricey, but you do get a lot, and the ambience is great.

Our bartender Phil was amazing! He was very accommodating and offered anything and everything he could possibly get us. I felt very relaxed and cormforable at the bar. He brought us bread even though we didn&#39;t order any food. Also the manager Scott was very sweet and offered us spots at the bar when the wait was long. I had a great experience and recommend the cucumber martini with gin!!!
I really enjoyed the Cheesecake Factory the place was clean the staff was nice the menu was awesome me and my wife will definitely go back again in the near future for their brunch
I usually love this place but the service is bad and half of the food wasn&#39;t available . Our waitress didn&#39;t talk and was very quiet with an attitude.

Very good meal!   Cozy winter dinner with my girlfriend. The music is a little loud and there is usually a wait (my only complaints). <br><br>Avocado egg rolls are yummy. My next meal will be miso salmon. I&#39;ve heard it&#39;s great. Entrees are $12-25 and more homemade tasting than your typical chain restaurant.

I have eaten here at the cheesecake factory 5 times now. I have sampled my way through the menu and of course the desserts as well. The entrée items I have ordered seem to be on the heavier side, meaning creamy with thicker sauces. The portions are good, if not large. The Santa Fe salad is huge. Desserts are also good. The homemade strawberry shortcake was really good and enough for two to easily share. Service is spotty; some days are better than others.  This a very loud restaurant and it&#39;s often hard to have a conversation with someone across from you. As for the cheesecakes....A+

Ok.. so I&#39;ve never eaten at the Cheesecake Factory due to the lines being ridiculously long and the wait times estimating over 2 hours... every time I go. However, I do go straight to the cheesecake line and I&#39;m in and out. I&#39;ve tried just about all the cheesecakes and they&#39;re delish. But the Oreo cheesecake is to die for! Very moist and delectable! One piece is $7.95, but the piece is very large. It&#39;s actually shareable if your into sharing lol. Good place to come for slices of cheesecake. They also sell whole cheesecakes for about $55.00 or so.

Worst customer service took an hour to get my food the waitress she was giving us an attitude never coming back there they are so unorganized I was waiting there for almost an hour there&#39;s people coming after me they getting seated before us without reservation till I talk to the manager and I still waited more the worst place ever. N

Okay let me start by saying, no I haven&#39;t tried their actual food, but I did order some cheesecake to go, and although the cheesecake is amazing! Original and red velvet! <br>The thing I didnt like about this place, was not only how crazy and hectic it was, but how unorganized it was, I had to wait almost an hour for my cheesecake and while waiting I was being smooched by random stranger also waiting for their cheesecake. So even though their cheesecake was good I dont know if it was worth waiting in that crammed space and almost an hour for.

Called ahead to let them know we had a party of 10 at 9pm, 2 hours before closing. They rudely informed us they would not accommodate us due to our party being far too large and too close to closing stating there was &#34;nothing they could do...&#34;<br><br>Consistently terrible service and customer care. Please avoid this place at all costs.

The wait for Cheesecake is always 1+ hours. There is no room for guests to be waiting and the buzzer does it work outside the restaurant. Leaving guests to be crowded and uncomfortable in the lobby area. There are only 5 seats for people to wait when there&#39;s more than 30 people waiting at a time.

The Cheese Cake restaurant in Novi has horrible service. I have never been more disrespected in my life. I wanted to purchase two gift cards and was told to go wait in line behind 10 who were buying cheesecake. I was already at the register. When I got back to to register after waiting 30 minutes in line. Was asked what do I want. Well you told me to get back in line. I want to gift cards. After that asked Brittany that&#39;s her name a question and before I could say anything she told me with her finger up one minute!!!! Gave me my gift cards not knowing which one had what amount on each. Cheesecake Factory in Novi Michigan can kiss my BLACK ASS!! Will never come back and had to wait 21/2 hours at that.

Honestly run of the mill food.  Way Way over priced and overrated. Chicken Alfredo for $21.00.  come on!  Waitress was nice and fast.  I will never come back or recommend.  Place is clean but if you like getting gouged, this is your place.  Texas Rolls, Fried Mac&amp;Cheese (apps), one Chicken Alfredo, 3 Blue Moons and 1 piece of cheesecake= $79.00. I have attached a picture of $15.00 of our bill.  Enjoy!

My fiance and I were excited to come here with our 9 month old baby. My kid loved the mashed potatoes and my fiancé got the chicken Madeira which was amazing as well. I myself got Sheppards pie which was very good. <br><br>Well halfway through my meal i looked over and there was a bug on the table. I don&#39;t know how long it was there for but my awesome waitress called someone over to clean it up. Her name was Stephanie and she did an amazing job! <br><br>However; as bad as the bug situation was I kind of looked past it. The icing on the cake where it went bad was when the gentleman wiped it off the table and lifted it OVER the top of my plate. I am not one to get someone in trouble so i stopped eating immediately and had my waitress box up my food to be nice and pretend nothing happened. When a different waitress walked by I asked her to discard the food and just get rid of it. <br><br>The food was great don&#39;t get me wrong. This was just a bad experience for our first time here. We also got Chris&#39;s cheesecake which was incredible. I just don&#39;t want this review to turn away people because one man made a mistake.
Just another chain restaurant with an overinflated menu long wait and lackluster product.

I went here last night for a girlfriends reunion. It&#39;s enough said about the long wait of this location. I was told to wait about 70 min when I got there at 6pm Friday night (probably peak hours). The staff were helpful and relatively patient. The estimated time is accurate. Our waitress was very friendly and cheerful, she also offered to take pictures for us. For food, I ordered the shrimp and chicken gumbo which couldn&#39;t be better! We shared two cheesecakes: mango something and chocolate truffle cake, both are ok.

The Cheesecake Factory is a family favorite for us. We come here for special events and nice meal. The Cheesecake Factory is a bit pricy but good for a once in a while dinner. I recommend going right when the open for no wait or a shorter wait. I believe peak hours are at 1:00. The Saturday and Sunday brunch menu is very tasty. They also introduced a new skinnylicious menu with low cal options. No matter what you get it&#39;s always good we&#39;ve had no regrets with food options, EVER. Today I the shrimp soft tacos. They were good but cold. I thought they would be grilled or something. The waiters are always super friendly. We got the same waitress twice in a row with our visits 4 months apart (funny right?). We also  got the chocolate hazelnut crunch cheesecake and then regular carrot cake, both we fantastic. We&#39;ll for sure be back. And we always recommend it!

One of my favorite restaurants to go to! The menu has an option for everyone. The dessert is amazing! Even the simple original cheesecake is delicious. The service is great, I&#39;m always happy with my waiter/waitress. I wish I could make reservations in advance because this place is almost always packed.
I went here for my birthday and it was amazing. Every single thing we ordered was amazing. There was a really long wait, but I think it was worth it! Will definitely go back!

A lot of bad reviews are about slow service or wait times. Come on, it&#39;s the Cheesecake Factory. You should know to expect that. This place is always busy at dinner no matter what day of the week, but especially on weekends. The factory nachos with chicken are easily the best nachos I&#39;ve ever had. If you haven&#39;t ordered them, get them as an appetizer to share or a full meal for yourself. It easily fed 5 people when I went. I got the parmesan chicken with mashed potatoes and green beans, which was excellent. I also recommend the cheddar stuffed burger. Very messy, but worth it. My favorite cheesecake is the celebration flavor, but every flavor I&#39;ve had is great. Love coming here, just don&#39;t expect anything to be fast.

Horrible service!  Ordered delivery through their partner DoorDash and food never showed up.  When I called Cheesecake Factory they seemed disinterested in helping me and left me on hold almost 10 minutes before a manager picked up the phone. Needless to say I had to call American Express to get the charge removed.
The Cheesecake Factory is loud, busy, and the food is quite greasy, but the cheesecake is so top-notch that it deserves a full five stars regardless of its shortcomings--yes, it&#39;s THAT good!

We went here for my birthday dinner on a Thursday evening. They do not accept reservations so we had to wait (boo). I could see not reserving during peak times or days.... but a Thursday? It took about 20 minutes for us to be seated after walking in. Another 5 to order drinks. Another 10 to actually receive the drinks. Everything took time. It&#39;s a big place with a lot of tables so it is not completely unexpected. The whole meal took 2 hours. <br><br>For an appetizer we ordered the dynamite shrimp and it was tasty!! The entrees were a decent size and we had plenty to take home. The cheesecake slices are big, so plan to share. We ordered the oreo one for there. (warning: it has some sort of cherry filling in it. we did not know this and ended up scraping it off because we did not like it) We also got the tuxedo slice to go. SO DELICIOUS. It was amazing the next day.<br><br>Prepare to wait. Prepare to shop while you wait. Prepare to wait once you are seated. Slow moving, but a fun time.

I feel like this place has gone down in quality after being open for a couple years, I had the lunch portion salmon and it was OK nothing more. the prices just don&#39;t go with what is being put out on the table I mean don&#39;t get me wrong the cheesecakes are worth every penny but the food quality and presentation has dramatically changed but yet the prices are still the same. And they took off my favorite appetizer off the menu which was the sushi roll. But it comes to the fact that I would only go here for lunch now if I absolutely had too. Other than that I&#39;ll stick to taking a cheesecake to go!
Ordered to go over an hour ahead &amp; 15min past my order time and waiting.  There is no point in ordering ahead

I cannot stand mediocre restaurants that try to put out an image of exclusivity when they are no better than your neighborhood Applebee&#39;s.<br><br>We walked into an empty restaurant at 10:45 on a Sunday morning  (45 minutes after they open) and were told that it was a 30 minute wait. I watched this happen for the next 40 minutes until there were more people waiting to be sat than there were people actually at tables. In the meantime we are watching the waitstaff, barstaff and host staff socialize in the empty dining area. <br><br>We finally were sat and the food was decent (not bad, but not worth the wait). I must note that ALL of our plates were too hot to touch. For anyone who has not worked in the food industry: this means your food sat under a heat lamp for at least 5 minutes. Restaurants don&#39;t have &#34;plate warmers&#34;. <br><br>As we left we saw that the wait was well over an hour (for lunch!!)  which could have been prevented by moving things along starting with the people who arrived earlier. <br><br>Management: if you are listening and care- there are better ways of running your front of the house. There were a lot of other irritated people waiting to be sat who had the same grumblings as me. <br><br>We will not be back.

We were finally able to go here without having to spend half the day in line. It was in the middle of the week around 6 pm and the wait was a little less than an hour which is decent considering how busy they still are. <br><br>The service at every Cheesecake Factory restaurant I&#39;ve been to is better than average and it was very good when we went. I had the Cajun pasta and it was quite good, I had no leftovers so that&#39;s a good sign. <br><br>I had to get some cheesecake while we were here and I went with their strawberry cheesecake. It&#39;s one of my favorite cheesecake flavors now hands down.
Waited 2 hrs for table, food was not worth the price or wait times. Small portions, I can get way better meals elsewhere. Best part about this place is the cheesecake, just get some to go.

Only rating one star to leave a review. It&#39;s a shame because the food is quite good, but the last couple times I&#39;ve been I&#39;ve had an upset stomach! Also, in the restroom others stated the food was good but upset their stomach as well. Not okay and will certainly not be coming back! One of the women was actually staff and stated,&#34;This is why I don&#39;t recommend eating here&#34;. She had an upset stomach.

Last week we drove almost 3 hours to come eat here and we finally get seated server was very short ,slow and it&#39;s us, rushed when ordering and never come back to the table to refill of anything to drink till after dinner was done by the time dinner came mash potato was hard , meatloaf was dry. Cheesecake has never disappointed and I typically travel and always drive to find the Cheesecake Factory but Novi location really bit the bullet.

We went there on a Friday night at about 6 PM. It was super crowded but they had an excellent system to get customers in and out. We were seated with in 10 minutes. I ended up ordering the appetizers which included the edamame the chicken samosas and Korean cauliflower. I would say that this place was average but because we ordered appetizers it didn&#39;t cost a lot. Our waiter was friendly enough however there was such a crowd in and out we didn&#39;t get service as fast as we could. It was interesting to look around the decor was okay. Overall it was okay nothing special..including the cheesecake.

Ordered a slice of cheesecake and tiramisu online. The one time I do not look at my order before leaving the restaurant, this is what I received for tiramisu. Way to plate it. Appealing, wouldn&#39;t you say?

It is too bad that this facility simply doesn&#39;t value its customers time.  An hour and 15 minutes to get a simple order because of an &#34;issue with the Caesar salad&#34;.  No apology.  Just someone rude handling it.  2 hours after? Still not done.

Arrived @ opening 11:00 am, the cocktail drinks are a ruse <br>tall attractive drinking glasses, lots of garnishment but little<br>alcohol . My Stuffed Mushrooms, Bang Bang Chicken and <br>Shrimp was very tasty ! spicy with a Thai Curry sauce.<br>Our spring roll sampler platter was also flavorful.<br>Great host staff and charming waitress Emily.<br>Loved the music, the overall atmosphere.
Nice setting and good service. Had a veggie burger, beef burger and Alfredo pasta with chicken. Everything was just average.

My boyfriend and I dined here the other night for my birthday. We&#39;ve been here a couple times in a past and loved it. <br><br>While the wait was an hour for Saturday afternoon, we didn&#39;t mind at all. We snagged a pager and shopped the mall for an hour and when we came back our pager when off. When we came back the wait was over three hours long so make a day of it and understand that you will most likely have a wait. <br><br>We got placed at a two seater table at one end of the restaurant. Perfect spot because we were out the way in the very crowded restaurant. <br><br>Menu is humongous and actually has page numbers.  I ordered the chicken tacos that came with a side of veggies. 3 corn shell tacos stuffed with chicken and pico. Yum!  <br><br>They give you bread to munch on while you wait and it&#39;s to die for! <br><br>We had a Carryout of the kahlua cheesecake and it was heavenly! <br><br>We will definitely be back for special occasions. It&#39;s about an hour drive from my house. Service has always been great- as well as the food.

This was my second visit to the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s a busy place and always crowded, so I suggest you plan to wait when you go, but it&#39;s worth the wait! First of all the menu has 21 pages! Needless to say it has many varieties of food from appetizers to salads to entrées of all nationalities. I had the baked potato soup and the Tomato Basil Pasta for my entrée. Both were excellent. The bread basket was filled with French and pumpernickel bread which was divine. Unfortunately, we didn&#39;t have room for dessert, although we had thoughts about coming back later to get cheesecake to take home, but we&#39;ll save that for another day. We&#39;ll definitely go back and try one of the many other menu items.

The wait time for my carry out order was longer than expected. I ordered the Carne Asada Steak, Sheila&#39;s Chicken and Avocado Salad, Godiva Chocolate Cheesecake, and Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;Mores Galore. Of course the highlight of every of my Cheesecake Factory visits are the cheesecakes. But this time I got to enjoy eating the rich and velvety slice of heaven in the comfort of my bed. Solid cheesecake as always.

Went in there with a friend and waited our turn to be seated. However we sat down and waited for about ten minutes until our waitress approached us.  She didn&#39;t check on us until we were finished with our meals. Although, they were really busy but still. The hot spinach and cheese dip was good but not the best I&#39;ve had. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs as my meal, and it was not that good. Definitely not worth the price I paid for. Next time I think I&#39;m going to skip this place and go elsewhere. I don&#39;t mind spending the money if I get good food and service.

A group of us went to the Cheesecake Factory while we were Christmas shopping. It was free cheesecake day but we were told not for PAYING costumers only for people lined up at the door. After we ate only half our salads to save room for cheesecake we were told it would be 45 minutes to get cheesecake! They were giving free cheesecake to people paying nothing! Manager called over and said they were overwhelmed by the event. So we left with no cheesecake. The manager did offer to give us a piece but it would take a few minutes we told him we had paid our bills already. Very unorganized event and poor management! Paying customers should take presidence over unpaying

The food and service made the 45 minute wait worth it! Coldest day of the year so far but this place was packed! Shrimp Jambalaya and Red Velvet Cheesecake! Yumm so good! Our server Christopher was bomb! I sucked down 4 glasses of water and he never left it empty! Fun!

My first and only experience with Cheesecake Factory was unsatisfactory. Cheesecake topper for my daughters sweet 16 cake came out looking like an unreadable blob. Had to go back up there to have it remade the night of the party while the staff scrambled around completely unorganized.

The reception service is horrible at this Cheesecake Factory In Novi, MI. I&#39;ve gone to the one in Chicago several times &amp; they are great. If you questions the reception staff - watch out- they&#39;ll push you down the list. They are unorganized have no order on how to take names of parties to be seated. It&#39;s chaotic!!  <br>The martinis are wonderful! The bartenders are wonderful. The wait staff is a hit or miss on any given day. Some are friendly and introduce themselves with a smile others lack motivation and don&#39;t seem to want to be there. <br>The food is good. Every time I&#39;ve eaten at the one in Novi the foods been good however I&#39;d gladly pay more money for better service &amp; good food anywhere else. Needless to say- we had to go to apple store at twelve oaks &amp; that&#39;s why we decided to put our names in to eat at Cheesecake Factory- come convenience!! I dont recommend this restaurant. Bonefish grill is much better more organized friendlier better food &amp; service!!<br>STAY AWAY!! BEWARE!!

Who in their right mind wouldn&#39;t like Cheesecake.<br><br>The best time to go here, is anytime before 5pm. They have lunch specials that are up to $5 off the dinner price. <br><br>Of course with the name like Cheesecake Factory, the cheesecake is on point. You can order any different kind and you will surely be impressed.<br>The service here is pretty average for a restaurant that is as busy as this place is. Be careful of the time you go, the typical busy weekend/nights are busy. Your wait may be longer then you want it to be, however it is for sure worth it. <br><br>I suggest eating the cheese cake no mater what, even if your lactose. It&#39;s that good!

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory several times in several different cities. On this visit I ordered the Mac and Cheese burger.  I ordered it medium well, but it was burnt on one side when it came out and the beef patty was significantly smaller than the bun.  The waitress was very apologetic and returned it to the kitchen.  She left the fries for me to nosh on while I waited.  My friend had ordered the shrimp platter so I ordered that as a replacement.  I&#39;m actually glad the burger was burnt.  The shrimp was very good.  I even liked the coleslaw.   I placed a takeout order for a slice of carrot cake, caramel pecan turtle cheesecake, and the salted caramel cheesecake.  They were delicious.  You can&#39;t go wrong with any of their desserts.  My combined visits here are a 4.  Some have been better than others.  Our waitress on this visit was great also.
The only downside is that the wait time on any day is ridiculously long. Other than that, a whole variety of great food. Try to come during the weekday as the weekend could be hell for the wait.

I went with a group of 8. We arrived around 5:00 on an evening that was busy with holiday gatherings and shoppers. We only had to wait about 20 minutes to be seated. Timing seems to be everything with this place. Though, since it&#39;s in the mall, waiting a couple of hours, as happens on weekends and later in the evening, may not bother everyone. <br><br>The service was great. Our waitress was knowledgeable and attentive. She knew the menu and the drinks well and made good suggestions. <br><br>The food was okay. Based on recommendations here, we tried the nachos. While it was a huge portion and easily shared among 8, the flavor was so so. As was the calamari and the avocado egg rolls. I ordered the grilled fish tacos, recommended by a friend, and they were also just okay. The rice served with them was bland and was not hot on my plate. The black beans were very good. The tacos themselves were well presented, but their flavor was boring. What should have been a contrast of textures, chewy shells, crunchy cabbage, tender fish, just didn&#39;t have enough contrast. It seemed as if nothing was held at the right temperature or that the tacos had been made up and sat for a long time before serving. <br><br>At my table I overheard several similar comments on the food, well-flavored salmon, but overcooked, another cold side dish. Perhaps this was an off night, or maybe the sheer number of menu items makes it hard to do anything too well? <br><br>Since I was off to another event following dinner, I didn&#39;t have any dessert, but if I go back I think that&#39;s what I&#39;ll stick to since it&#39;s in the name.

Stopped in for dinner this past Friday, which ultimately led to the updating of my previous review. <br><br>In my former CF experiences, the wait was long, the food was so so and the service was always decent. And for the strangest reason, nothing off of that gigantic menu ever seemed to sit well in my stomach. <br><br>This Friday, I met up with some girlfriends and was looking forward to a great night. For starters, the wait was finally reasonable! 30 minutes for a Friday night. Huge contrast to the one and two hour waits that used to be the norm. <br><br>For starters, I ordered the fried Mac and cheese and for my entree I had the southwest chicken sandwich (not sure if that&#39;s the actual name but you get the gist lol).  We were so caught up in conversation that I never realized my appetizer never came out and suddenly our entrees began to appear. Our server (I want to say her name was Mandy) came and asked if I ever got it - apparently there was a mix up in the kitchen but they offered the app to me on the house! Who doesn&#39;t love FREE fried cheese! I&#39;m all in.<br><br>My sandwich was good, I REALLY enjoyed my salad. I think it might&#39;ve been the balsamic dressing...but whatever it was it was the bomb. Fried Mac was also good as well. Fast forward to the end of the night, I noticed my app wasn&#39;t taken off the bill, and of course I had to overthink myself into wanting to make a big fuss on a busy Friday....so I didn&#39;t say anything. It&#39;s the thought that counts right? I assumed she must&#39;ve put everything in as we ordered and forgot to comp it maybe? Either way I appreciated the effort to make things right - my fault for not opening my mouth to do anything but shovel more fried cheese into my face! <br><br>Rounded everything out with raspberry lemon cheesecake, which is proving to be my favorite cheesecake that they offer. AND to top it all off, no stomachache! I couldn&#39;t believe it. All in all, successful night out! Food was good, service was great, deserving of an updated review. I&#39;ll be back again!

We went here for brunch this Sunday and every visit is great but our server Cameron G made it amazing, he was great, very attentive, and didn&#39;t miss a beat. Thanks so much Cameron for making our visit awesome, oh and of course the food was yummy :-)

2/15/19 The wait to be seated was unbelievable, but it was extremely busy. (More on this to come) The waiter (reminds me of Jack Black, sorry I&#39;m bad with names), was great, dude smiled, engaging, quickly addressed concerns. The cheesecake was terrific. We where a party of 4, 2 adults and 2 kids. The food was warm at best. My plate was cold! Now since it was so busy I just knew all of the food would be hot. I was dead wrong. Waiter and management apologized and address the issue, however this was a terrible first/last experience. Recap would have been less then 2 stars, if were not for the waiter (Jack Black look-a-like) being great, everyone else liked the food, and terrific Cheesecake. Note: I based my more than 20% tip on Jack Black&#39;s customer service.<br><br>Not going back

I needed a sugar free cheesecake for Christmas last minute when the first place I ordered from screwed up my order. I was grateful they did have one. But I waited an extremely long time in line to pick it up. They had lines around the restaurant. I couldn&#39;t believe how little planning went into creating a system to handle the demand. I was very disappointed.

This place used to be great when it first opened.<br>Last few experiences have been disappointing to say the least.<br>Insanely slow service (1+ hour wait for food when the restaurant is nearly empty).<br><br>The general manager is extremely patronizing and rude. Not sure how this guy became a manager in the service industry but it definitely wasn&#39;t due to his customer service skills.<br><br>They also don&#39;t take reservations - I&#39;m sure this is a corporate policy but to tell people that you cannot make a reservation for a large group coming from out of town is absurd.  There should always be exceptions to the rule for these situations, as many other restaurants have. Instead the policy is &#34;you and your 8 guests will have to drive two hours and then stand in line for 4 more hours to eat - because we hate people using our establishment for special occasions and don&#39;t want your business.&#34;<br><br>This place will survive on the reputation that other locations built and nothing more. This location is tarnishing the Cheesecake Factory brand.<br><br>Very unfortunate.

I like to always ensure that I give a constructive criticism if needed for a restaurant or hotel. However, this was the worst! I ordered to go and was forced to go into the restaurant and a half an hour to pick up my order. No one ever came out to my car there for negating the term curbside.<br>While standing in line, on Easter weekend, I was I was told that they may not have scheduled someone. Reaching the cashier I was notified that my order I was not showing up in the system. This means that the Cheesecake Factory needed to place and cook my order even though I placed the order 45 minutes prior to my arrival. The entire of time my car sat out front, with my purse in it because I thought I was going in for a quick pick up and leave.<br><br>I am only giving a pre-emptive, hoping that my food just a turbo when I try to eat it later. One of the associates was more than kind.<br><br>This was a less than great experience

When we&#39;re in this area we always come here however the wait is not a legit time frame to wait that&#39;s a disappointment when  you drive a good distance like we did just to go to the cheesecake Factory and I only did because it a my husband birthday.  The waiter we had was new on the floor,  so our order got messed up but thankfully a lady named Stacy came and helped out and everything was great after that.  Whoever Stacy is hopefully the managers see my review and we thank you so much for your prompt hospitality. <br><br>Thank you again
Save your money and go to a restaurant that knows how to serve food and take care of customers <br>We were a party of four and all agree we will not return

Went here after months of dieting for a bodybuilding competition and let me say if you&#39;re going for a &#34;cheat meal&#34;, over the top, ridiculously unhealthy meal it DOES NOT DISAPPOINT! Started off with some kind of fruity blended alcohol drink, then a got the Mac &amp; cheese burger with sweet potato fries, and ended the night trying the carrot cake and the peanut butter butterfinger cheesecake. Everything was amazing. I have been wanting to go back ever since.

I have been here several times. Long waits when they first opened but as people got their fix their waits slowed. I like their low calorie menu, it&#39;s filling and the portions are just. I had the veggie burger from the low calorie menu. It was absolutely great. We also had the egg roll sampler the sauce on the sampler are worth keeping when your fries come. At first the waiter brought the wrong Burger, instead of the veggie burger however the manager came over and apologized offered me some free items and fixed the veggie Burger. Overall I am impressed with the Cheesecake Factorys Service,  it&#39;s not really the service when everything goes smoothly it&#39;s the service when things go wrong that matter.
Horrible service for average overly priced food.<br>I have pre-ordered a cheesecake twice for pick-up and both times have ended up waiting for them to go get it from the back.

Absolutely atrocious service the last few times I was here. What should have been a simple order ahead and pickup of a cheesecake turned into a frustrating experience. It took me 3 calls and 20 minutes to book a cheesecake for a family event. When I went for the pick up, it was not ready and it took 15 minutes as the staff was simply not interested in paying attention. Their handling of the rush during evenings is also rude and inefficient. I will strongly advise to skip this location. If you want cheesecake, just get their&#39;s from Kroger!

It is hard to believe that yesterday was my first experience with the Cheesecake Factory. This is due in part to the tremendously long wait times each time my wife and I attempted to visit. This is also the reason why I only gave four stars. The restaurant is located within Twelve Oaks Mall in Novi, MI. As mentioned previously, there is always a long wait to be seated so bring your patience. We were once told that it would be over an hour to seat two people. My wife decided to take me for my birthday so we gave it another try. Fortunately, the wait was only about 30 minutes. The staff were all very pleasant and made great recommendations. I chose the Chipotle Chicken Pasta dish and my wife selected the Spicy Cashew and Chicken dish. The food came out within a reasonable time and both dishes were exceptional! I now understand why the wait is always so long. For desert we opted for Strawberry Cheescake and Carrot Cake Cheesecake slices. They too were phenomenal! I would absolutely return for dinner! Enjoy!

I&#39;ll start out on a positive note. The cheesecakes are phenomenal, especially the Oreo Xtreme one. However....<br><br>My husband and I have ordered the same thing for the last 3 years: the BBQ chicken salad. <br><br>Every time we go, the salad quality diminishes significantly. For example, they used to put a ton of chicken, corn, black beans, etc. on the salad. Now, they put such little portions of each that it tastes like I&#39;m eating purely lettuce. <br><br>Just to put it in perspective, we used to drive 45 minutes just to get this salad as &#34;take out&#34; because we liked it so much. Now, we don&#39;t even consider going here anymore. <br><br>Overall, the food quality has steadily declined. It really is a shame.

I usually only wrist great reviews, not this time. This is one of my favorite<br>Restaurants, but this time was different.<br>The server was not good very indifferent could care less.  Did not serve food as it was ordered.  My friend ordered a hamburger with no Mayo, they took it back, and it not return to the table the server said she was checking on it <br>Well it did come after we had desert <br><br>By the way the restroom was a disgrace

I LOVE the Cheesecake Factory and was so happy when they opened one in Michigan finally. It opened in August and I didn&#39;t get there until today, because of the crazy lines... Finally got my parents to wait in line today and I skipped out of work a bit early. <br><br>(they got there around 230pm and would have been seated around 345pm, by the way, which isn&#39;t awful. This was a Friday afternoon. They only seat you when your whole party is there, though, so we were seated at 415pm when I arrived) <br><br>I got my favorite dish, the Pasta da Vinci. For dessert we ordered a slice of the Caramel Pecan Turtle cheesecake and one of the Adam&#39;s peanut butter. Caramel one was just okay, the PB one was good. <br><br>Waitstaff was very nice and on top of things for the most part. I did order no onions in my pasta and got onions, but not a big deal. <br><br>As much as I love CF, I&#39;m going to wait a bit before going back. It was just too crowded for my taste, and normally I don&#39;t have an extra 2 hours to spare. But definitely go if you have the time (and money, because CF is expensive, too - $11.95 for lunch portions though you get a lot of food, $7.50 per cheesecake slice).
