Horrible customer service I ordered a cheesecake here and I receive the wrong cheesecake. When I called the store and talked to the manager who had a awful attitude he told me that he would send out a gift card. He said there is no way that I would know if you ordered a cheesecake from here. Like wtf where do you think I got the cheesecake from. Piss poor service with piss poor employees. Wish I could give -20 stars
So many options on the menu it&#39;s insane. Usually a good idea to come during happy hour and sit in the bar area. Half off apps, smaller menu so you won&#39;t get overwhelmed with choices.

Came here for the first time ever yesterday, for dinner with a friend. I wasn&#39;t expecting much from a giant chain restaurant, especially because a huge menu usually means mediocre food. Well, I was blown away. Terrific food and great service! From appetizer to entree to dessert, it was a truly delicious meal. Now I understand why Cheesecake Factory gets such long lines! I&#39;ll be back as soon as I can.

Service was horrible I would give it 0 stars if I could.  It took us over an hour to get our food and they tried to tell us that it was because their kitchen was to small for how big the restaurant is.  We usually love Cheesecake Factory but this one has ruined our taste for them.

Almost two hour wait... watered down tasting martini... burrito was actually COLD on the middle even though actual plate it was served on was extremely hot....however, cheescake was delicious and waitress was great!

I went several times to The Cheesecake Factory. The first time was in 2015 in Chicago and after that I am always looking for this restaurant near me. My favorite food is the cheesecake for dessert. I love the traditional flavor and the others meals that I tasted were very good, delicious and generous portions. The atmosphere is great, the place is beautiful and the waiters are very kind. The only thing that I don&#39;t like is the long wait. You need to have patience but I am sure thats worth it. Unfortunately where I live doesn&#39;t have Cheesecake Factory and for suggestion I think that this restaurant needs to open in Perrysburg.
First and last time eating here. Cold dry boring chicken tacos served with pickled vegetables, yuck!  and expensive!

Yesterday I took my family of six to eat at your establishment we had a very long wait the whole total experience took over two hrs. my wife had brussel  sprouts when she got the dish only the leaves off the sprouts were in the dish,any where else we go to get them they always have the whole sprout . I&#39;m paying for the sprout not just the leaves.your prices are outrages what you have to pay for .the coffee for two cups was seven dollars don&#39;t you think that is a little much!!!!!!!!!!!. also i had your burrito grande it had very little sauce on it and the chicken and rice was very dry. (note) the price of the brussel sprouts was $16.00 , don&#39;t you folks think that&#39;s a little ridiculous?also what you charge for your food is nuts, i could have taken my family to another restaurant and it would not have been a $195.00 with tip . also the waitress did not come back to fill our drinks. I hope this review will help you in the future.

Pretty depressing brunch to be honest. The food was just meh at best; did a build your own omelette (goat cheese, mushroom, spinach, bacon). My omelette must have had maybe a teaspoon of goat cheese down at one end (probably a 7&#34; omelette in length), spinach was &#39;crispy&#39;, not sure what happened there, and bacon was tough and chewy and the size of bacon bits. <br><br>My lady friend had the huevos rancheros and that wasn&#39;t a bad dish, although extremely heavy on the black beans.

I had a Caesar Salad, pepperoni pizza, basil and tomato and cheese flatbread, along with a strawberry lemonade and half a glass of white Zinfandel. Everything was delicious and filling and full of flavor. The flatbread was yummy with a nice taste of cheese and basil as the primary flavors. The pizza was nice, hot, melty, and tasty. The lemonade was tart but sweet with a sugar rim that felt classy, and the salad was nice but a little spicy from too much seasonings. The ambiance is nice and warm and classy but not extremely formal. The waitress we had was very polite and made me feel like I mattered. The cheese cake was superb and very decadent. I had the Hershey bar cheesecake with fudge . I really recommend this place and if you want a shorter wait time then either make a reservation or come between 5 and 6 cause after 6 the wait gets long.

I normally enjoy coming here, but not today. I don&#39;t know what happened, or if there was a communication error, but when we were finished eating, the waiter didn&#39;t even ask us if we wanted to go boxes for our leftovers. He just took the plates and there goes $40 of food to the garbage. During our meal, he came to check on us to see if we needed anything. I needed another little cup of ketchup. 20 minutes later, I&#39;m full. A waiter who I&#39;ve never seen before shows up with 2 ketchup cups. Well, I don&#39;t need them anymore! Very slow service. And no food to take home. Disappointed :/

Horrible customer service! tried to place a pick up order &amp; they put me on hold for 20 minutes without any explanation. when I asked to talk to the manager, he was very arrogant. apparently they were very &#34;busy&#34;. too busy to take an order which would take them less than a minute! horrible!

On a return visit, many of the challenges associated with opening the popular eatery have largely been worked out. The wait was considerably shorter, only 20 minutes during lunch instead of some of the much-longer times reported here. The pace within the restaurant was still fast but more relaxed and less frenetic and confused.  <br><br>Within the restaurant, diners happily met up with family and friends to share large appetizers, big salads, large-portioned entrées, and luscious desserts. This time around, I had the Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Vera Cruz, a dish that included a small portion of fish, shrimp, several spears of asparagus and white rice in a tomato, olive and caper sauce. This dish is on the separate Skinnylicious menu for diners looking for something healthier or saving calories for the dessert to come. Unfortunately, the fish and asparagus, while well-prepared, were rather bland. The shrimp was crisp and more flavorful.<br><br>On a mission to taste all the desserts here (I succeeded in sampling all the pizzas and most salads at California Pizza Kitchen so I felt up to the challenge), I tried the Hershey&#39;s Bar Chocolate Cheesecake and sampled the Ultimate Red Velvet Cheesecake. Oh my! The chocolate cheesecake featured layers of chocolate cake with chocolate cheesecake in between. Chocolate chips added another chocolately dimension to the dessert. As for the Red Velvet Cheesecake, I might have found a new favorite. The bite that I had was an explosion of yummy flavor. So very good.<br><br>The waitstaff was friendly, responsive and knowledgeable, and much more confident in the menu (thank you for the dessert recommendation). Take-out continues to be popular - while waiting, I noticed many, many people exiting with large cake boxes and bags of food containers.<br><br>Management, while not as conspicuous as the last visit, was still visible, warm and welcoming.

Love love this place. Lettuce wraps are to die for. I&#39;ve never had a bad experience. Servers are very friendly and well informed on the menu. You have like a million different cheesecakes to choose from. Yum.

We are giving two stars for the cheesecake...everything else was terrible.  Dirty, dirty, dirty!!!  All of our silverware had food still stuck on it, how does this happen? Food on the floor and stained napkins.  We only stayed because we had a gift card and wanted to get rid of it.  Service was terrible and had to ask for new silverware twice.  Switched waitresses in the middle of our dinner and service was very slow.  She was friendly so we tipped well but it was slow and the food was sub-par.  Cheesecake was the only enjoyable part of the dinner.  Will not be back.  Don&#39;t waste your time...get a slice of cheesecake somewhere else that is clean!

Well after reconsidering never dining at this establishment again, my boyfriend had a hankering for some chicken and waffles. So with much grunting but with the promise of as many martnins as I could handle I couldn&#39;t say no.  <br>All I can say about this visit is WOW! Our server Tyler was such a delight. He was nothing less than spectacular! The food came out hot and perfectly cooked. My drink was never empty. I left satisfied and feeling like one can never judge a whole establishment based on one bad dinning experience.<br>So thank you Tyler for being a wonderful ambassador for the cheesecake factory !! Five stars!!!

We visited The Cheesecake Factory for lunch on 08-06-2015.  This was the second time we dined at this location.  <br><br>We were seated promptly as we arrived around 04:00 PM and the place was not busy.  And yet, it took a good 25-30 minutes to get our meals.  The taste of the food was very good.  I actually would rate the food a 4 or 5 star.<br><br>It didn&#39;t appear that this establishment had any management on duty. Two male waiters spent15-20 minutes socializing with two young woman at the table in from of us.  If supervision were present I can&#39;t imagine they would allow this on the dining floor.  At least I would hope not.<br><br>Finding broken toothpicks in your food is un-acceptable.  They lose two stars for this safety hazard alone. My wife ordered a chicken salad sandwich.  I understand they hold each half of the sandwich together with a tooth pick.  However, one should never find a third broken half of a tooth pick INSIDE the sandwich.  Clearly, who ever made the sandwich misplaced the tooth pick and simply added an additional one.<br><br>Again, I have no complaints about the food.  It does appear however, that the Cheesecake Factory is missing some checks and balances in the managing of this restaurant.

This was my first experience with The Cheesecake Factory. The check-in process was pure chaos. There where people everywhere with no visible line or oder. We had to let each other know who was in line for cheesecake, waiting to be checked in, or waiting to he seated. <br>After about 70 mins we were seated. It took another 10 mins for us to get out drinks. By the time we stood around in that incredibly cramped space for 80 minutes, all we wanted was water! We couldn&#39;t believe how long it took to get that. The waitress was pleasant but not very attentive. She must&#39;ve walked by us every 30 seconds or so but didn&#39;t check on our drinks or ask how our food was after we got it. <br>On to the food. Although it was overpriced, the food did taste very good. We all really liked it. <br>Whe were quite surprised at the amount of the check when 3 out of 4 of us ordered water and 2 of us shared an entree. I mean, the food was good but there was nothing about it that stood out enough to warrant the prices. <br>In the end, if I&#39;m in the area, I will most likely return for a piece of cheesecake (to go) but other than that, I don&#39;t think I&#39;d go back again.

I understand that the restaurant is very busy.  The problem is when you&#39;re told there is an hour wait for dinner, your give a pager, you come back in an hour, and then are told it will be another 15 minutes, you come back in 15 minutes then are told it will be another 20. When you have young children who are hungry the restaurant really should not lie about seating times. Just tell the truth and a family can plan for when people really get seated.  We went elsewhere as we could not rely on the restaurant to seat us.  Very disappointed.

This place has delicious food and big portions. You can&#39;t go wrong with anything here. My favorite is the avocado rolls. If you love avocado, they are a must and of course cheesecake for dessert. Now, if you are looking for more healthy options they also have a low calorie menu.

I came here to pick up a cheesecake for a friend that was phone ordered and it took them almost an hour to find it. The manager did not even look for the last name on the order and was just giving me a hard time. I wouldn&#39;t give this place my service next time if the food was for free. Restaurant service here was comparable to stopping at a fast food joint in an inner city.<br><br>Don&#39;t remember the restaurant manager&#39;s name but he definitely shouldn&#39;t be in any customer service position and DEFINITELY NOT A RESTAURANT MANAGER!!!

Second chance and this time it was way better. The waiter was so kind and even though there were tons of people he was able to get our order down on time. He was very attentive and made sure we were having a good time on our anniversary. This is the service I experienced the first time and this time when I asked for extra bread he didn&#39;t forget  Thank you James and hopefully that $20 tip made your day.

Not bad. I have always wanted to go here since it opened 3 years ago. Oddly, I just kept forgetting.<br><br>My wife and I went here for dinner on a Thursday night. Good music and beautiful inside.<br><br>My wife ordered the old burger and fries. I ordered the Cajun pasta. Mine was very good. My wife&#39;s burger was ok. &#34;Well done&#34; means burned at this location. The price was around the price of red lobster and Olive Garden.<br><br>All in all, it wasn&#39;t bad. Lots of menu items to try. Next time...
This was the worst dining experience period. Food was terrible, took forever and was cold. Server knew it was obvious and did nothing to rectify it. Never again. Don&#39;t waste your money
Their Monte Cristo sandwich for brunch is to die for. Which is ok, because the portion sizes will kill you slowly anyway. That&#39;s kinda the point of the place.

Wait time: The wait time is ridiculously long and completely unorganized. We were buzzed to be seated after a 40 minute wait just to end up waiting another 15 minutes. They did this to so many ppl that the host stand was crowded with ppl waiting to order a seat and other people asking questions because they were confused about why they weren&#39;t being seated after being buzzed in. The waiting experience was frustrating and crowded.They NEED to start doing reservations.<br><br>Food: food took 30-40 minutes to arrive. The food isn&#39;t worth the price or wait time. Sure it&#39;s good, but other chain restaurants like Red Lobster has wayy better food for the same price and wait time. The menu has a large variety to the point of being overwhelming, and there&#39;s no theme to the place. There&#39;s Cajun dishes , Italian cuisine, classic American and Chinese to name a few. This large variety is probably why their food doesn&#39;t taste as good as it could. I have been here several times and have yet to try a great dish, only good dishes I can get at a cheaper restaurant.<br><br>Ambience: The decor and lighting is beautiful. It&#39;s great for an intimate date. <br><br>Service: all of the workers are incredibly patient and helpful. Waiters/waitresses were friendly and did their job the best they could.

I had lunch here last Friday (4/13/18). I ordered the Shrimp and Chicken Gumbo and a Raspberry Lemonade. Very delicious. I couldn&#39;t decide between the DULCE DE LECHE CARAMEL or the GODIVA CHOCOLATE CHEESECAKE so I ordered them both to take home. I have dined here several times and each time was a great experience.

The food was great, as always. The service was disappointing. However, the manager Jared turned our experience around. He is an asset to your company (&amp; no he&#39;s not a relative or friend - just someone very skilled at taking care of unhappy customers.)

The Pros:<br>-I appreciated that they cut up my son&#39;s grilled cheese in bite size portions.<br>-The fried cauliflower<br><br>The cons:<br>-From the time we sat down at ourto the time we left was two hours and 15 minutes.  And our dessert was ordered to go.  Just really slow.  Including the wait, it was over a 3 hour trip.  Not ideal with an 18 month old.<br>- The menu is way too big.<br>-Kinda grumpy staff.  I asked the person who sat us for a high chair and he said, &#34;someone else will bring you one.&#34; After asking someone else 5-10 minutes later we finally got one.  We just stood awkwardly while we waited.

See every Cheesecake Factory works by the given standard which very nice because the food is always good and you can&#39;t go wrong with it. The problem with this place is the way they manage everything, so the hostess told us the wait time is an hour and we are a party of seven she sat us down after 1:45 minutes! And off course we called the manager who was very kind of some what speeding up the process

Food is great but what&#39;s the point is you have to wait 35-45 minutes for it to arrive and you are too frustrated and full on bread before it even gets to the table. Every time I go, I remember why I don&#39;t return for another six months. The wait time is always ridiculous

Everything about this place has already been told. Long wait lines on weekends - seriously guys, do something about it? May be? The food is good as usual, can&#39;t go wrong with the recipes. Cheesecakes are great as well! But the servers could be more friendly! A brown customer does NOT always mean they will pay you less in tips - try serving them as you would serve other customers! You will get your dues!

Only order a cheesecake to go if you are ok standing in  a mosh pit for literally an hour with no available seating because you need to be standing right by the counter to hear your name called.  The cashiers call your name twice in the loud waiting area of 50 people and then happily give up and put your finished bag to the side, where it stays unless you fight your way to the front to ask about it.<br><br>Did I miss my name being called?  No, they just didn&#39;t have it yet.  Now, if you&#39;re going to say, &#34;Your order will be ready in an hour&#34;, then great, no issue, just be honest.  But when you say my order will be up in 15-20 minutes, that&#39;s not ok.  <br><br>It&#39;s not worth the hassle, they have no organization and a huge lack of efficiency.  It looked like what took so long is the restaurant is always packed with people ordering cheesecake after their meal, and waiters kept cutting in everytime a seated patron ordered a slice, forget the to-go orders that have been waiting.

So my bf and i went two days ago after making a stop at lord &amp; Taylor. We drove from Ann Arbor and i usually have had nothing but good experiences in the past (at the Chicago location). So our server (Cameron G) was nice told us he will be back with bread, after we placed my bf drink order (whiskey smash). Waited and nothing... we ordered a spinach and cheese dip... still no bread. Meanwhile I&#39;m watching the bread being brought to tables all around us. Now i ordered a J Ws Pink lemonade.... and surprise that still came before the bread. Drinks were yummy but definitely couldn&#39;t taste any alcohol... particularly the lemonade! I mean for $10.75 each, they aren&#39;t worth it. Save your money. So he finally brought out our spinach and cheese dip... so i proceeded to ask &#34;can we still have the bread?&#34; And he informed me he was waiting on it to come out from the kitchen. I have served before and understand that you have to wait on the kitchen at times, but it had been well over 30 mins and i literally see servers all around me dropping it off to their tables. So my bf and i had a bet to see if Cameron would bring over the bread. We decided besides the dip that we were going to get a cheese cake! I had to go with the one i normally go with the white chocolate Macadamia nut cheesecake! I was so excited, talking it up to the bf (who isn&#39;t a huge fan of sweets). We get it and take a bite and wow. It sucked bad! It tasted old... the crust had absolutely no crunch to it. It was basically wet. We were so disappointed we left like 75%-80% untouched. He came back and i shared my disappointment. As a server i would have taken the plate to the manager and asked to either refund or offer another piece! He said &#34;better luck next time&#34; after he said &#34;are you guys too disappointed to take it home?&#34; He could care less. But for the price that you are paying for one slice of cheesecake (and those drinks) there should be better service. But i lost the bet! My bf called it we never got the bread but got the bill for every item! I will never make a trip out to a mediocre restaurant such as the Cheesecake Factory here in Michigan.

I ordered take out for the first time at the Novi location and was quoted 25 min. I waited 25 min to pick up my entrees and then waited an additional 25 min to cash out and get my food. I waited a total of 50 min for a freaking burger! Waste of time! Staff at the Togo bar couldn&#39;t offer any help and could not explain where the cashier was. Excuse me but what kind be of business are you running here? If your a business person on lunch break I don&#39;t recommend this location for lunch... You will be highly disappointed like I was.

My hubby &amp; I visited Cheesecake Factory yesterday afternoon around 3:00 for his bday. We had a 30 min wait. Food was very good as it was the first visit I had. Our waitress had several tables she was tending to so checking on us was a bit slow. But she was very good and polite. <br>We had pretzel chicken, pulled pork sandwich &amp; stuffed chicken tortillas.<br>S&#39;mores &amp; raspberry truffle cheesecake. <br>The S&#39;mores was very rich but raspberry was excellent.

After reading through all the previous reviews, we don&#39;t have a ton to add to the conversation.  We thoroughly agree with a lot of the reviews, but we will share our experience nonetheless.<br><br>We have dined here three times since they opened at 12 Oaks Mall.  We didn&#39;t go for the first time until last summer, because of the long waits.  As someone else stated, this place is good, but not wait 3 hours good.  I wouldn&#39;t really wait more than 30 minutes for this place.<br><br>The food here is really good with large portions.  As someone else stated, everything is surprisingly good, but it is also really high in calories.  I am pretty sure I doubled my caloric intake just by eating one meal.  The nice thing is that my wife and I usually will split a meal because the portions are so big and you really have to leave room for the cheesecake.<br><br>The cheesecake is really good, although really expensive for a piece of cheesecake.  I am pretty sure you can buy a pretty good whole cheesecake somewhere else.  We are not huge fans of cheesecake, but &#34;when in Rome&#34;....maybe &#34;when in the Cheesecake Factory&#34;?  Anyway, it is really rich and even when we split a piece, there is some left over.  Last time we got it with ice cream and the ice cream was amazing.  We might actually just get ice cream next time.<br><br>The reason for only getting 3 stars is because of the overpriced items, the close quarters, and the mediocre service.  As stated by others, this place squeezes you in like coach class in a Spirit flight.  You definitely feel like you are sitting at a table with strangers, which may be customary in Europe, but not in America.  The waitstaff all three times have been just alright.  There are long wait times for bread, refills, and the waitstaff we have had has lacked any type of enthusiasm.  I have actually felt more welcomed at a Denny&#39;s.<br><br>Overall, this is a good &#34;once and a while&#34; type place.  We usually come here for special occasions like birthdays or Mother&#39;s days.  If you do come, I suggest splitting a meal and probably a cheesecake as well.  In the end, if it is good enough for Sheldon Cooper it should be good enough for you!

I LOVE THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY SO MUCH!!  Ok, now I feel better.  I&#39;ve been coming here for years, and glad that they finally opened one here in Michigan. I&#39;ve spent the past few years eating at the locations in Phoenix and California, and I&#39;ve never had a bad time or meal here ever.  Finally made it into this place last night, and what a good time it was.<br><br>The wait for this place was crazy, and I totally get why.  It was an hour wait on a Saturday afternoon at like 3:30...when does that happen?  We finally got seated around 4:30 and we were so happy to finally be in.  Mind you, my date has never been to the Cheesecake Factory before, so I had to talk him through the whole process of what to expect.<br><br>The menu is vast and huge, with just about anything for everyone.  The menu reads like a book, with pages and pages of delicious food to choose from.  Steaks, seafood, comfort food and so much more.  They also have a good selection of drinks as well, but I passed this evening.<br><br>We started with these tater tot thingies and they were awesome. Came with a white dipping sauce and we went nuts.  Mind you, we were famished, so that didn&#39;t help either.  My date went with the Chicken Tortilla wraps and I went with the Americana Burger for our main entree&#39;s. We could barely finish our food, and it was so good!<br><br>Our server was awesome. We started out with this one girl and they switched shifts half way through.  Both girls were awesome, very attentive and took excellent care of us.  You wouldn&#39;t have thought they were busy as they were with the awesome service we received.<br><br>I will say this location is a good size, but the one&#39;s I&#39;ve been to out west are at least double the size.  I don&#39;t know that it really affects anything, but I&#39;m used to the ones that are bigger.  Place is well decorated with a decent but small sized bar.  Lobby area can get congested if it&#39;s busy like it was last night.<br><br>I&#39;m really glad the cheesecake factory is here and I will be back in the future!

Your food is delicious as always. Thank you for being awesome! I do have a suggestion and that is if you guys had cheesecake flights. I think it would be cool to sample a couple different ones. Thank you have a wonderful day.

Not impressed with this place. Placed a online order they quoted 25. Get the in 25 min and there&#39;s confusion around my order. I waited an additional 20 mins to get my food, I only have a 30 min lunch break. Hence why I ordered over the phone. Not cool, not impressed. I could&#39;ve just ordered in store and waited the same amount of time. Get my order and I have no napkins, no eating utensils. So I have to eat my veggie burger that fell apart with my hands. Again not how I expected this experience to go. Not placing a phone order from here EVER again.

My friend wanted to come and try it out. I&#39;d never been to this location but I have been to Cheesecake Factories in Chicago and California. Their skinnylicious menu is good but the regular food....nope. You seriously have to fast for three days afterwards because their food is so calorie, fat, and sodium laden. <br><br>Anyway, we arrived on a Sunday at 8:30 pm. I had heard wait times were crazy in the past but it was Sunday night and this place has been open for at least a year now. I went up to the hostess and she told me it&#39;d be an hour and a half wait. I had to have her repeat that because I was afraid my hearing had failed me. You have to be out of your mind to wait that long for food at the Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>We promptly left and had a very nice meal elsewhere after being immediately seated.

HUGE menu, HUGE portions. On their website, they claim that their 250 menu items are made from fresh items, from scratch every day - wow. So I&#39;ll start with the items I love - the dulce de leche cheesecake and the herb crusted filet of salmon. There are a few salmon dishes to choose from but in an attempt to avoid salt-filled foods, I selected the salmon topped with a Lemon Sauce, and served with side Asparagus and Mashed Potatoes. It was so delicious and exactly what I was craving, I also didn&#39;t walk away from that meal feeling like I consumed a week&#39;s worth of calories or in need of water so it was a win all around. In a previous visit, I had a burger and fries and this is what I&#39;ll steer away from in the future. It&#39;s just impossible to enjoy a slice of cheesecake after eating something so unhealthy and salty.

Note: I did not eat in the restaurant; This review is only for the cheesecakes to go - which I got on 3 occasions, and each time was worse than the last. The very last time was the last straw. <br><br>The inside looked pretty nice and the food displayed on the T.V.s looked really good, but I was only there to quickly pick up a cheesecake. I wish I could eat there, but it would be impossible without reservations.<br><br>I went there 3 times and each time was a 40 minute wait (Sunday Nights each time) to stand in a line and get it, but I don&#39;t get why the wait was so long! You asked for the cheesecake, you pay for the cheesecake, why did each person take 5 minutes? I get that you&#39;re busy but when you have a specific counter for cheesecakes, you&#39;d would expect the service could be faster.<br><br>Onto the cheesecakes, I got a pumpkin (pretty good), a traditional (fine), and a chocolate(terrible), in that order. When you&#39;re paying 25-30 dollars per cheesecake, you would hope they&#39;re pretty good, especially with a name like cheesecake factory but I could make a cheesecake 5x that good for half of the price that they charge. <br><br>The chocolate one was by FAR the worst thing I&#39;ve ever eaten. I drove home to Kalamazoo from Detroit. I gave it a 3 hour defrost time, and when my friends started to unbox it- the box literally CRUMBLED because it was SO freezer-burnt that the box was eroding and it literally was crumbling apart as we tried opening it, like some frosty relic. <br><br>The chocolate cheesecake itself was still covered with frost after a 3 hour drive in a warm car. You could tell that it was in deep freeze, because it was even sweaty from de-thawing but still had so much that a mountain of freezerburn-frost still remained. The cheesecake was very dry and crumbly and it wasn&#39;t even that chocolaty. It was hard, dry, and tasted like dust. The other 2 cheesecakes were okay, but nothing special. They didn&#39;t look nearly as good as the pictures as they varied with toppings. They were significantly less freezer burnt, but still had that essence to them. They were only half a step up from a frozen grocery store cheesecake.<br><br>The one thing I can thank Cheesecake factory for is inspiring me to bake my own cheesecakes from now on. They&#39;re cheaper, faster, and taste a whole lot better and fresher.
Over 50min for my carry out. Food was ok. Place is hyped up but always ends up being mediocre.

Very disappointed!   I totally understand not wanting strollers in the restaurant, but seriously,  a 1 month baby can&#39;t have a car seat at the table???? <br>How r we supposed to enjoy our expensive &#34;for what you get&#34; meal, with a baby in your lap?  <br>The person that sat us was very rude and we couldn&#39;t figure out how we were gonna enjoy our  meal with a baby in someone&#39;s lap  the entire time.  <br>We ended up leaving.<br>Very poor customer service.  As I&#39;d he wasn&#39;t bothered one way or another. <br>I know this won&#39;t hurt their business, but still needed to be voiced.    <br>Won&#39;t be back.

The only reason my fiancé and I even decided to dine here was due to our gift card.  I had my reservations due to all the negative reviews but luckily, that&#39;s what helped me have a not so terrible experience.  If you&#39;re going to eat here on the weekend, place your name on the list AND THEN go shopping.  I was told a 70 minute wait time and when we were done shopping 60 minutes in, the hostess was kind enough to check my place in line.  We had 3 people in front of us and then we were up.  15 minutes later our buzzer went off and we handed it in and waited to be seated.  Here is where the issue happened and you could see, due to the rush and enormous line, how unorganized the front desk was.  After waiting another 15 minutes with other couples who also turned in their buzzer and were waiting to get seated, people were being seated before us who were just turning a buzzer in.  Following me?  Had I spoken up sooner the issue would have been addressed but I didn&#39;t think I&#39;d have an issue once the buzzer rang.  Never assume at this place.  Take initiative.  Get your buzzer before you shop.  Inquire in with the hostess when you return.  See where you are in line.  If you&#39;re not seated within 5 minutes after your buzzer goes off, ask the desk what the deal is.  Fortunately, the staff member addressed the issue instantly and we were seated shortly after as well as the other couples that had the similar glitch.  <br><br>The food - can&#39;t complain.  It was hard to choose with their novel  menu but the Steak Diane was pretty darn good and cooked the way I requested.  The Mojito was perfection.  The cheesecake heavenly.  My advice, stick with the simple entrees and ask the server for recommendations.  Can&#39;t go wrong.  Speaking of servers, she was super polite, although service was a little slow.  <br><br>In conclusion - this is the only Cheesecake Factory in Michigan.  Mindboggling, I know.  This is why this restaurant is constantly slammed.  If you plan to eat here, keep in mind that there will be a wait and service will be slow, it&#39;s inevitable.  My advice: don&#39;t arrive starving and impatient.

This is a good place to get a nice meal if you have plenty of time. The wait, in my experience, has never been less than forty five minutes and due to the constant rush of people, service isn&#39;t as speedy as most would prefer. Dinner here can definitely stretch anywhere from 2-3.5 hours if you plan on an appetizer, main meal, and dessert. <br><br>My table split the fried mac &#39;n cheese for an appetizer. Three out of the four were very good, but the fourth wasn&#39;t cooked all the way through. <br><br>I had a salad as my meal, which was good for the most part. I have no complaints, but suggest asking for dressing on the side if you aren&#39;t a heavy dressing person. <br><br>I had lemon raspberry cheesecake for dessert - this was very good and very filling. I took home about half. <br><br>Keep in mind portion sizes are large and do make very good leftovers!

The food is excellent, but the wait is long. The waiting system is quite flawed, but eventually you will get seated. Once you get seated your food and your waiter is fast service. I enjoy this place and wish there was another one in Michigan.

Disappointing experience at this location. Very overpriced, and exceptionally slow. I hate having to push through a throng to leave a restaurant. The hostess was very nice, the server was ok. The woman who ran the food was rude af. They didn&#39;t have a Cuban sandwich, which was what my husband ordered. In all, a mediocre experience at best. We won&#39;t be back. We actually canceled our dessert order because it was taking so long. There are a lot of better dining alternatives.

Crab cakes are the best that I&#39;ve tasted. Perfectly seasoned and not over cooked. Their menu has over 200 items to choose from including a menu if your watching your calorie intake. The Cheesecakes that I tried were all delicious. Lemon Meringue and the Key Lime are highly recommended.
Tell me somone who does not like cheese cake?!?? This place has an amazingly huge variety of cheese cakes leaveing your pallet yearning for more..the only thing i dont like is the wait times...

We were seated and then waited 10 minutes before we asked a waitress for help. My husband was grossed out by his raw burger. The whole fiasco took an hour and a half on a Wednesday. We won&#39;t be back.

Like most others, the Cheesecake Factory was a &#39;have to go here&#39; place when I&#39;d be out of town. Now that I have one in my backyard.. I literally never go!<br><br>It&#39;s not that I changed my mind on the food (well, a little) - it&#39;s just that this CF is not the best iteration of this chain. Somehow, service is *always* slow and barely friendly.  Just like my water is always barely full (i.e. on super empty throughout my meal) and my food is barely warm. <br><br>The waits are long but that&#39;s because this restaurant is tiny, especially considering the size of usual Cheesecake Factories.  I don&#39;t understand why they insist on these ridiculous portion sizes.. one meal is literally three meals. For this reason I stick to items that reheat fairly well (chicken and potatoes, for example, or the pasta davinci), the small plates menu, or a salad. And usually the food is good.. it&#39;s not mind blowing, but it&#39;s good and if prepared the way it&#39;s explained on the menu - it&#39;s consistent.  <br><br>Salads here are pretty spectacular - when they come out correctly. During my most recent attempt at eating here I ordered the kale/quinoa/avocado/cranberry/onion/Brussel sprout salad with grilled salmon. Salmon is fantastic - zero complaints there (get it!). <br><br>The problem is that my salad, which *on paper* sounds well-balanced flavor- and texture wise, ended up being a big plate filled with kale.  They were out of half the ingredients for the salad and long story short; a plate full of raw kale is not all that appetizing.  It&#39;s a consistency and service thing for me. Don&#39;t put out product that&#39;s half-assed, if you&#39;re out of ingredients let people know.. common sense, peeps.<br><br>WINNERS: 1. mushroom soup! 2. white chocolate raspberry cheesecake 3. the breadddd 4. salmon

I haven&#39;t eaten there in years and always had wonderful food and service. This particular time I did not. It was so bad the customer next to me commented and told me how bad the service was feeling sorry for me. I had my three year old with me, he forgot to bring his chocolate milk. Never saw the waiter for long periods. Waited so long, asked other servers for water, coffee, chocolate milk. Our waiter was nowhere to be found. I was frustrated and then they bring my salad without dressing. No waiter around to help me. I stopped eating the salad and waited to get someone&#39;s attention but no one was around. Our waiter, finally,  came so I asked him for dressing and waited even longer for the dressing to arrive. I wanted to just leave that&#39;s how frustrated I was. It took an HOUR and FORTY FIVE MINUTES to eat a small lunch with my child. Service was horrible. I spoke to the manager about it and so he knew why I only tipped $5. That was too high but I am a kind person. <br><br>I will NEVER eat there nor recommend this place again. They all have their heads up their $**!!!

The wait to be seated can be excruciating. Take turns with a friend or eat elsewhere. The menu is overwhelming with options. The lettuce wraps are perfect. I buy a whole cheesecake to take home and freeze half for later. Defrosts in fridge in 2 hours to enjoy later in the month.

I have been to the Cheesecake Factory about three times now. It&#39;s almost a given at this point since every time I go, it&#39;s with my grandma who takes me out shopping once or twice a year. <br><br>I highly enjoy this place. The waitstaff is extremely knowledgeable and professional, the menu is extensive, and the place seems to be run well like clockwork. <br><br>I&#39;m a huge pasta person so the carbohydrates are usually what I go for. I&#39;ve had the Pasta Carbonara twice and it&#39;s amazing! The garlic sauce added to the dish is a perfect compliment. I&#39;ve also tried many of the other dishes since I tend to sample my family&#39;s as well. The plates are always very flavorful and delicious! <br><br>Now let&#39;s get on to why ya&#39;ll are really here. The Cheesecake!! I&#39;ve never been a huge cheesecake person, but this place knocks the dessert of cheesecake out of the frickin park! I&#39;ve not only been to the Cheesecake Factory in Twelve Oaks, but also to the one in Las Vegas. Both have the same level of divine taste for dessert! My favorite Cheesecake is the Oreo. It&#39;s so good and besides I&#39;m obsessed with Oreos. It&#39;s not the healthiest thing in the world, but I live with it. <br><br>Needless to say, if you&#39;ve never experienced The Cheesecake Factory, do it. Right now. Why are you still reading this? Go, right now and do it. It&#39;s delicious and needs to be tried at least once. There&#39;s a reason The Cheesecake Factory has places all over the country. Now go get some bomb-diggity Cheesecake!
Came here for my birthday with my bestfriend and it was amazing and yummy!! Service was great waitress made my night, the cheesecake is honestly the best and the chicken marsala is delicious.

With the many varied menu options, you&#39;re bound to find something you like here.  Salads are some of the best around.  The quesadillas &amp; pastas are usually very good, sometimes a little too salty. The shrimp scampi  is good.  Surprisingly their pizzas are very good.   Service can be slow when dining in, the busboys HUSTLE to keep tables cleaned &amp; set up.

Super long wait, could not get help  by any staff members or someone to look at us. We just wanted a slice of cake to go. 35 mins of wAiting for nothing, no help no list no ticket , no customer relations or staff member to make order of the situation so we left annoyed. I won&#39;t be back. Feel free to waste you day here.

I&#39;ve been here twice, there is always a long wait and the restaurant is really loud so you have to tell across the table to have a simple conversation. <br><br>The second time my wife and I came here, they messed up my wife&#39;s order, but the waitress was having a bad day so we told her to bring out the dinner anyway and just give us a free cheesecake, which she happily did. I had the salmon with mashed potatoes and asparagus, and ended up with food poisoning. <br><br>The food was good and the cheesecake is great, but I&#39;ll never be eating here again.

There are very few, if any, redeeming qualities about this restaurant. Please read all of the more recent reviews, because none of them are exaggerated. We had to ask for bread, our appetizer took 20-30 minutes, and after finishing our appetizer and our drink we waited 30 minutes for cold, inedible food. The food looked dry and you could tell that it was siting under the warmers for God only knows how long. My husband, who is the more even tempered and patient of the two of us, ended up saying something to our waitress. The food and service was simply unacceptable. The manager, Brandon, came over and offered is cheesecake on the house and took my inedible entree off our bill, which was very nice of him. However, we sat there for another 30 minutes waiting for the cheesecake. We finally ended up paying our bill and leaving without the cheesecake, as we had other engagements to make it to. <br><br>I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory and I LOVE their sister company &#34;Grand Luxe Cafe&#34;, but today&#39;s visit at this location will likely be my last.

Be prepared - there&#39;s always a wait but they do stay within that time period for seating. If you don&#39;t want to wait for a table, they do offer carry-out, including cheesecake slices.<br>Every table gets a bread basket and butter, and we also ordered the Pretzel Bites appetizer. The Bites were super tasty and came with a spicy mustard and cheese sauce for dipping. There is way more cheese sauce than pretzel bites but I recommend saving it for your bread and/or fries.<br>For kids, our chose the sliders with cheese and grilled cheese. Both items were good and served warm. We also had the meat pasta, mushroom burger and stuffed cheese burger. They put ketchup on the plate but if you want mustard, mayo or anything else, I suggest ordering it ahead of time. Any extras we needed took quite a while to get. As far as taste, it was really good. I loved the option of getting salad as a side instead of French fries. It was mainly just spinach but I was okay with that.<br>Our table of 5 shared 2 cheesecake slices and still had leftover. The Celebration Cake was better than I thought it would be, and I loved the &#34;burned&#34; marshmallow on the Toasted Smores&#39; cake.<br>Besides a lot of waiting, this place is really good.

I used to love the Cheesecake Factory, so I was super excited when I heard a CF was opening in Michigan.<br><br>Now, it&#39;s just A-OK, especially considering the prices. Yes, the portions are huge, so you can pretty much count on taking home at least half of your meal. But, perhaps because my tastes have changed over the years, I don&#39;t find the Cheesecake Factory food as satisfying anymore. There&#39;s nothing terribly wrong with their food. It&#39;s just not great or something you&#39;d want to go out of your way for. We ordered:<br><br>1. the avocado eggrolls, which probably wouldn&#39;t be so great without the sweet sauce that comes with it.<br>2. chicken and biscuits; chicken and veggies (carrots, peas, and mushrooms) were delicious but the biscuit could have been fresher.<br>3. fried shrimp platter with french fries and coleslaw; the fried shrimp tasted just salty on their own, not much flavor; but at least they weren&#39;t overcooked.<br><br>Of course, their desserts are great. Service was friendly and attentive. I wouldn&#39;t object if someone wanted to come here, but this wouldn&#39;t be first on my list of places to go out for food that&#39;s worth the price.

To anyone who has never been to the cheesecake factory before, the food will actually blow your mind came here for my birthday with my boyfriend and it was a great end to the night absolutely amazing food!
Usually have to wait so make reservations ahead of time. But it&#39;s a great experience and worth the wait. Salads are fresh and the meat was tender and the salmon was very flavorful.

Awesome experience!! We went for lunch so it wasn&#39;t super busy....the food was very good, service was excellent, our server was amazing and the best part was the CHEESECAKE!!! So yummy!! We hat the Hazelnut Nutella Cheesecake and it was soooo good!! Definitely would come again!!

I really enjoyed my meal. However, my party was initially told it would be a 50 minute wait. Our wait turned out to be an hour and 10 minutes, I had to ask to speak with a manager for us to be seated, and we ate hurriedly because we had an event to go to. The hostess did share with me that the Novi location is being expanded and the servers were extremely attentive which made up for the poor start. I&#39;ll definitely go back once the expansion is complete.

Waiter was great food and Drinks  not their fault but table next to us kids were all over the place back and forth down the isles I did my best to ignore them. Doesn&#39;t seem like a place for young children not trained.

I was not impressed the entrées took a long time to arrive at our table. They lay the silverware on the table as place setting. Not good! The Shrimp and steak Diane was a big let down. 3 shrimp and a couple of chunks of steak mixed with mushrooms, the rest of the plate was mashed potatoes <br>The Bang Bang Chicken: sauce was delicious though not enough the weird thing about it were pools of grease in it. Rice rational far exceeds the rest of the meal. <br>I&#39;ve had tastier meals.

Sorry but it shouldn&#39;t take 15 minutes to give your name to the hostess at 4PM in the afternoon.  After submitting our name to the hostess, they were about to show us to our table.  Table was dirty.  She walked us back to the hostess stand.  We stood there while they proceeded to seat 2 groups of the same party size that arrived after us while they were waiting for &#34;someone&#34; to come and clean off &#34;our&#34; table.  We walked out.

First time at this Cheesecake Factory and I&#39;m pleasantly surprised. I used to love Cheesecake Factory when we traveled outside of Michigan, but started hating it because of the endless menu and huge portions. But my experience today was pretty nice. We had calamari and the French country salad for an appetizer. The calamari was hot, crispy, and not too salty and was fried in clean oil. The salad was alright nothing too special. I ordered it for the beets but the beets were underdone for my taste. <br><br>I ordered a lunch portion of spaghetti and meatballs, but as expected it was still a huge portion. It was very delicious. The noodles were perfectly al dente, the sauce had a strong basil flavor, and the meatballs were meaty and soft without being mealy. The only thing is that it needed a little bit more sauce. The fried basil garnish was a nice touch. Also everything was hot as food should be. <br><br>The jambalaya Cajun pasta was a little disappointing. Very spicy, but that was about the only flavor it had. The grilled steak medallions on the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu was the only thing we ordered that was a reasonable portion size. I purposefully never order low fat, low carb, lighter fare options based on the concern that the food will lack flavor, but it seems that the lighter fare menu here is just slightly lower fat, but mainly smaller portions. Which is wonderful. <br><br>Our server did a nice job as well. Polite and attentive. However I didn&#39;t like that we had to ask for bread instead of it just being provided. But don&#39;t hesitate to ask for it. The brown bread they have doesn&#39;t seem to be a rye bread, but it has a sweet chocolate flavor, which sounds weird but I had nearly 3 pieces, with butter oops... <br><br>Oh also we shared a tiramisu cheesecake which was so so good. I couldn&#39;t believe how yummy it was. It was a little lighter than a typical cheesecake which was needed after a big lunch. <br><br>Overall great experience. Would come again.

Went there last night -- Sunday &amp; the wait for a table (party of 4) was 80 minutes. We didn&#39;t mind. ;) <br><br>I ordered the combo Steak &amp; Herb Salmon and it was fantastic!!!  Ambiance &amp; service were excellent. Highly recommend!
Not enough gluten free items on menu. People need to realize MOST of us gluten free people are NOT by choice.

It&#39;s official, I&#39;m insane... I keep trying this place over &amp; over again expecting different results...<br><br>HORRIBLE experience today.<br>1. Didn&#39;t even know who our server was?!?<br>2. Waited 10 minutes to get knifes for our meals after receiving our entrees<br>3. Both tables next to us, we&#39;re having basically the same issues...<br>4. My flatbread had hard breadcrumbs sprinkled on top? And my friends steak came with .1oz of potatoes... Huh??<br><br>I really hope the family that owns this chain, gets a reality check soon. No one seems happy recently and it makes me sad.<br><br>Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake: To-go, YES! Dine in, NO!!!!

Really good food, but incredibly long wait. Told us that we&#39;d have to wait an hour and a half, ended up waiting 2 and a half hours and when we we went in after an hour and a half, they said we had only waited 20 minutes but we had not. Took us forever to get seated, and online it said wasn&#39;t busy and we called to see if we would have a table when we got there and they said we would.

The servers and food here are always amazing. However, I have been here multiple times where the hosts have been rude, disorderly, and ineffective. They always seem confused and never seem to know what&#39;s going on. I have been ignored by the hosts both of the pst recent times I have been here.

Food was good/very good but not excellent as the 5 times I ate at a Cheesecake Factory in Tucson and Pheonix.  Was such a crowded wait here it killed some of the experience, too. Was the food worth the hassle? Not for me.

This place used to be great but the last few experiences have been HORRIBLE!!!!!! The most recent disastrous experience was this past Sunday 10/23/17.  After a 40-45 minute wait we were seated and placed our order immediately after sitting to avoid waiting longer to eat. After placing our order the server comes back to say they were out of steak!!!! After waiting maybe 5 or more minutes for her to come back we were able to place another order. After waiting almost an hour for two entrees to be served I never got a chance to eat. I was served under cooked meat!!! The other entree that was served was room temperature. How do you take an hour to prepare and serve raw cold food?  Mind you while waiting this additional time for dinner not once did the server check on our table. After flagging down the server I was told she would have the manager address the issue.  <br><br>The manager is a whole different issue in itself with the place.  This guy has no customer service skills and little to no social skills. He was very monotone when addressing the issues. There was barley an apology or any type of offer to make things right. I finally had to say that we will not pay for the meals due to the unacceptable service that was received and we left. As we were walking away he then decided to make a comment and say &#34;oh I wouldn&#39;t expect you to pay for this&#34;? I decided to keep walk-in and not address this person you all have decided was a qualified manager for your establishment.  <br><br>For the prices you charge for your food the service should match. There is no justification for your employees lack of customer skills especially when it come to your management. This is the second time I have had a horrible experience here and have had to address your lack luster management regarding the crappy service.<br><br>And to top it all off there was a bug running around the floor and I&#39;m sure you know what I mean! When it was brought to the manager attention as well he expressed no concern regarding that either. By taking a look at some of the other reviews on here I&#39;m not the only customer who has noticed the bug problem in this place!!!

Don&#39;t bother coming here. The wait is over an hour and they are routinely out of like 75% of items on their menu. I drove an hour to get here only to be told almost everything  on their menu is sold out. The person responsible for ordering stock should be fired

To summarize, most of our party of 9 thought the food was better than average, however a burger that was ordered medium-well literally came with blood soaking into the edges of the bun. Sent it back to be cooked more and it came in a new bun, but was still dripping red when picked up. The taste wasn&#39;t good. Sent the meal back, that person&#39;s appetite was lost. Waiter was very nice and apologized but management just came and stated &#34;someone didn&#39;t like their burger?&#34;, and then left. The 16.50 was taken off the bill. It took 2.5 hours to be seated, but we expected that and arrived 2 hours beforehand. It took 2 hours for the dining experience once seated. Of course the cheesecake was excellent, as always. Some of us decided that it&#39;s really not worth it to come here when you weigh everything out. Quantity over quality seems to be what they were thinking when this restaurant was expanded. The hostess that managed the front desk was top-notch, she deserves a raise, as the chaos that spins around her is very well managed.
Good food, extensive diverse menu, mouth watering cheesecakes but the wait is a turn off....45 minute wait for dinner is just unacceptable for a restaurant that has so many seats and tables

Tyler V took care of myself and my friend. We had long day after meeting all day. He made us laugh and took good care of us with our Tuna was amazing! Cheesecake I had tiramisu my friend had salted caramel she even ordered an extra piece to go for later date hahaha Tyler V we love you will be back! Tyler V is awesome! He will make you laugh and make sure your food in great!

WORST EXPERIENCE EVER. <br>1. A 3 hour wait on Saturday evening - I was expecting a long wait from the other reviews so this was the least of my ordeal.<br><br>2. My table was dirty, there were still crumbs on the table and in utensils on the floor when we were finally seated.<br><br>3. My order came out wrong, this too I can forgive because my waiter was new. I sent the order back then ended up canceling my meal because it took another 20 minutes to fix and by then I ate bites of my friends&#39; food and was so pissed off by the end of their meal.<br><br>4. My poor waiter had the manager come talk to us and he turned out to be a jackass. Instead of apologizing and being nice, he came out first arguing about our wait time down to the minutes, then arguing that there was an error in how I ordered the meal, then last he tried to rectify the situation by giving us a slice of cheesecake. AN APOLOGY AND BEING NICE GOES A LONG WAY, what an arrogant asshole.  There was a second manager who didn&#39;t even come out after we told our waiter that her manager was rude. <br><br>I WILL NEVER GO HERE AGAIN, take my advice stay home or eat ANYWHERE BUT HERE! Support your local restaurants.

Let me start this by saying the only reason this isn&#39;t a 4 star is because of the wait.  The food we got was good and a fair price.  The server was very friendly and accommodating.  The Cheesecake was obviously the highlight of our meal. I understand why so many people go here as there is food for every persons tastes.  While we enjoyed the food, probably won&#39;t be back due to the wait alone.

I guess it&#39;s hard to please cheap people around the area.<br><br>Let me start off; the food is incredibly good including desert. I&#39;ve been here twice already and it gets better for me all the time. <br>Yes there&#39;s a wait and yes they don&#39;t take reservations but you need to be patient and have to use your head that it&#39;s the only Cheesecake Factory in Michigan and other people want to eat there too. <br><br>Appetizers: I recommend the fried calamari and the flat bread. It was so good!<br>And for the meal: steak Diane with the Samon and mashed potatoes UGH SO GOOD!!!

Very loud environment that was not conducive to conversation.<br>I had the chicken salad skin version on lettuce without the bun.  Chicken salad was salty and lacked any flavor besides mayonnaise.  I asked for dressing on the side and  when plate was delivered the dressing was missing.  It finally arrived after asking 2 people and finished most of my salad.  Server only asked to refill my tea once after it sat nearly empty for most of my time with food.<br>Another person at table ordered baked potato soup and a sandwich with bacon on the side.  Soup was cold and salty as well.  Bacon was missing.<br>Third in our party orders burger and fries.  Fries were cold and hard.<br>For all the hype about the chain it was an over priced disappointment.  No thank you.
Great food, great customer service, great environment. Please open more locations in Michigan!

This ccf is amazing and ive visited many in different states. This is by far the best.  Wait time was only 20 minutes at the most and it&#39;s now packed, food was awesome and our server is that deal.  All for miss jennie. Thanks for being awesome, patient and just a gem. If i come only because of her excellent service it will be worth it.  I&#39;m very satisfied.  Restrooms are clean and everyone happy...and i mean I&#39;m getting paid well and can eat cheesecake daily happy.  Valet $5 fast and courteous and mall is beautiful with great shopping right outside the door.

our server, Nate, was amazing. however, your hostesses are very rude and ignored me and my friend for 5 minutes to talk to people who came in after us. they also sat 3 groups of people who who also arrived after we did. we had a very similar experience the last time we came here about 3 months ago.

Horrible food, service is hit or miss, but at least ambience is nice. <br><br>Chicken Chorizo omelette:  potatoes were burned and very dark. Egg omelette tasted rubbery, very artificial taste and texture. Chicken chorizo filling was ok. <br><br>Miso salmon:  rice was dry and undercooked. Not moist at all.  Salmon was nothing special.  Sweet miso sauce very sweet that you can&#39;t taste miso. <br><br>Bacon chicken pasta (Evelyn&#39;s pasta?):  extremely greasy!!  I love bacon but that was so greasy I couldn&#39;t even taste the pasta sauce, therefore, very bland!<br><br>Cheesecakes and desserts very good as usual, thankfully because they are not made in house. I usually take the family here once a month for Sunday brunch because of the ambience and we usually order breakfast items because it is harder to screw up breakfast, but today&#39;s lunch was sh*t!!!  <br><br>Most waitstaff are well trained, but some from the other side of the tracks need to take their attitude elsewhere. I already overpay for less than average quality food and shouldn&#39;t have to deal with servers who do not have basic customer service skills such as a smile. <br><br>I&#39;ll be getting take out desserts from now on.

I&#39;ve never been to a more overrated restaurant than Cheesecake Factory in Novi. It all starts with the wait-I&#39;ve tried to get into here a couple times and the wait has been always been over an hour (one times it was 3.5 hours). I&#39;m sorry, but 1. Nothing is worth waiting for, 2. Restaraunts aren&#39;t worth waiting for 3. Cheesecake Factory is not worth waiting for. There is really no system to the waiting the entrance is small so they suggests you wait in the mall area. They give you a buzzer and tell you, you can walk around the mall...but don&#39;t tell you how far you can go. <br><br>Once you finally get a seat the service is terrible. We sat for 10 minutes until someone came over and asked if we had been waited on. We said no and she picked us up as her table...the table next to us ordered around the time we did, we were done and had received the bill and they hadn&#39;t received their food. <br><br>I can&#39;t complain about the food, it is good. But not an hour good or 3.5 hours good. Had the burrito and we got some small plates (Cuban sandwich egg rolls and buffalo chicken meatballs). The food is the only thing that saves this place from getting 1 star. <br><br>I&#39;ve been to the location in Chicago where I have never had to wait... I&#39;m not sure why this is but I have an idea. The location is just too small, not enough room for a bar, carry out, bakery and seating. Everyone is sitting on top of each other because too much was thrown into a space that can&#39;t handle it.

Worst Cheesecake Factory location in the country.  I have been to over a dozen locations across the country and the manager of this location is rude, condescending and not customer friendly.  A server dumped a whole Nutella cheesecake on my college-aged daughter - she is highly allergic to tree nuts and broke out in hives, had trouble breathing etc.  The manager took over an HOUR to come and talk to my daughter.  He refused to provide any information about the server, the exact ingredients of the cake or provide my daughter any compensation for having a whole cake dumped on her head (in her hair too).  We complained to Corporate and they credited my daughter&#39;s credit card for her order and then they recharged her card later the same day.  WTF Cheesecake Factory?<br><br>The entire waitstaff and management of this location is rude and needs to be replaced...pronto!

Just Amazing!<br><br>I had a wonderful three thumbs up experience!  On arrival we were told there was an hour wait which we gladly waited. It ended up only being about 35 minutes until we were seated.<br><br>Server was polite and I had ordered the avocado eggroll appetizer to start and it was to DIE FOR.  If you are an avocado fan, this is one dish you must not pass up. The dipping sauce added wonderful flavor to the app as well.<br><br>For an entree I ordered the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta which was delicious. I loved the added vegetables in the pasta such as asparagus, peas and red and yellow peppers. The sauce was creamy and had a slight kick, but full of flavor. My friend ordered the bang bang chicken and shrimp, which she was pleased with. She said it had a stronger curry taste to it, so I wouldn&#39;t recommend it to anyone who isn&#39;t a curry fan.<br><br>For dessert I went all out and got the Adam cheesecake which had peanut butter cups, butterfingers and caramel. Absolutely scrumptious. Very rich, but delish.<br><br>The restaurant was busy, but everything was prompt. The server was on her game with filling up my water glass and clearing unneeded dishes.<br><br>I will definitely be back if not next week then the following<br><br>A++
I enjoyed my dinner &amp; I will recommend this dish. I wished it also came with green beans. The price is $17.50 for the Famous Factory Meatloaf.

My boyfriend and I came here for happy hour one evening and the experience was terrible. We got to the host stand and told the hostess we wanted to try out their happy hour and she said it was self seating so we picked a table and never got menus. After about 5 minutes I went to the host stand and asked for a happy hour menu as well as a waitress. 5 minutes later a waitress came over to greet us and was clearly disappointed we were there for happy hour. Almost as if she didn&#39;t even want to serve our table. We ordered and she was extremely fake with us and it almost made me feel uncomfortable. The food was great. Big portions and good price. But the service was just terrible.

Hello Yelpers, <br>OHHH YEA....I was so happy to find out that the &#34;Cheescake factory&#34; was here in MIchigan.   We arrived at a good time, for a new restaurant like this, because everyone wants to try it.. We went on a Sunday and I Tried the chicken picatta, because that&#39;s what I always get when we are in Scottsdale, AZ. I love this restaurant in AZ so I just knew I&#39;d love it here as well.. But the Picatta was a bit  too lemony &amp; mushroomy for me ! The one in Scottsdale AZ was better so far...at least for the Picatta dinner.  <br>I did send that back...but the waitress was so kind and the staff was very nice and they wanted to please me and us. So I ordered the &#34;applesauce pancakes&#34;...OMG...they were so good, I couldn&#39;t get enough. I took about 1/2 of it home to save for later. I got to enjoy it twice. It wasn&#39;t like any kind of pancakes I&#39;d ever had before.  There were these great big fluffy pancakes and the sauce is really the restaurants &#34;applesauce recipe&#34;.  But to me it tasted like the insides of an apple pie.   Not just any apple pie, but the very best apple pie you&#39;d ever tasted in your life.  I&#39;m not kidding, this was soo yummy, it melted in my mouth and I just couldn&#39;t wait to go back and get it again.  <br>Sadly, I have to tell you that we went back another time and they took these favorite pancakes off of the menu. I guess other people didn&#39;t think it was as delectible as I thought it was.  But there are so many other entree&#39;s on the menu that I&#39;m sure you &#39;ll find something pleasing to your taste buds.  Right now while this venue is a new spot to eat, the lines are really long and the waiting time is evenn longer. But you can go on a Sunday about 11:00 am and not have too long of a wait time.  Im sure after it&#39;s there awhile, the waiting times will go down.<br> My husband had the baked macaroni and cheese and it was excellent too. I  tasted it and It was full of cheese and flavor! I absolutely will have that the next time we go to this restaurant. Believe me, we will be going back.  I must add that all the wait staff and the hostesses were very kind and friendly as well. I had been looking for a refill on my diet pepsi and another waitress just brought it for me without me having to ask.  Our waitress was knowledgeable and kind.

Service isn&#39;t always so great here.  Dishes often come out separately.  Often times I will have eaten half my meal before the other people get their meals.  Orders are often messed up, missing items, the food is cold and to get a waitress sometimes you practically have to beg to get a drink refill.  There are some GREAT waiters/waitresses.  The best waitress this location has is Heather.  She truly cares that your order is correct and your glass is never empty.  She&#39;s also very personable and attentive.  I wish all of the staff was as good as her!  We have also talked to a Manager at one point named Quinn.  He was so professional and truly cares about the happiness of his guests.  I can&#39;t say the same for the other managers.

I&#39;m only rating the cheesecake. I have only had a hand-full of dishes from here and the food is just ok.<br>The cheesecakes are frozen and made in a factory in another state!! they are over priced for the quality. If you want a great cheesecake try Peteets cheesecakes in Oak Park.

The worst experience I have had during my visits at the cheesecake factory. On arrival for a birthday party of seven,  initially we were informed a thirty to forty- five minute wait. After being seated at a booth and discussing availability of rooming, we were DECIDING whether we should move or not. At this time, Amanda was alongside the booth. Not finalizing, only trying to make a determination whether to move,  Amanda left,  came back and informed us she was TOLD to bring us back up to the front to await a different section.  I then verbalized we had not decided yet,  as she continued to say she was TOLD! This disturbed me as she continued, with persistence, that she was TOLD! After speaking with her and sharing the idea of not appreciating her persistence nor the idea of getting pushed out,  we headed back up to the front to await an additional fifteen minutes. We were then approached to be sat when Brandon,  who identified himself as district manager,  quickly stopped us and stated they made a mistake and was about to sit us DIRECTLY behind the booth we were just moved from. Because of this, the individual whose birthday it was,  asked would there be accommodations of ANY kind for the time and inconvenience we were experiencing. Brandon then expressed, &#34;Eating at the cheesecake factory.&#34; This was expressed as if to say, &#34; Be glad you have the privilege to eat here!&#34; I was shocked at his response,  as we proceeded to explain the entire ordeal. He then went on to say he was aware of the situation,  as the additional booth mistake, would cause us to wait even longer &#34; until the previous party got up,  whenever that would be!&#34; As far as accomodating, Brandon went on to say, &#34;doing something with the bill or giving you something,  no,  that&#39;s not going to happen!&#34; The birthday girl then went on to say,  that&#39;s not what I asked.&#34; Brandon then stated,  &#34;That&#39;s what you implied when you said...&#34; I was appalled. To stand there, and witness him acknowledge he was aware of the situation, yet go on in a manner of conversation as he did with a patron, was not only rude,  but out of order. I have had better service and respect driving through a fast food restaurant. And,  to make such a statement regarding the cheesecake factory being a privilege to us,  I pray he was not insinuating based on race! It&#39;s unfortunate that individuals such as that are put in positions of management,  eliminating the main ingredient of business success... customers!

We were told 1 hour and 15 minutes wait time however it might be longer. At 1 hour and 15 minutes we checked and were told 30 more minutes. It didn&#39;t make sense to leave so we waited. 30 minutes later we checked again and were told 20 to 30 minutes. Oh, and they were sorry. Two hours and 30 minutes for a table. The food is not good enough to wait that long. By the way, the pagers only work if you stand by the cold entrance door so don&#39;t plan to walk around the mall while you wait. Really, get with the times and just text us when you have our table. Never again CCF, NEVER AGAIN!

I know it is overhyped. I know it is overpriced. I also know you are foolish to wait for it. I still have a soft spot for The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>I went awhile back in the sweet spot of dining out time wise. It was like a Tuesday or Wednesday afternoon around 3pm. There was little to no wait. Wait staff did a good job. Sat in a half booth and was comfy too. <br><br>The food was really quite delish. My dad had the steak Diane and shrimp scampi combo, my mom had the Jamaican black pepper shrimp and I went with the herb crusted salmon. All were happy and huge, none were dietician friendly. I think very few things on the menu are to be frank. This doesn&#39;t bother me a bit, if you are trying to eat anywhere near healthy it may bother you. Me, well I figure they state they are a cheesecake place so I am not expecting health food.<br><br>I love the sinful nature of the salmon here, the lemon sauce is creamy and evil, a pure butter base. This rich sauce is perfect with the slightly crisped salmon, calorie bomb mashed potatoes and tender crisp asparagus. I also loved my mom&#39;s shrimp because of the black beans, mango salsa and fried plantains. They all worked together well with the kick of the shrimp. My dad&#39;s scampi was tasty but I am not hugely into steak Diane. It is a good rendition if you like it though.<br><br>I will get a salad next time because the portions were so generous I couldn&#39;t order a dessert. I took a bite of my mom&#39;s carrot cake and meh. Skip it. I&#39;m betting the carrot cheesecake is better. I find the cakes in here to be a bit overrated myself but the cheesecakes are always fabu. My bite of my father&#39;s key lime cheesecake was bliss.<br><br>I like it here a lot but will not be a regular until the hype dies a bit.

We came here for my daughter&#39;s birthday and I am appalled at how our meal went. It started with the appetizer taking 20+mins bc they burned it the first time (no big deal, manager apologized) however.... When the birthday girl&#39;s spaghetti came it was dry and old-looking, completely unacceptable to serve (i am in the industry, it was 100% not ok). Second daughter&#39;s food was ok (can&#39;t really mess pizza up) then my steak/shrimp combo came....<br>Each piece was a different temperature, I ordered mid rare and received one less than rare, on med well, and one medium. Wtf?!<br>No manager apologized, server half heartedly apologized, aka we won&#39;t be back.

We went to the Cheesecake Factory for dinner last night and had the most horrible experience I have ever had in a restaurant. <br><br>My BF asked for the remainder of his meal to be wrapped.  So they took his plate away to do so.  A little while later the waiter came back to the table and told him he was sorry - that his meal had been thrown away but they would make him a new meal to bring home if he would like.  He told them that would be great.  About ten minutes later the waiter comes back out with a box telling my BF that they had found his meal and that it has not been thrown away.  However - when my BF opened the box - it was very obvious they had dug his food out of the trash and thrown it on a box .... As there was other food in there that was not a part of his meal.

There is a long wait. But go at the right time its only like 15minutes. I been a couple times its a 45min drive for me but i love coming. Drinks are awesome. But i can deal without the flys and fruit flys as a unwelcome guess.   if i have to keep looking up to watch my kids food u lose 2 stars automatically.

Food is adequate. However, if you want clean dishes and cutlery you may have a problem! Omgoodness!! Had to ask for three different tea cups and then I had a surprise in my teapot...lettuce!!  When I asked for another bowl to share my dessert they gave my daughter a filthy one. I&#39;m scared to think what our dishes looked like from the kitchen!  The waitress was unfazed by the lettuce in the teapot...can&#39;t go back there!<br><br>They get one star because the food was served hot.

I LOVE the food here. Their menu is extensive...there is a LOT to choose from. Ironically enough, I never have room left after dinner to actually order cheesecake. The veggie burger has to be the best veggie burger I have ever had.<br><br>If you&#39;re coming here on the weekend, come at least an hour early, put your name down with the hostess, then go shop around. There is ALWAYS a long wait.

At the restaurant&#39;s request, I submitted a detailed explanation of the poor experience I had with the Novi location of CF.  It reminds me of the last bad experience I had with the restaurant when the floor manager &#34;could not be found.&#34; The manager in &#34;the back office&#34; asked for my contact information to follow up a different mistake their carryout staff had made. Because I did not get any return call back then, I can&#39;t expect one now.  My mistake for going back to this restaurant.

Most atrocious carry out pickup ever. I expected a wait time, and for them to be busy considering it was a Saturday, so I called ahead to place my order. I was given a 20 minute wait time, which is actually very reasonable to me. When I arrived at the location to pick up my meal, the ladies at the register kept yelling for people to get in line to place an order (which I had already done) so I had to ask repeatedly where to stand for that, and kept being directed to an unreasonably one line of people waiting to place an order. Finally, I was informed that there&#39;s a separate area to wait for orders that were already placed and was able to check out. <br><br>The meal tasted decent, but was ice cold when I got it due to how long I had to wait just to cash out. (I work in the mall so I didn&#39;t have much wait time between pickup and eating it.) $17 for a small, cold, mediocre lunch portion of Alfredo, with no carry out supplies in my bag,  and terrible service is way too overpriced. I shouldn&#39;t have even tipped, and will never order carry out from there again.

The cheesecake factory never disappoints. The food is always fantastic! However on this particular trip our server Christine Boguth really made our visit special. Her description of the food as well as her friendly attitude and smile made this experience wonderful. I highly recommend her at this location.

Never order curbside here.  No parking and no one answers the phone so you can let them know you have arrived.  Called back to get a refund and sat on hold for a manager for 15 minutes before having to hang up.  Worse service.

My recent visit was not what we are used to. The hostess seemed overwhelmed and was very short and rude. Our server was Joseph and he was outstanding. Unfortunately the food was mediocre at best as the pasta and shrimp meals my son and I ordered had tiny shrimp that had only been half pealed. I had to pull all of the shrimp out and finish cleaning them before I could eat my dinner. There really is no excuse for this other than laziness. We drive over an hour and this visit was disappointing. My visit was 3/08/2019.

2 hour wait for small party and the host staff was very rude when I asked questions. If I didn&#39;t have a gift card to use I wouldn&#39;t have come in. I&#39;ll save the gift card for another location- this one lives up to it&#39;s awful reputation.

This Cheesecake Factory location is decent. The food is pretty good. The service is so-so in the restaurant area. The service is great in the bar area, especially during lunch hours, 11am-2pm.
