Main problem is during dinner hours there is always a 1-2 hour wait to be seated. It&#39;s ridiculous. Other than that, decent place.

When we first arrived the waiter told us 20-25 min wait. So of course we waited by the only waiting area they had which was by the door.  After the remote vibrates we were sat close by another couple and preceded to order our food. The waiter we had was named ken, he was good and patient. The service was so so what I mean by that is he would come and go but not that often over the hour we&#39;ve been here I only seen him 2 at our table. He brought out bread and there was a fruit fly around in our area. The food cane fast. I had the Cajun jumbalya with shrimp and chicken. It was spicy and delicious but just gave me more peppers than meat for the price of 20$ a plate. I would recommend it to come here if you have a party and are with your friends. But to come as a romantic night out don&#39;t.
Wish there was a location closer to me, this is over an hour away but they have a way better pasta carbonara than olive garden. The cheesecake is also great
Aside from the long wait. The food came out cold and missing items that was supposed to come with the meal. Over all The Cheesecake Factory is better experienced outside of Novi, Michigan.

I am so disappointed. I order a carry out for work. Now mind you I have to drive 25 minutes there to pick it up so it is not close but we have special people in and what better lunch then food with cheesecake.  Well I pick up the food two full bags. Pay for the food and leave. Get to work and no cheesecake is in the bag.  I call up there and get the manager who is sorry and because we are so far away just offers to put the money back on my credit card for the forgotten cheesecake. I said that is fine and give her all my information. 3 days later its not back on my card. I call up there and wait on the phone for 45 minutes for the Manager who never comes to the phone. Angry I finally hang up. The next day call and ask for the manager again on hold for 40 minutes and the manager still never comes to the phone. I call back they put me back on hold and I am on hold as I type this with another 39 minutes has passed.   I am sorry but this is just pathetic. I am really going to have to ride back out there in person. I will never ever order from here again. Your customer service is the worse I have ever seen.

Two days after Thanksgiving?  Everyone is still working on leftovers, so our wait was only 15 minutes!  Since we weren&#39;t expecting such a short wait, I asked to be put at the end of the line to do some holiday shopping.  Bought us 45 minutes to peruse at our leisure.  <br><br>TIP:  Prepare to wait!!  Go straight here, get a little buzzer, go shop the mall and come back.  They aren&#39;t taking reservations until after the holidays.  <br><br>I really enjoyed our whole experience.  The interior design was decadently busy, but a nice contemporary departure from most nicer restaurants in SE Michigan.  Our server was very professional and checked on us often.  When I asked for hot water with lemon (for the tickle in my throat), she thoughtfully brought honey as well.  We sat and chatted for awhile, so we made sure to tip big.<br><br>Our three person party ordered two salmon plates with vegetables and a Glamburger.  Everyone was content with their food, but I can only speak for my meal.  I ordered the herb crusted salmon with vegetables. The salmon was tender and the loads of vegetables were prepared from scratch (not frozen).  Broccoli, carrots and asparagus in a lemony, cream sauce.  I felt the sauce was a little too sour, but a dish of ranch dressing showed up out of nowhere and we took full advantage of it (seriously, we didn&#39;t ask for it, but we didn&#39;t say no!).  I&#39;ll just be picky here because everything else was really nice. The carrots were a bit more rustic - roughly chopped, and not peeled as cleanly as I would like.  But who really cares, the food was great :)<br><br>Oh, we were too full to even share a slice of cheesecake, but it was my birthday and they gave me a little birthday sundae on the house.  They even sang for me.  Yae!

For right now, I just wanted to note that their Factory Nachos Appetizer with Chicken is off the charts! And then, that the Classic Original Cheesecake is the creamiest, cheesiest melt in your mouth deliciousness I/We&#39;ve ever had. Wow! We came back twice and ordered the Factory Nachos and the Original Cheesecake Desert with Coffee and we may just do it again before we get to try anything else on the menu. It&#39;s the best! 5 stars and I&#39;ll definitely be back...

So my friends convinced  me to go on opening day which was a big mistake. The line was literally wrapped around the world! It felt like I took 3 trains, 2 busses and a helicopter just to get to the front of the line. But on a positive note, the food was really good. I&#39;m not sure if they&#39;ll be this crowded every day, because like I said I went on opening day, but go at your own risk, and may the odds be in your favor.

I was in the mall with my mom looking for shoes and decided we wanted a piece of cheesecake. We did carry out and were surprised as to how fast we got our order in and our food ready to go. The staff was also really friendly. The dine-in side had about an hour wait- which is very reasonable as seeing how packed the place was! <br>The interior looks amazing!! I&#39;m so happy to finally have a Cheesecake Factory by me (AND in Novi- instead of the Eastside!!!!!) <br>I&#39;ll definitely be going for dinner soon.

Normally I won&#39;t go to chain restaurants but this place is out of this world and I don&#39;t even like cheesecake. I have been to various locations (Chicago, Columbus,Orlando,Novi) and each time the food is outstanding. The menu is so big( it can be overwhelming) you could eat a different entree daily for months and never have the same thing. Mixed drinks such as the blood orange mojito and cucumber mojito are excellent. Long waits are normal but understandable because it&#39;s worth the wait. Highly recommend and don&#39;t let the long wait scare you away.

Everything was great and tasted amazing. The menu was a little overwhelming, but a great variety. I was a little disappointed that my first choice wasn&#39;t available. I know this place is typically swamped but, service still left something to be desired.

I know some people find it over priced and a long wait. I know it&#39;s a chain n still I love it. I love the cheesecake options n have yet to find one I do not love. So good! Sure they could have faster service. They should take your dessert order with dinner as that takes forever too but I love the cheesecake enough to over look their service issues.....that good. Yummy.

Our server Christine impressed us with fine dining service on a busy Sunday afternoon. Perfectly cooked steak and they let me sub in extra veggies without a problem. Totally worth the 30-40min wait to be seated.

Bad, I went there a couple of times and loved it, but lately whenever go, the food is not up to the mark. <br>I went there yesterday and the French fries were super cold, the buffalo blast as well as the egg roles were super duper oily. <br>I have ate them so many time but I guess they can&#39;t handle rush anymore as well as their server&#39;s standards are reducing.<br>All and all have been having a disappointing experience with them from some time now.

Always a fan &amp; this location is no different. Very crowded due to opening week &amp; I&#39;m sure it will be that way for a while. <br><br>Our wait for a party of 5 was 4 hours. Only complaint I have is that I specifically asked for a certain type of seating arrangement but when we went to get seated it wasn&#39;t what I had specified but management quickly fixed it for us. <br><br>The servers &amp; service was wonderful. Stacie M was very pleasant &amp; fun. <br><br>Macaroni balls were a little cool but delicious, Pasta DaVinci was great. <br><br>Patio seating was great but bugs started joining is for dinner about 8pm. Smokers are a pest because they light up not too far from where you are seated. <br><br>We had to order cheesecakes with dinner due to back up but they ended up coming right on time. <br><br>They attempted to handle the crowds as best as they could. <br><br>Can&#39;t wait to go back!

Food, service, and atmosphere were great. The hostess was the reason I bumped it down two stars. I almost walked out. She was extremely rude. We waited for her to finish up with the person ahead of us. She then asked my friend to &#34;get in the correct spot for the line&#34;(there was NO ONE in line, all patrons were taken care of except for us, my friend was standing right at the desk in front of her, I was standing off to the side). A gentleman walked in the door, and the hostess took him instead. The gentleman saw what happened, and let me step in to continue placing our reservation(friend was upset and didn&#39;t want to speak). I don&#39;t know why she did that to my friend. I think I know the answer, but I am not going to put that kind of stuff on here.

We went there a Friday night and the bartender area was excellent. He made us drinks based on what we told our likes were and they were excellent. In terms of the hostess that&#39;s where it went downhill, she was rude, bumped into us while waiting and never excused herself, and then gave us attitude when we asked how much time left for our seating. We talked to the manager and he was amazing. Our waitress was excellent and fast with our orders. There were 3 hostess that day the other two were excellent but that one was the younger one of them and had zero skills. You could see she kept rolling her eyes and just didn&#39;t want to be there.

I usually eat at this restaurant at least a couple of times per month but I decided to get cheesecake slices to go on Monday night and they where the smallest pieces I&#39;ve even seen at any Cheesecake Factory. The service at this location is usually amazing. Can&#39;t someone please tell the employees at this location that a slice is $8.00 or more and people should get their money worth. I just wasted over $25.

Definitely not worth the long wait, or money. Spend your hours at a restaurant where the workers aren&#39;t condescending and the silverware isn&#39;t dirty. Super disappointed, and I was actually looking forward to eating here for the first time. 1:30 wait to have some tasteless food, and thawed cheesecake. So unfortunate.

I need to write this review so I can delete some pictures out of my phone. I came here because I happened to be at work and currently this is the only location in Mi. My husband and I came when they first opened and we had a very nice experience so I decided to try their happy hour. I must say I have become a happy hour enthusiast. If I could get a job critiquing food I think I would be in heaven. <br>On to the review..... I sat at the bar of course and was greeted promptly. I placed my drink order which only consisted of water with lemons. I also ordered a burger med well with fries and crab and spinach dip. The crab dip was to die for. I could eat that any day of the week. It was so flavorful and cheesy. The burger was good but not something that really stood out. The presentation was very nice!! Although I have forgotten my bartenders name she was very courteous and attentive. I definitely will be back!!

Interesting menu selection. Portions are huge. Lots of options from seafood, pasta, burgers, salads, etc... unfortunately I find every dish here to be calorie laden. They do offer a lighter fare menu but I found those options to be greasy as well. I also received a free piece of cheesecake (happened to be national cheesecake day) and found it to be awful. Truthfully the worst cheesecake I&#39;ve ever had. Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t bad but it&#39;s not good either. It&#39;s a mediocre restaurant that relies on fat to make food taste good. I wouldn&#39;t not eat here but I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to eat here either.

Years ago we ate at The Cheesecake Factory in California/Phoenix and the quality was excellent.   I noticed s definite difference in the quality today.  I ordered chicken Lettuce Wraps.   Very disappointed.   Lettuce wasn&#39;t crispy, carrots were t julienned very well, chicken seemed heated up in a microwave.  Overall food was disappointing.  Our first waitress was one of the worst.  In a rush barely ever made eye contact.  Her replacement was so much better thankfully.  I&#39;ve never left s review but I wanted people to know that if they were expecting the good quality of the Cheesecake Factory they are now just another chain restaurant.

I haven&#39;t visited a Cheesecake Factory in a few years, and on Sunday July 28, 2019 I was reminded why.  Cheesecake Factory has become so overrated, the only thing I care for is the Lemon Raspberry Cream Cheesecake. First of all, my party of 3 ordered Cinnamon Roll Pancakes, the Monte Cristo sandwich and the Brueleed French Toast. Twenty minutes later the waiter comes out to tell us that they&#39;re completely out of French toast... lol. So the person in my party that ordered that is Vegan so they ordered the fried cauliflower, fried macaroni balls and corn cakes as a replacement.  Another twenty minutes goes by and here comes my vegan friends&#39; food.  I&#39;m like ok 45 minutes and still not even a pancake??? Ten minutes later here comes the pancakes and my sorry excuse for an entree.  Cinnamon pancakes were very mediocre looking.. didn&#39;t even match what they were advertising smh.. my Monte Cristo sandwich looked like something I made after coming in at 1 am from a drunken stupor... smh my diced potatoes were nicely burnt.  But back to this repulsively prepared sandwich; the bread was so soggy that when I picked up the sandwich it stretched apart. I&#39;m like &#34;really?&#34; Now I&#39;ve had this entree many times at multiple locations across the U.S. and never have I had it so terribly prepared. I didn&#39;t even eat it. I informed the waiter and he took it and apologized sarcastically and asked if I wanted anything else... I told him no as that&#39;s really the only thing I liked besides the cheesecake.  The waiter then had the manager come over, I don&#39;t know why because I didn&#39;t ask to speak to him but ok. So the manager came over and asked what was wrong and I told him for us having to wait pretty close to an hour for our food, my potatoes should not have been burnt and my bread on my sandwich should not have been soggy. The manager then proceeds to justify the atrocity by saying &#34;well the bread is actually marinated in a custard&#34;. I said I understand that and this experience would probably be slightly different if I had never had the entree before or possibly never even eaten a Cheesecake Factory before but being that I&#39;m a seasoned diner here and stopped for a few years because of this type of mediocrity this is unacceptable. He offered to take the meal off of the bill which he was going to do anyways because I did not eat that mess at all.  Cheesecake was bomb as always. But you guys really tried it this time and I had to blast you guys for it because those prices are too high for you guys to be serving mediocre food.  I&#39;m only eating at Michelin rated restaurants from now on. Thanks for the reminder Cheesecake Factory.

The management at this location is so rude its hard to believe they still have a job. I would give zero stars if I could. How this place stays so busy is confusing when they are so terrible to their customers.
It was amazing food but the bill was so much haha, it was definitely a treat. service was great too!

This place is always crazy busy but if you have never been here go during lunch because it&#39;s not as busy. One time I waited three hours during dinner time. I personally never thought the food was anything special it reminds me of a AppleBees or TGI Friday. There is a cheesecake counter where you can order dessert to go which is really the only reason I dine here. I would skip the wait and grab cheesecake to go.

You would think that they would precut a cheesecake if you order one...while the cake was tasty it was a disastrous mess and the servings looked like blobs...no to future cheesecakes from here, at least Costco precut their cheesecake

The service was terrible! Sat waiting for food for an hour! The waitress forgot to give us napkins. Pasta tasted like cardboard. Manager had to tell us where our food was. Waitress got an attitude with us towards the end of our meal. Cheesecake was okay.

Took longer than quoted waited. It was supposed to be a birthday dinner with my family and we all ate at separate times because each entree was brought at different times. Ordered a drink from the bar and server forgot about it so I didn&#39;t get until the end of my meal. Ordered to slices of cheesecake to go and she again &#34;forgot&#34; so I had to wait even longer. Mind you I drove nearly 2 hours to get here to get the worst service ever! I&#39;ve been to multiple Cheesecake Factory restaurants over the years and never had a bad experience until I came to this one. I don&#39;t recommend anyone visit this one. Horrible experience from beginning to end

I love Cheesecake Factory. I had my birthday dinner here and our waiter was very kind to all of us. He made sure we had everything we needed and that all of our orders were correct. It was very clean and it wasn&#39;t that bad of a wait for a table.

I have been to I think four of these locations and although I really do enjoy their food, I truly do not appreciate the long lines and extreme waits for the food.  The company really needs to take a look at increasing guest satisfaction by expansion and not making their restaurants a destination location.  I mean it is DINNER not DISNEY!    Enough Said!

My sweet mother in law brought me lunch and I was disappointed. I had the chicken scampi pasta and when it arrived in the takeout box, it did not look appetizing. The pasta was not all coated with sauce and the chicken were the end pieces of the breast so very fatty and dry..bummer!!<br>Overall, it was okay and probably not something I&#39;ll get again.
I ordered shrimp with angel hair, had the saltiest pasta my entire life. After talking to both server and manager, I still had to pay for my bill even I just had a few bites on the pasta.

This is my third time to Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve been to their Cleveland location and to this one twice.  I ordered 2 of their grilled chicken sandwiches (once in Cleveland and also in Novi),  though it&#39;s called something more fancy, of course.  Well unfortunately the chicken was bloody,  luckily I&#39;m a &#34;cut your sandwich in half&#34; type of person and I noticed it prior to consumption.  The waitresses (yes, it happened TWICE) apologized profusely and removed it from the bills.  Not that it was expected but considering I almost got selmanila poisoning you&#39;d think I&#39;d get a complimentary piece of their name sake. No dice.  Wah!<br><br>Today&#39;s visit, the mac &amp; cheese balls were absolutely positively AMAZING!  Do yourself a favor and order them!  My Husband throughly enjoyed their &#34;Miso Salmon&#34; atop rice, he seriously was making &#39;oralgasm&#39; noises.  Ridiculous. Lol!  My entrée was their cheesesteak sandwich, the bread was super hard and the meat sadly had a weird gooey texture, the highlight was they didn&#39;t hold back on the cheese.  The fries...COLD.  Bummer. I love fries! Perhaps I&#39;m just picking badly?? They do have 200 things to pick from afterall.  I don&#39;t know but sadly my relationship with CF has been a strained one in the entrée department. <br><br>Out of fairness,  I&#39;ve never had a bad piece of cheesecake. TG or they should rethink the name.  Lol!  Note to all you cheapskates-- you&#39;ll be paying $6.95(plain)-$7.95 a slice but as the old saying goes &#34;you get what you pay for&#34;! My favorites in the cheesecake department is: Carrot cake,  Red Velvet, Godiva, PB Ripple... AMAZING!<br><br>The service has ALWAYS been amazing, the cheesecake brings me back... and well, my pouting Husband.  Lol! <br><br>Be prepared to wait well over an hour for dinner and the weekends are even longer! NO RESERVATIONS!

The Cheesecake Factory is the Cheesecake Factory. Pretty much the same everywhere. A little over priced, the food is a little overrated, there is always a longer wait than you expect. That being said, there is comfort in consistency. A big plate of eggplant parm will most likely be exactly the same in Chicago or Novi, and that isn&#39;t a bad thing. It can be a dinner, and your leftovers can be lunch the next day. The decor reminds me a little of something you would find at Disney World- also not a bad thing.

Food wise, The Cheesecake Factory never disappoints. It doesn&#39;t matter where you are. The experience however from location to location is much more variable. This location lost major points on a few fronts:<br><br>Firstly, they were out of all burgers, turkey, salmon and a few other items on the menu. Seriously, that&#39;s almost half the menu?!?! Um, okay...<br><br>Secondly, while it&#39;s great that there was outdoor seating, whenever the wind blew in a certain direction, we were overwhelmed by a pungent garbage smell. No exactly appetizing.<br><br>Lastly, the service was underwhelming. I hope given everything else that we were just there on an &#34;off&#34; night, but it took a while for our server to take our order, bring our order, refill beverages, etc. The poor man looked ready to call it a day and just quit on the spot. <br><br>Overall, I think next time I&#39;m in the mood for some Cheesecake Factory and in the area, I&#39;ll call my order in ahead of time and do it as take-out.

This is the most poorly managed restaurant I have ever been to. Going on 2-1/2 hours waiting for a table for a birthday party. Dont understand why everyone wants to come to this over priced, poorly managed location. I must be nuts for staying and waiting with my family. Never Coming Here Again!!!!!<br><br>In response: As you just suggested, we did arrive an hour before our desired eating time, which was 5:30pm. Are you suggesting that we should plan on arriving at 4:00pm in order to be seated at 6:30pm?

I choose to eat at The Cheesecake Factory every year on my birthday. It&#39;s always good food and even better cheesecake. This was my first year dining with my service dog accompanying me, I was a bit nervous that we would have issues with her being welcome since it is such a large restaurant. The staff was very accommodating and kind regarding her. I enjoyed my meal without issue and the waiter was very nice and prompt. I am so happy that I was able to enjoy my favorite place with more ease this year and hope to keep coming back for many years.

1. Need training on how to treat people.<br>2. Need to smile at their customer.<br>3. Need to make sure that they smile and say hello.<br>4. This is a multi billion dollar company and they should have a multi billion dollar customer service.<br><br>The african-american female &#34;greeter&#34; did not smile once, even after my senior citizen mother said &#34;i want to see a smile!&#34; The girl looked like we were bothering her, and appeared like she did not want to be there. <br><br>For God sakes find another job besides customer service GREETER if you can&#39;t even crack a smile for my family when we&#39;re going to spend over $150 on dinner for my senior citizen mom&#39;s birthday. We watched this girl walk people to their table the entire night, and she never once cracked a smile or said &#34;thank you&#34; or &#34;please.&#34; Just ATTITUDE! <br><br>Also, no free cheesecake slice on your birthday is disappointing.<br><br>There were flies everywhere. My shrimp alfredo was the worst meal I&#39;ve ever had in my life, with barely any shrimp. The little shrimp I did have were way over-cooked and rubbery.<br><br>We waited over an hour to be seated on a Sunday evening, and It was way too hot. The air conditioning should have been set at least 10 degrees colder. Our waiter was sweaty.
First time eating at The Cheesecake Factory. Went on a Saturday at noon, we were seated right away. Our waiter was great! Food was great! Will return

I have been to one other Cheesecake Factory (in Chicago) and it was phenomenal! But this one in Novi is absolutely garbage. Have gotten sick from their food here and the service is abysmal. DON&#39;T GO HERE UNLESS YOU WANT TO THROW YOUR MONEY IN THE TRASH.
The bang bang shrimp and Cesar salad were scrumptious. Our waitress was phenomenal and could multitask like a pro.  A piece of advice...... Save room for the cheesecake!!!!

I&#39;ve given 2 stars ONLY because we are obsessed with the cheesecake.  After years of carry out cheesecake my 13 year old decided to eat in for her bday dinner.  We arrived at 6:30 and were told 50 minutes for a party of 6 (4 kids 2 adults) The beepers they give when it&#39;s your turn don&#39;t reach outside the restaurant, and the waiting area is extremely crowded and not big enough AT ALL.  I understand space can&#39;t be changed though, so while annoying we dealt with it by taking shifts and letting the kids walk around.  7:20 came and we were told that we were quoted 50-70 min. (We weren&#39;t, but whatever, we weren&#39;t going to leave over 20 minutes). Long story short- this place is terribly ran.  We were seated at 8:15. There was no shrimp available at all for any meal. All of our food was cold, almost as though it was leftover and reheated. At this point (9:30) we were all so hungry, with 4 kids ages 6-13, that waiting any longer wasn&#39;t even an option, even to fix the food.  We did send back sweet potatoes fries once, and were given more cold ones.  The waiter said &#34;if these are cold we&#39;ll throw in fresh ones for you.&#34; As though they shouldn&#39;t always serve them fresh. To top it all off, They were out of vanilla bean, our favorite cheesecake.  We will never eat a meal here again.  A $150 meal, served cold with limited options as they were out of most things on a Saturday night.  Having been a restaurant manager manager and waitress previously, this place needs better management and better processes. We&#39;d have had a better experience at Applebee&#39;s for 1/4 the cost &amp; wait and better food

Five stars for the cheesecakes. One star for the long wait times. Three stars for food quality. Two stars for the prices. <br>I&#39;ve been eating at Cheesecake Factories for years, and have visited six locations total in four states. The best thing about Cheesecake Factory is of course the cheesecakes. They&#39;re amazing. At other locations in Texas and Nevada I&#39;d pop in and buy slices at the to-go counter all the time. Here though, it&#39;s a 20-30 minute wait just to stand in line and get a cheesecake to go! It&#39;s ridiculous. I&#39;ve stopped trying. Waiting for a table can take over an hour. This wouldn&#39;t be so bad if they would move to a text-message waiting system, so that you could shop in the mall while you wait. Instead they still give out old-fashioned clunky beepers that don&#39;t have a wide enough range to do anything but sit and wait in the hallway. <br>Cheesecake Factory&#39;s food has always been moderately good with enormous portions and ridiculously high prices. I don&#39;t mind paying big bucks for food if the price is commensurate with the quality. I&#39;ve never felt that Cheesecake&#39;s is worth the money it costs. That&#39;s why I prefer to just buy dessert to go. <br>Overall: This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I&#39;ve visited. But the cheesecake is amazing, so I put up with it on occasion.

Don&#39;t listen to the estimated time to wait..  we were told 15 - 20 minutes and walked out after multiple excuses and 40 minutes passed.  The worst experience I&#39;ve had in a long time. Another customer was told an hour for a family of 6, they waited just shy of 2 hours.

Today my friends and I took another trip here and as always were very impressed. We decided to sit on the patio as it was beautiful outside and also Memorial Day. Let me start with this, once on the comfy patio furniture I felt no rush to leave and was super happy to be there and enjoy my time. We ordered mocktails which I&#39;m so happy they offer, as a non-drinker the usual water or soda gets boring after a while. We ordered several appetizers instead of doing the traditional meals some may do. What we forgot is that their appetizers are very generous portions and the table quickly filled up with deliciousness! Our server was timely with everything and super friendly talking and making suggestions every time. I filled up on all the food but  I took cheesecake for home and as always the lemon raspberry cheesecake was just to die for. Would I go back? Absolutely, I make the drive from Rochester as often as I can for a meal here and now that I know about the patio it&#39;ll be my summer go to!
If there was zero stars I would give that. Worst possible service. The staff is racist here

The food was just okay and quality was expected for a for a food chain . The service was very slow. I didn&#39;t try their cheesecake because of how slow service was. Our server was a nice but meh I wasn&#39;t overly impressed.

Do yourself a favor and put The Cheesecake Factory on your bucket list. Heaven on earth in many ways. <br><br>So, my wife and I visited this location at 3 PM on a Wednesday. From what I&#39;ve heard, any time during a dinner rush and you&#39;ll be waiting in line like it&#39;s the Maverick at Cedar Point. We saw the hostess, got on the list, and got buzzed to our table roughly 10 minutes after we got in. It was pretty steady for a late lunch crowd. <br><br>Service was fantastic and the little details were notes thoroughly (cooking preferences, side items, etc.) I had the fish tacos and my wife had the macaroni and cheese burger. The food was literal perfection in every way: temperature, taste, texture. It was all amazing. <br><br>And what&#39;s a trip to The Cheesecake Factory without a slice? I shied away from my normal Tiramisu flavor and went with Pineapple Upside Down cheesecake this time. It was light and rich all at the same time. <br><br>Make it a priority and sit down for a meal here. You won&#39;t be disappointed.

Great food-terrible terrible guest service. If you have a party don&#39;t expect to eat here because due to the manager it&#39;s &#34;first come, first serve&#34;..... what? We drove an hour for my birthday. Didn&#39;t even eat &amp; left disgusted at the way we were treated. We were basically refused to be sat because &#34;it was going to be WAY to difficult to do&#34; <br><br>I get it. Im a waitress myself. I get busy &amp; I get big parties but for as popular as this place is you&#39;d think they would consider a reservation or at least not uptight attitudes... won&#39;t be back any time soon

literally we have been waiting for two mf hours &amp; then i look over my shoulder to see a father and a son getting an empty table of four for the TWO of them. Oh and they came after us. HI IM JUST CONFUSED AS TO WHY THIS IS HAPPENING i&#39;m hungry af did not ask for this bs i turned red &amp; felt hot air coming out my ears ugh. anyways let&#39;s see how the food will taste oh &amp; how long it&#39;ll take. i&#39;ll be back for more

Food is amazing but the timing for your food can often be ridiculously lengthy . The staff is friendly as long as they are waiting on you. <br>The wait for a table is very long and they don&#39;t take reservations. I will say though that is usually the case for a great restaurant.

I spent my 4th time at this restaurant just yesterday for my Mom&#39;s birthday. I&#39;ve had the chicken madera, the chicken Marsala, avocado eggrolls, crab wontons, Mexican chicken lettuce wraps, The Steak Diane, and more food that I can even remember. Needless to say it&#39;s worth the wait. Of course the earlier you go, the shorter the wait. The wait staff is always great and the atmosphere is beautiful! I love this restaurant and I will continue to frequent here! The cheesecake is AMAZING and each visit I tried a different type. They all were excellent!!!!

Surreal! I asked my family to take me there for my birthday, and it turned out to be a disaster. To start, we were told it would be a 45-60 minute wait. Now, this isn&#39;t atypical for this location, but since they&#39;re still on the old fashioned pager system instead of a proper text alert system like so many restaurants are embracing (and with their consistently long wait times, it&#39;s obscene that they haven&#39;t switched), we were stuck waiting near the place for that time, lest we go too far and lose our spot. It took nearly 85 minutes to get a table. Why? Their dishwasher broke, and supposedly they were having trouble getting clean dishes out to people as a result; a fact the hostess failed to tell me about when I checked in at the 45 minute mark, when she insisted it&#39;d only be another 10 minutes. We got told at the 70 minute mark.<br><br>So by the time we sit down, the whole family is pretty hungry and grumpy. I will say, our waiter took good care of us. He was polite, and efficient. He was the only redeeming factor of the evening. I ordered the Factory burrito, which turned out very bland and even a bit cold. My dad, however, got the shaft big time. He ordered the fish and chips, which were not only cold, but tasted like the sat in the oil way too long. After he sent it back and requested an order of chicken fingers, we all split our plates with him so he wouldn&#39;t sit there empty handed, but it was another 25 minutes before we gave up on the chicken fingers. We managed to get the fish and chips taken off the bill, and the chicken fingers came in literally as we were getting up from the table. <br><br>I would give them 1 1/2 stars, because I liked the waiter, and he at least tried to make it right for us, but overall, this was a lousy experience. By the time we were done, I didn&#39;t even want a slice of cheesecake, which was half the reason I came in the first place. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be back. any time soon, if at all.

Pathetic. Wait 2 hours to get in and then you get to be herded like cattle to your seat. The front desk staff has no concept of customer service. Food was mediocre and that is being generous. Stay away - there are better places by far.
Love the Cheesecake Factory!! My waiter was fast and very friendly. The wait was a little long but since I had a such a sweet waiter I didn&#39;t mind! Will be back for more

This restaurant is a little complicated.  I had never been to one until recently (this one opened up 5 minutes from my home, and I watch The Big Bang Theory), so I had to try it out.  When it first opened, it quickly became famous for having 3 hour seating waits (for people to wait that long... must be incredible right?).  The first time I dined there I was given an old Sears Christmas Catalog.  Oh wait... that&#39;s the menu!  It&#39;s a big menu.  When I quizzically commented on the size of the menu, the waitress proudly exclaimed &#34;Yep, 365 menu items for you to choose from&#34;.  My wife and I looked at each.  I was worried.  Knowing a little bit about the restaurant biz, the general motto for menu size is &#34;the bigger the menu the worse the food&#34;.   <br><br>After having eaten there about 10 times now, I can make some comments that I believe to be true. Their food is actually pretty good.  It&#39;s not &#39;wait 3 hours&#39; good, but I never have a bad dish, and some dishes are incredible.  They get around making bad food from a large menu by loading their dishes with fat.  And I can&#39;t stress this enough.  They use heavy cream, cheese, oils, sugar, and salt so generously you would think they owned stock in them.  Their serving sizes are also quite generous.  When you get people addicted to trans fat and sugar, yes they will flock to you.  But the menu size also contributes to the long waits at this restaurant as the kitchen is accommodating an incredible number of varying orders.  <br><br>Now there are some healthy items if you really look for them.  The Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps are delicious and weight watcher friendly.  There is a &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu there, but BIG WARNING here - they just replace fat with salt - A LOT of salt.  <br><br>In short, I eat here occasionally, but purposely avoid it sometimes for health reasons. If you don&#39;t care about your health and what you put in your body, this is a fantastic restaurant - the dishes only go from good to great, the portion sizes are huge, and the deserts are straight out of Willy Wonka&#39;s dreams.

When this place opened, I was working retail at the mall, we had so many customers solely because they were on the wait list at The Cheesecake Factory and it was a 6-8 hour wait, no joke. This place was a huge addition to Twelve Oaks.<br><br>I went with a couple friends, and this was my first time to a Cheesecake Factory. It was a year after they opened so there was no crazy wait time, and it was summer, so they had very nice outdoor seating. We ended up sitting outside, it was a very nice day. We sat under a big umbrella in what was like a big outdoor booth.<br><br>I ordered the pretzel crusted chicken strips, which is an appetizer. I didn&#39;t enjoy them as much as I thought I would, and the presentation wasn&#39;t exactly appetizing... They were served on wood skewers and one of them broke inside the chicken, so I was afraid I was going to eat part of the stick. This is why I gave four out of five stars!<br><br>The waitress was great, even when she was waiting on multiple tables she made time to refill our drinks quickly and was knowledgeable about the menu.<br><br>We ordered cheesecake, and I am not a cheesecake person, but I tried a couple bites, and it was great. It was the S&#39;Mores cheesecake, it looked almost too good to eat, but we devoured it within minutes.<br><br>Beautiful place, I didn&#39;t get to venture to the back of the restaurant, mainly the outdoor seating, bathrooms and bar area. I&#39;d definitely go back again, just not at a busy time!

Very frustrating to understand why people at the CF think they can stand around and waste time while the customers are waiting on them.  Last time I will go there !  It&#39;s overpriced and I can get the Cheesecake at Costco for less.  Kick myself for not going to Costco to get the cake.  Waited 30 minutes for them to prep my cake.  I had 1 lady ahead of me.  I hope you can better manage your time at CF Novi than what I saw!!!  What a waste of everyone&#39;s time for everyone to have the staff standing around trying to figure out their personal lives.

Terrible slow service, it was a weekday so we got a table right away but waited 10 mins and nobody came so finally had to go looking for a server.  Ordered chedder stuffed burger and took a bite of a raw hamburger with a cold middle. Showed the waitress and she got the manager who finally came over, after about 10 mins and took it off the bill and asked if i wanted something else but at this point i didnt trust them to cook anything else. In my opinion the manager should have comp the whole meal or at least our appetizer but whatever. So i was there for an hour and a half with my wife and had an order of fries. I would never go back here.

The food is good, that&#39;s it...good. It&#39;s not head over heals spectacular. The cheesecake is delicious but why why why did it take 2 hours to get cheesecake? That doesn&#39;t include the 40 minutes we waited to get in. We were prepared for a wait to get in but seriously? It took 118 minutes from the moment we sat down to the moment our cheesecake was delivered to our table. We didn&#39;t even go for dinner, just dessert. <br><br>The next trip we went in a Sunday right after opening for lunch &amp; cheesecake. Figuring the 2 hour cheesecake situation had to be a flop maybe because it was Friday and so on. Nope, over 2 hours for lunch and another 45 for cheesecake. <br><br>I&#39;m very perplexed as to what is going on in the kitchen? Are there live chickens in there? Is the chicken piccata that fresh?<br><br>Kinda bummed because they have some really great cheesecake flavors but I can&#39;t waste an entire afternoon for cheesecake.
Service is slow. Food is very disappointing and expensive. Drinks are pricey. Nice atmosphere and good cheesecake.  A good place to throw away your money! So sad.

As always the food is good but tonight&#39;s visit was made even better by our waiter Jake; he made our dining experience fun and insightful.  For great service and overall fun and enjoyable experience while dining here, ask to sit in Jake&#39;s section.  He doesn&#39;t work on Monday&#39;s but he&#39;s there most other days of the week; checkout Sunday mornings for brunch as well.  Thanks Jake for a wonderful time; Cheesecake Factory has an excellent employee and I hope they appreciate the level of service you provide their customers; you made us feel like family and friends!  Also, your entree suggestions were spot on; we&#39;ll certainly be back for more...

Overpriced and overcrowded. Seriously, you can get much better food anywhere down Novi road or grand river. If you want to eat here, be prepared to wait no matter what time you go. Cheesecake is phenomenal though...try getting it though carry out!

I really used to love this place.  It&#39;s an hour from home, there&#39;s always a 2 hour wait, no reservations, no call ahead seating.. but, it&#39;s usually good food and a good selection, especially their small bites and apps.  This time I ended up having to argue with my waitress which was very awkward and I won&#39;t return.<br><br>I&#39;ll just get down to it:<br><br>Told 40 minute wait.. was over an hour.  Ok, whatever.  We get seated around 7 on a Sunday (didn&#39;t get out until after 9).  Of course we&#39;re put in those row booths with chairs on the other side so you&#39;re about 6 inches from the people next to you.  There are 3 of us including a toddler which makes you want a little privacy so the kid&#39;s not bugging people.  They don&#39;t care about that there.<br><br>10 minute wait for drink and I was very thirsty after waiting for over an hour to be seated.  It&#39;s not a terribly long wait.  30 minute wait for bread.  <br><br>Ordered the crab cake bites.  Really good and a good price.  Didn&#39;t wait long for those.<br><br>Next.  Ordered the fish tacos for dinner.  Wife had the shrimp and salmon combination.  Kid had the bowtie pasta with butter and parmesan.<br><br>My wife&#39;s dish came out 5 minutes before the rest.  Whatever.<br><br>Kids pasta was ok.  A LOT of butter for a kid&#39;s dish.  We didn&#39;t get the included drink.  Probably would have ordered a milk.  A lot of places also offer a veggie or something.  Not here.  $7 for something I could make for 50 cents.  3 ingredients.  Pretty easy. <br><br>Wife&#39;s fish was nice and moist.  Shrimp tasty.   Mashed potatoes were really good.  But there were only 3 small shrimp and about a 4 ounce piece of fish.  I recall large portions at Cheesecake Factory and always bringing food home... no longer.  And, for $22 I expected at least 4 shrimp?  <br><br>Finally, fish tacos, bleh.  Fish was ok.  The salsa stuff didn&#39;t have much flavor.  They forgot the avocado... I told my waitress when she brought our desert after checking the menu to confirm.  She just acknowledged it and I asked her to tell them they forgot it.  Fish tacos without avocado... maybe it&#39;s small, but I would have ordered one of the other 500 things on the menu if i knew there would be no avocado.  Anyway, she gave us the bill.  Kind of snuck it under my arm.  I found her and told her that I wasn&#39;t happy and asked if she told a manager.  I said all this waiting and a relatively expensive dinner I expect my dish to be correct.  She told me if I had told her during dinner she would have fixed it.. well, she had disappeared for 10 minutes after the food came so I had already eaten half the meal.  Then she asked what I wanted her to do... that the manager would ask the same thing.  Really?  You screw something up and expect the customer to have to ask for something?  I at least expected a manager to come and apologize.  Offer a free drink, desert, something.  I told her to let the manager decide and she gave us the kid&#39;s meal for free.  Still, no manager came and said a word.  She didn&#39;t apologize and just handed us the check.  10% tip instead of 20% right there.  Be nice and fix the problem and it would have been 25%.<br><br>You get the idea that since there&#39;s such a long wait they don&#39;t have to actually try any more.  Like they could lose half their customers and still be busy so why work on customer service.  Even without the issue with the waitress and the avocado you just add up all the little things and wonder why you just waited so long to eat there.  And WHY would you pay $8 for a slice of cheesecake.. it&#39;s not THAT good.  Well, I have no reason to go back to twelve oaks or the cheesecake factory.  If I screw up and forget this experience and you see me there, please punch me.  I deserve it.
The food is delicious. The service is great. The prices are as expected. My only qualm is the ridiculous wait times. No reservations. No call ahead seating. Carve out 4-5 hours for a meal.

This place always has a ridiculously long line. If you sit in the bar area either high top tables or bar its first come first serve. So while the tables had a two hour wait, we lucked out and sat right away at the bar.<br><br>Started with spicy chicken nachos. It was large portion, as are most things here. Came with guacamole, salsa and sour cream. Great for sharing.<br><br>We then got shrimp summer rolls. It came with two dipping sauces, one peanut and another soy sauce based. Very good and refreshing.<br><br>We finished with a peanut butter cheesecake and a raspberry lemon cheesecake. Both very good. The raspberry had the most amazing raspberry sauce.

Food is average but the cheesecake is always good. Service is also pretty sloppy. The fact we had to wait 30 min for our dessert and about 45 min for our food. The waitress also didn&#39;t pay attention to what we asked for I personally had to ask 3 times for lemons.

The food was very tasty, although I wasn&#39;t really impressed with the service this time. Our waitress who&#39;s name was Amanda seemed to be overwhelmed or something because she wasn&#39;t really attentive to our needs. I asked her for sweetener for my tea and she said one second. Then she went and took the order of two other tables. By the time she brought my sweetener, my tea was cold. It will probably be s while before I come back. It was good but not that good.

Went for brunch with a couple of friends, which technically was just breakfast items on the regular 20 page menu. Nothing super special or different. Waited about 30 minutes for all of our food that came out cold. Also, they brought out one of our meals 15 minutes before getting the rest of the tables food out. Was disappointing because I&#39;ve been for dinner and had some tasty food. I wouldn&#39;t recommend for brunch. But we were hungry and didn&#39;t want to wait the two hours at Toasted Oak.

Absolutely terrible! DO NOT waste your time or hard earned money here!!! Bad service. Bad food. Pasta tasted like it came out of a 99 cent Chef Boyardee can. The service, however was the worst. Rude, inconsiderate, and inattentive. I do not know how this place stays in business. Well I&#39;m sure it won&#39;t be around for long unless major changes are made.

I&#39;ve been here many times and wait times are always long so what I do is usually get a buzzer and my name on the list and go home for an hour or just walk around the mall. This last time i sat at the bar and drank samples of wine until I found the ones I liked and got two bottles of those for my sisters gathering later that night. The bartender was very helpful. The samples were in miniature wine glasses and were free!! Super great service from the bar so I left her a tip!

Be prepared for a soaking<br>One thing the Cheesecake Factory knows how to do is seperate you from your wallet.<br>The average entree starts at 15 dollars and goes up<br>A slice of cheesecake goes from 7 to 9 dollars<br><br>I went there on a sunday afternoon and it was packed<br>The girl at the front desk said it would be 30 minutes to get a buzzer, and a 60 to 90 minutee wait for a table.<br>Unless the dishes are platnium plated and the food is top notch nothing is worth a 2 hour wait just to &#34;Be Seen&#34; at the CheeseCake Factory. I bolted for another restaurant.

I was so excited when we finally got or very own Cheesecake Factory.  I love cheesecake!  Unfortunately, I haven&#39;t had great luck with the regular food.  I&#39;ve tried 4 different menu items as the main course and have liked none of them.<br><br>This place gets very crowded, quickly.  They open at 11 AM.  I always get there right after they open.  You have your best chance of getting in without waiting.<br><br>As far as they cheesecake, I&#39;ve yet to have a bad slice.  My personal favorite is the Godiva cheesecake, (I&#39;m not willing to share it).  My daughters and husband love the Oreo Extreme Cheesecake.<br><br>My two recommendations for this place is to go early, and remember that you&#39;re their for the cheesecake!
Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorites. The menu is very extensive, service is always good.
Me and my wife love this place. Food is great and we&#39;ve always had great servers. The only downside is the wait times but that&#39;s not bad.

A big choice of food and as well a menu for low calorie food. The american cheese cake is awesome and I enjoyed the time. Waitress was nice and polite as well. Good place to get different choices of american cheese cake like oreo cheese cake etc.

Went on a very busy Thursday afternoon with colleagues, the wait was reasonable and honestly expected with the crowd the way it was. <br><br>Seated within the amount of time in which we were told. Were approached very promptly by our server. She was very sweet and knew the menu and the specials for the day. <br><br>The food was there in record time for the amount of guest in the establishment. Our drinks were constantly refilled. <br><br>The food was awesome everyone liked what they ordered. <br><br>If you are going here especially around the weekend prepare yourself for a wait and have realistic expectations.<br><br>Also if this is your first time or it&#39;s been awhile check out the menu online so you are not overwhelmed.

You wait.. and wait... and wait and when you wait till the time they tell you, you wait some more then you finally sit down to a sweet waitress and eat some great food and then you wait..,and wait again for your cheesecake. The waiting sucks!
Too costly for the quality and type of food on the menu, no better then most resturants. However, the cheesecakes served are delicious.

An update to my 8/25/13 post.  We went there to celebrate my mother&#39;s 73rd birthday.<br>I understand they do not take reservation over the phone, so I went there to reserve a spot for over 20 people.  I was told it was a 2 - 2 and1/2 hour wait. This was at 1:45 p.m.  I notified my family and told them to arrive around 4:30 p.m.  We did not get seated until 6:00 p.m. because there was another large party there that had been there for over 2 hours and did not leave until an hour after cashing out their bill.  They should have some kind of rule in place for large groups that after dinner is finished you should not linger around for another hour or so.  Once our family was seated, we conversed, ordered and ate dinner and left after we finished.  We didn&#39;t want to be rude in case some other people were waiting.  2 hours is long enough to eat and converse. 3 and1/2 hours is ridiculous!!!!<br><br>Anyway, the food was delicious and the wait staff was excellent.

It makes me sad to give this place 2 stars. The service is pathetic. My 1st experience was good.<br>2nd experience: it took 20+ minutes to get guacamole. and it was 45 minutes but the main course had not arrived. We canceled the order and left.<br>3rd experience:  went there with kids. No breads. The main course was served before the appetizers. The waitress didnt care. <br>I love the food here -- but the dining experience is really bad. <br><br>I have had much better experience in TCF in Atlanta , Chicago and Jacksonville. This place needs to ramp up its service quality.

Excellent.  There is always a long wait but that&#39;s because the food is always excellent.  Every dish I have had here is good.  Whenever I am traveling Cheesecake Factory is always a standby. They really need to build more of these in Michigan.

Food was only alright for the price. Had to wait almost 30 minutes for cheesecake because it was backed up. Will never go back. I don&#39;t even normally leave reviews but you get bored when waiting that long for desert.

The wait was over an hour but it was well worth it! The menu had so many options it was very hard to make a decision!! However I ended selecting the Cajun jambalaya pasta! It was delicious, seasoned &amp; cooked perfectly!! The service was also great!! Ok now let&#39;s get the the famous cheesecake desert!! We prefer the turtle cheesecake!! It was simply ok! It didn&#39;t taste homemade, it rather tasted like it was bought &amp; not prepared in house! Maybe we selected the wrong type of cheesecake!! We are definitely going back &amp; will try a different type of cheesecake desert!!

The cheesecake factory is nothing really to get overly excited about. Its your standard American fare  favorites that range from pasta, burritos to orange chicken. The portions are large so bring an empty stomach. But not too empty because the waits are still pretty long. For our party of 6 we waited and hour to be seated. Once seated I would say it took 30 minutes for our food once the order was placed. And another 30 minutes for our cheesecakes that we ordered to go. Our waiter was great; made sure we had refills and plenty of bread as we waited.<br><br>Now to the good stuff our food. I ordered the chicken Bellagio which I wanted to sub the cream sauce it comes with for Alfredo sauce. I had this dish before and didn&#39;t care for the sauce it came with. It wasn&#39;t thick enough for my liking. I get my plate eat some of it and realize it wasn&#39;t Alfredo sauce. Huge disappointment but since I didnt want to wait another long time for the correction I just sucked it up and decide just set it aside and safe room for cheesecake. My mother ordered  the burrito which was surprisingly good. I would def give that a try next time. My sister had there steak Diane and chicken Madeira which are favorites of mine. Absolutely love the sauces on them. My uncle had their Shepard&#39;s pie which he enjoyed. The cheesecakes were delicious as usual. The food is really good here despite me receiving the wrong sauce. Its nothing to die for or to wait over an hour for but it is better than your average chain.
The waiting period is unacceptable for the quality of the food. I&#39;m thinking I&#39;m getting some A1 food but it wasn&#39;t even all that
Excellent restaurant. Nice variety. Prepared well with fresh ingredients. Cheesecake is awesome. Service professional. Near perfect.

The service I received today was unacceptable. I was completely ignored the entire time until it was time to pay then he arrowed toward the tip section. I will no longer tip for customer service that is substandard I&#39;m over it. PLEASE PICK ANOTHER CAREER!!!!!!
Love the Cheesecake Factory. Not a huge fan of the wait when coming here but the food always makes the wait seem like nothing at all.

It makes me sad to give a restaurant 3 stars, but in this case I think the rating is generous. <br><br>I have been to this restaurant 3 times. The first time everything was good. We knew we would have to wait, and that was fine. Once we were seated all was well except the cocktails were slow coming out. I got wasabi tuna, and my boyfriend got the Jamaican shrimp--he made the better choice. I can&#39;t remember which cheesecakes we got but they were good too. <br><br>The second time we went, a Tuesday night, the restaurant was still full but our wait was only about 20 minutes. We ordered an appetizer, which seemed to be taking awhile to come out. Then all of a sudden our meals were brought out! We decided to cancel the appetizer. I can&#39;t remember what my boyfriend ordered, but I got the combo chicken madeira and steak diane. I took a bite of my chicken and the sauce was really good, but the texture was not right. I looked, and the chicken was raw. I showed my boyfriend to get confirmation and he said yep--that&#39;s raw. I showed my server when she returned and she apologized. The manager came over and offered a complimentary salad while we waited. He also gave us 2 free slices of cheesecake. I wasn&#39;t angry--I understood and thought it was handled well. I was lucky to not get sick. <br><br>I brought my mom on the Saturday before mother&#39;s day. I had enjoyed the steak diane, so I ordered the combo with that and the salmon. I asked for medium rare-medium steak. I could not find a speck of pink in the meat. It was very well done. We had already waited a couple hours and I did not want to wait for my meal (again). So I just ate the salmon (which was great) and choked down the dry meat. <br><br>The kitchen is having some serious organizational issues. Perhaps investing in a reliable meat thermometer would be useful? <br><br>I like the cheesecake, but I&#39;m inclined to just get a piece to go after dining somewhere else in the area.

I only came to this place because I had a gift card. We ordered a salmon dish and shrimp scallops with steak. Both cake with mashed potatoes. The food was presented very well but didn&#39;t have the oomph taste. Everyone takes how amazing this place is but the food was not all that, however it did look good but it tasted like food that you would get from a all u can eat buffet. The food was not that hot when it came out, it was warm, I was able to tell that it was sitting out for a while. We also ordered chicken pretzels and fried mac n cheese balls. The chicken pretzel didn&#39;t taste as good as it looked. It tastes like a piece of chicken breast meat that was very fried and crispy. However the sauce that came with it was amazing. The fried mac n cheese was great (they are known for that). The good thing is that there menu is huge and you can pick a from a variety of things.<br>For dessert I got the carrot cake cheesecake! It was amazing! So yummmmy! <br><br>If I got next time I will probably have dessert and probably a light appetizer or salad. Not worth dinning in because there food isn&#39;t all that.

Went on a weekend and waited in line for 30 minutes to get a take out order. There was no room for those waiting to be seated and those waiting in line for take out orders.  After the long wait, the cheesecake was ok.

All I needed was to pick up a 10inch low carb frozen Cheesecake. Last year we picked up the same low carb 10inch cheesecake and I was in and out within 10 minutes. Today it took me 45. There was one person in the to go line ahead of me and after he placed his order both people at the register left and I was standing alone for 10 mins. Finally a girl came and took my order and I watched as she placed the paper near the cheesecake area and waited. 10..20..25 mins pass by and people are lining up getting antsy. I noticed there were people behind me who already got their cakes which didn&#39;t make sense as I watched them place their order after me. I went to the hostess area and told the lady my situation and she said in a rude tone &#34;they&#39;re backed up or maybe they called your name and you just didn&#39;t hear it. It takes a while because they have to take the Cheesecake out put dressing on it and set it up nicely in the box. the people that ordered after you probably ordered something small. Ask them how much longer&#34; well... 1. I stood there the entire time they did not call my name. I would&#39;ve heard it. 2. I ordered a plain low fat cheesecake... there&#39;s nothing to do to it except put it in a box. It&#39;s just a plain frozen cheesecake no whip cream nothing. 3. She could&#39;ve just said I&#39;m sorry for the wait. We&#39;ve been really backed up. I would say I&#39;m pretty patient but her tone was just rude. <br><br>I normally don&#39;t post reviews or say anything but I felt that the staff was not attentive nor really cared bc it&#39;s not their problem. <br><br>The guy at the pick up area was nice about it though and he agreed that the low carb cheesecake shouldn&#39;t take that long- and he apologized for the wait which made up for it. He looked to check if t came out.. which if didn&#39;t and he had someone call the back to bring it out. They did that within 5 mins. I didn&#39;t catch his name but he should be handling customer service as his responses are a lot better than the ladies there.

Service is deplorable,  the cutlery is always dirty and the glasses are consistently,  shamelessly murky. In addition, the servers are UNTRAINED and act as if they are working at a theme park...this location HAD to be a rush job. <br><br>I have been to Cheesecake Factory locations all over the US and it was hands-down my favorite restaurant before going to the Novi location.<br><br>I live 2 mins away from this restaurant and would rather drive 5 hours to Chicago then patronize this establishment. I was so excited that i was going to have a Cheesecake Factory in my backyard...epic fail!

Appetizer came out 5 minutes before the meal and was cold. By the time it came out again I had sent part of my meal back for being cold, got the fresh food, and finished my meal. Again the appetizer was cold. It comes with a special sauce and after bringing it out four times and being assured four times it was the right sauce it still wasn&#39;t. The manager than attempted to prove me wrong. <br><br>The waitress was great but I can&#39;t say the same for the management.

Came here at almost 10 pm. No wait. Amazing waitress! She kept our drinks filled and made sure we had what we needed. We enjoyed fresh, warm bread and I had Chicken Carbonara. Perfect. By the time I finished dinner, I sadly had no room for cheesecake. Nice atmosphere. Prices a bit high but it was worth it for a nice dinner. The chicken pretzel bites were delicious too. I&#39;ve been here one other time with friends from Canada and had the perfect meal then too.

Made a bad first impression. Very slow and poor service today. Brought the before meal bread AFTER my food came. To me, this place is overpriced and over rated. Would probably NOT return to this place.

Meh... not all that. Super long wait due to being in the mall which is a no brainer. The main issue I have is the food. It sucks. I have been to many cheesecake factories all over the country and this is by far the worst. Servers are ok and treat you fine but again when you wait that long for food, you expect it to actually taste good. 3 times I&#39;ve tried it and all 3 times were a fail

So I come here often because I work in the mall and not that many options for a good salad around here... Bianca always seems to be at the bar LOOKING MISERABLE. Every single time it never fails, she doesn&#39;t smile, IS NOT welcoming and is rude and will ignore you when she notices you want service. The person sitting next to me said &#34;maybe bc your only having a water&#34; I&#39;m sorry I didn&#39;t know I was required to drink alcohol while working at 1 in the afternoon for friendly service or a smile. The only reason I left 2 stars is because my Greek salad is always good. Once in a while there is another man bartender sometimes who is OUTSTANDINGLY Nice and a breathe of fresh air. I also work in the service industry and I know how to treat customers. Seems I&#39;m not the only one not impressed with the staff, the 3 stars with over 500 comments says it all.

I&#39;m a big fan of The Cheesecake Factory. And I will continue to be. But this location does not meet up to the rest. The service is slow and the managers are completely unaware of the chaos that unfolds. I work in the service industry and understand that variables that affect operations. However, this place is bar far one of the worst. Any item off the menus takes 20-25 minutes. I ordered a steak salad medium it too 30 minutes. When it came out the steak was well done and the steak ice cold. It had been sitting for some time as the lettuce started to wilt.<br><br>I tried to give them another try so I ordered a carry out order this past Sunday and they forgot half my order.<br><br>Beyond unacceptable!

My husband and I went on a Saturday at about 11:30am and although they were packed, we were seated right away. Our server was great, and kept our drinks full.<br>My husband got the double bacon cheeseburger and he said it was one of the BEST burgers he ever had. I had the homemade veggie burger which WAS the best I&#39;ve ever had. The green salad that came with my veggie burger was blah. Just greens with some kind of vinaigrette. <br>    We shared a piece of Lemon Meringue Cheesecake and it was the best cheesecake we&#39;ve ever had, and it better be for $7.99 for one slice. <br>I give 4 stars instead of 5 because of the salad and very high prices.

I didn&#39;t think I&#39;d ever write a bad review on Cheesecake Factory.  I&#39;ve eaten at a Cheesecake Factory about 20 times in 5 or 6 different cities.  Our 4 1/2 hour experience at the Novi Michigan restaurant was so bad I feel compelled to describe what happened.  The 2 1/2 hour wait for a table was not enjoyable but this is what we were told when we requested a table for 6.  This was supposed to be a birthday celebration for my wife.  I do expect good service and good food after waiting the 2 1/2 hours.  The waitress brought our food and there were issues with all 4 of the adult dishes.  One meal didn&#39;t even come because the rare steak that was ordered was overcooked and the waitress said they had to start over.  My wife does not like mushrooms and requested her pasta dish without the mushrooms.  It, of course, was served with mushrooms so they took it away to be redone.  The other 2 meals were served only luke-warm but the waitress was already gone so we ate it.  The manager stopped and apologized for the 2 meals being screwed up and said they would get the replacement meals to us quickly.  About 10 minutes later, the steak was re-served and it also was cooked to medium-well rather than rare.  The manager nor the waitress came back to see if it was cooked properly.  Later, when everyone else was finished eating, my wife&#39;s dish came remade without mushrooms.<br><br>I have had many restaurant experiences where something didn&#39;t go right and your opinion is strongly based on how the manager handles the issue.  In this case, we had to ask to see the manager again.  His solution was to not charge us for the steak dinner and give us 2 free pieces of cheesecake (one for steak dinner and other for the pasta dish made with mushrooms).  Not charging us for a steak dinner that was not cooked correctly (twice) and not eaten is not a deal and does nothing to satisfy an unhappy customer.  You&#39;re not charging them for something they didn&#39;t get.  When we told the manager we didn&#39;t think a free piece of cheesecake seemed adequate for a very bad restaurant experience, he asked what we thought he should do.  We said he should offer the person who ordered the steak dinner a free meal.  He replied that he was not able to do that and could only offer the free cheesecake.<br><br>So, the waitress brought menus back for the cheesecake and then the manager showed up again and said he was not supposed to do this but wanted to give the person who ordered the steak a $30 gift card.  We all thought he was making an effort to amend our bad experience.  Except, the waitress came back and said the manager noticed we had a coupon for 2 pieces of cheesecake so he was rescinding his offer of free cheesecake in lieu of the $30 gift card he gave us.  Now we&#39;re back to unhappy.  And untrustfull (if that&#39;s a word), so I checked the bill closely and guess what.  I was charged $30 for the gift card.  The waitress said she would remove it and by now I just wanted to get out of that place except we had to wait another 25 minutes to get our cheesecake.  Since we had nothing better to do while waiting for our cheesecake we called the number on the back of the gift card and discovered its value was $0.  I can&#39;t really finish this story because I got tired of sitting and left while the rest of our party dealt with the manager to get the $30 they were promised.<br><br>My summary of the entire event is that in most restaurants where I&#39;ve had issues the manager does whatever he can to make sure I come back.  This manager did not do that.  He was offering a free piece of cheesecake to make up for the really bad experience and if that wasn&#39;t good enough and we never come back, he has plenty of other customers waiting to eat at his restaurant.

Wow! So many negative reviews -- people are hard to please, eh?<br><br>Firstly, yes, the wait is going to be astronomical if you&#39;re coming on a Saturday with a party or six or more; that&#39;s just common sense. <br><br>Secondly, come a decent time! Both times that I came here, I was seated immediately and the food came out quick and was fresh and tasty.<br><br>This place has a fun atmosphere with tasty dishes and even tastier desserts, especially the cheesecake. <br><br>I enjoy this place every time I come, regardless of which city I&#39;m in. <br><br>Yum! :)

The food was good - not great. Also the service is terrible. We got seated and had to wait 10 mins until we complained to get a server. Paul the manager came by and apologized but the service never got better! It was just a horrible dinning experience which is just sad.
Terrible service and long wait time. <br>Food isn&#39;t that great either. Ruined my dinner with my family. Do not recommend to anyone

Food today was a let down. My family and I love this restaurant, 4 out of 8 meals were cold and another was burned. Asked to speak to the manager and he wasn&#39;t helpful. Our waiter tried his best to work with what he was given. Love the chain but not this location.

Inflated prices. $15 for a salad. Yes it was good, but for $15 you can add more than 4oz of chicken... More than a tsp Of sour cream and that green stuff.. The dressing didn&#39;t fit the salad . ( chicken tostada) and instead of cilantro, there were several sprigs of parsley . <br><br>Lots of corn and diced tomatoes
So over rated pasta was mushy and tomatoes tasted like they were out of a can. Service was very average expected more.
What can say I love the appetizers and of course the cheesecake everyone who works there always has a smile on your face and has a great attitude!

Ridiculously cold in this restaurant on a cold, rainy April day.  Management response: it takes an hour and a half for it to warm up - unacceptable. Eating in zipped-up coats.<br><br>Service: Fine. Attentive, helpful waiter Michael. <br><br>Wait for food: Long, considering this is not fine cuisine.  Medium busy visit time at 2:00.<br><br>Food quality:  B+. Excellent burger - well cooked, excellent flavor &amp; bun. Beef sandwich very good. Orange chicken very good.  Low cal chopped salad - meh. A lot of greens, perhaps too much head lettuce. Tough to find the chicken in it. <br><br>Value:  B<br><br>Overall: Its a chain. The experience suffered due how uncomfortably cold it was in here - and not any better by meals end. Despite multiple complaints by us and others, no manager checked on food or anything. Merely walking the floor to see table churn. Disappointing.<br><br>Overall: Come on a hot day. Wait a while. Good service, decent food. Poor management attention to satisfaction.

I&#39;m not even going to mention the wait to sit down because that&#39;s to be expected. What I will mention is the wait for our food - which I can understand to a certain point. But what was aggravating was that the food was luke warm when we got it. So we waited all that time and our food was just sitting their under a heat lamp while our waitress did who knows what. Our waitress was slow for everyone in our section and didn&#39;t refill drinks or bring out appetizers and entrees at the right time. And when we finally got our food it was greasy as heck! It was not worth the money they were asking and it definitely wasn&#39;t worth the wait. We have gone to this location four or five times and it&#39;s been heading in a downward direction each time. We will not be going back.

I&#39;d give zero stars if I could.  I went with my friend to get cheesecake slices to go.  She ordered ONE slice and was told by the cashier it was going to be 20-25 minutes.  What? For one pre-sliced piece?!  Okay....well it turns out we would have been happy with the 25 minute wait because it ended up turning into an HOUR wait!  The people in front of us had been waiting an hour and twenty minutes.  Ridiculous!! They need a better system because the kitchen orders and the to-go orders are filled by the same staff and it seemed the kitchen orders were priority. <br><br>They also need to be honest about the wait time because we could have decided it wasn&#39;t worth the wait.  But they lie to you about the wait time and take your money first so you&#39;re stuck there.  With the manager present, when my friend called out the cashier on the wait time, she lied and said she told us an hour and wouldn&#39;t have told us 20-25 minutes.  I HEARD her tell my friend 20-25 minutes and to have her lie about it was enraging.  Own up to it and apologize.  <br><br>If I were you, have the cashier write the wait time on your receipt and on a crowded night, ask the people waiting in line for to go orders how long they have been waiting.  Or better yet, don&#39;t go at all.  <br><br>This place needs a more efficient system to deal with the to go orders.  Ridiculous and horrible service. Never again.

I won&#39;t even lie: I was as excited as everyone else that Michigan finally got a Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;ve been to the locations in Chicago and Fort Lauderdale, and remember them fondly. <br><br>So why was I horribly underwhelmed with last night&#39;s dinner?<br><br>After a 50 minute wait, we were seated. We started with an appetizer of fried macaroni and cheese (my mom&#39;s request). They were....weird. We were served 4 baseball sized macaroni and cheese balls. There was a bit of tomato sauce on the plate (still not sure if it was a garnish, or a dip). They were tasty, but gave me an instant stomachache.<br><br>For dinner, I had the chile rellenos burger. Chile Rellenos is my absolute favorite food to order at Mexican restaurants, so I thought I&#39;d give it a go. The pepper was stuffed with cream cheese, like a jalapeno popper. It wasn&#39;t horrible, but it definitely wasn&#39;t what I thought it would be. <br><br>My mom ordered the Bellagio Chicken. It was bright green because of the pesto they used. They also covered the entire dish in basil. It looked like a big green mess (and I love pesto). <br><br>My daughter ordered the cheeseburger sliders, which came out with no cheese. We sent it back and they promptly fixed it.<br><br>For dessert, we had the smores cheesecake - which was amazing. Fantastic. I can&#39;t say enough words to describe how delicious this was. <br><br>The bill for two adults and one child was $60. We didn&#39;t have any alcohol. <br><br>Pricey and underwhelming. I&#39;d go back for the cheesecake...provided someone else was paying.
Food is below average and the silverware had dried food on it. Didn&#39;t think the wait was worth it and the staff was not friendly

I had the strangest experience at the Cheesecake Factory (CF) in Novi (12 Oaks) this evening.  I have been eating at the Cheesecake Factories for over 20 years and always sought these out in cities in which they were located.  I was thrilled when CF decided to open a new location in Novi (12 Oaks).  This evening we decided to have dinner at CF and asked for patio seating.  It turns our out they were cleaning the septic tanks adjacent to the patio and the &#34;aroma&#34; of patio seating was quite unpleasant.  We requested our table be moved inside.  I brought this up to the manager and she was very dismissive of our experience and was not evening willing to give us a complimentary piece of cheesecake.  Two servers profusely apologized for our experience and ironically, this was the one of the evenings they had trainees.  Truth is stranger than fiction and I am surprised how the management at CF can be so insensitive of the customer&#39;s dining experience.  I am curious to see if this location is meeting their performance benchmarks (very empty) and can understand if they are not as they just lost a 20+ year loyal customer.

decent, but not great. the two stars are solely for the cheesecake only.<br><br>we visited on a late Saturday night, and our party of 4 was able to walk right in and get seated. the service was pretty good, but other than that i see no reason people are willing to wait 3+ hours to eat here.<br><br>our table ordered the spinach dip, cajun jambalaya pasta, gumbo, and a burger. the spinach dip was literally just ok, nothing special and definitely not worth the $12 we paid for it. the problem i had was with my Cajun jambalaya pasta, seriously people? why are so many people obsessed with this dish? do people just not know how to cook at home and are easily impressed? that has to be it, because when i say there was 0 flavor in this dish, i am not exaggerating. the only thing about it was the presentation was great, but other then that, nothing stood out. you get lots of peppers and chicken/shrimp in this dish, but no flavor whatsoever. it literally tasted like someone just dumped an entire can of pepper on noodles, just awful. usually i am not hard to please with food, but if this is one of their more popular dishes, i don&#39;t understand why.<br><br>my fiancé said his gumbo was pretty good, and my sister said her burger was decent. however both me and my cousin who ordered the same as me did NOT like the pasta at all. we all ordered cheesecake slices to go and those were delicious as always, but i definitely will order something different when i come back! and i&#39;m only going to return because i have a gift card, other than that, this place is not worth the long ass wait time!

What a great restaurant for atmosphere! Very busy on a Friday night around 8:30pm, and we had a waitress that seemed to have ample time for us, which should be great, but she didn&#39;t seem to care much. Perhaps she was winding down for quitting time. That was a turn off and could have made this a bad experience if it weren&#39;t for my forgiving nature. My company was my daughter, which made this a 4 star review instead of a 3. Our appetizer came out after our meal, which was ok I suppose, but defeated the purpose. Now for the goods...
